Throughout the course, you will delve into the intricacies of memory exploitation, gaining a deep understanding of memory management in operating systems and the techniques used to manipulate memory to gain unauthorized access or execute arbitrary code. You will learn how to identify and exploit buffer overflow vulnerabilities and you will explore the nuances of stack-based and SEH-based overflow vulnerabilities.

title: System Security & x86 Assembly Fundamentals
description:
This course is designed to equip penetration testers and red teamers with the essential knowledge and skills needed to understand low-level system architecture and exploit memory-related vulnerabilities like Buffer Overflows. It will provide you with the pre-requisite knowledge required to begin your journey in advanced cyber security specializations like reverse engineering, exploit development, and malware analysis.

The course will start by introducing you to CPU architecture, registers, process memory, the stack, and stack frames. You will then delve deep into the inner workings of x86 processors, learn how they work, and how processes are loaded into memory. You will also learn how to write and assemble IA-32 assembly code on Linux. Learning IA-32 assembly language will provide you with a unique insight into the root causes of memory-related vulnerabilities and will provide you with clarity on how they can be exploited. Through practical exercises and hands-on labs, you will emerge from the course with the ability to write x86 Assembly code on Linux and interact with process memory and CPU registers.

title: Privilege Escalation
description:
In this course, you will develop a robust understanding of privilege escalation within both Windows and Linux environments, which is crucial for any effective penetration tester. The curriculum includes a detailed exploration of common vulnerabilities and misconfigurations that can lead to elevated access. Through theoretical instruction, live demonstrations, and practical labs, participants will learn to spot and exploit these security weaknesses in Windows and Linux systems, mastering techniques such as token impersonation, bypassing UAC, and exploiting SUID binaries and misconfigured file permissions.

By the conclusion of this course, you will have the necessary skills to conduct comprehensive privilege escalation assessments, significantly boosting your penetration testing proficiency and aiding organizations in fortifying their security defenses. Ideal for security professionals, penetration testers, and red teamers, this course aims to not only underline the importance of privilege escalation in the testing lifecycle but also to enhance your offensive security expertise and your value as a proficient penetration tester.

title: Network Penetration Testing
description:
Network Penetration Testing is a critical skill for penetration testers and red teamers to master. Designed for experienced penetration testers, this course dives deep into the critical skills and techniques needed to identify and exploit vulnerabilities within complex network environments. This course offers an in-depth exploration of these advanced techniques, providing both theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience through the use of INE’s labs.

Through a series of comprehensive videos and guided lab exercises, you will learn how to perform host discovery, port scanning, and service enumeration using advanced scanning techniques and tools like the Nmap Scripting Engine. You will also learn how to enumerate information from critical network protocols and services in Windows and Linux systems like SMB, NetBIOS, and SMTP to name a few. This course will also introduce you to Man-in-the-Middle (MITM) attacks where you will get an understanding of the principles and techniques behind ARP spoofing, NBT-NS poisoning, and SMB relaying. Finally, you will learn how to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in Windows and Linux systems for initial access and how to perform various post-exploitation tasks on these systems.

title: Command & Control (C2/C&C)
description:
C2 (Command & Control) Frameworks are used by adversaries, APT groups, and red teamers to stealthily control compromised systems during a security assessment or over a long time, in the case of APT Groups.

This course will start by introducing you to Command & Control in the context of red teaming, it will then introduce you to C2 frameworks, and explain how they work and how they are deployed for a plethora of use cases. You will also learn how to select the correct C2 Frameworks to use based on your requirements. We will also cover the process of using popular C2 Frameworks like PowerShell-Empire for Red Team Operations and will also cover the setup and usage of other popular C2 Frameworks to provide you with the knowledge and skills necessary to deploy and operationalize C2 frameworks in your Red Team engagements.

title: Lateral Movement & Pivoting
description:
This course delves into the advanced skills of lateral movement and pivoting, essential for proficient penetration testers and red teamers looking to enhance their post-exploitation techniques. It offers a blend of theoretical insights and practical experience, utilizing INE’s labs for hands-on learning. Participants will master various techniques to traverse systems and networks, including password spraying, Pass-the-Hash attacks, and exploiting misconfigurations across both Windows and Linux platforms, along with learning to circumvent network segmentation using different pivoting methods like SSH tunneling and SOCKS proxies.

By the completion of the training, learners will fully grasp the significance of lateral movement and pivoting within the realms of penetration testing and red team operations. The curriculum is structured to equip students with the ability to identify and apply common tools such as PsExec, WMI, and RDP for lateral movements, and to navigate complex network environments ethically and legally. This course is tailored for experienced penetration testers and red teamers aiming to significantly advance their technical capabilities in post-exploitation scenarios.

title: Introduction to Access Control Models & Methods
description: This comprehensive course delves into the fundamentals and complexities of Access Control Systems, vital for protecting information assets. It covers Access Controls, including asset classification, marking, and data retention policies, and clarifies the roles of data owners, custodians, and system owners. The course categorizes Access Controls into physical, technical, and administrative, alongside preventative, deterrent, detective, and corrective controls. It contrasts mandatory and discretionary controls, introduces Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), its constraints, and hierarchical models, and explores Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC). The course further discusses Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) mechanisms, including Radius, TACACS+, and Diameter, and examines port-based access controls like Port-Security and 802.1x, alongside Network Access Control Lists and segmentation techniques for enhancing security. It also provides an overview of Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) as tools for access control.

title: Cyber Security Fundamentals
description: The Cisco CyberOps Associate certification covers a wide range of topics, from incident response and SOC operations to intrusion analysis and threat hunting. In this first course for the CyperOps Associate learning path, we’ll be taking a look at a brief introduction to some of these topics. To start, you'll learn about what cyber security is and why it’s important for organizations of any size. We’ll follow that up by looking at threats and vulnerabilities, and various systems that can be used to protect an organization from those threats; such as firewalls and intrusion prevention systems. In addition, we'll take a look at advanced malware protection and various options from Cisco to protect an organization’s assets; both on-premise and in the cloud. We’ll wrap everything up with a brief introduction to security operations centers and digital forensics.

title: Client-Side Attacks
description: This course equips penetration testers with the skills necessary to exploit client-side vulnerabilities and gain initial access by targeting employee systems and behaviors, bypassing more secure public-facing servers. You will begin with an overview of client-side attacks, learning to gather information and fingerprint to uncover exploitable client-side configurations. The course delves into social engineering, teaching the principles, various attack methods, and the implementation of phishing campaigns using tools like GoPhish. Additionally, you'll learn to develop and weaponize VBA macros, create macro-enabled MS Office documents, and use ActiveX Controls for macro execution. Advanced techniques will include creating droppers and using HTML Applications in your attacks. Practical training on payload delivery methods like HTML Smuggling will also be covered. Ideal for penetration testers and red teamers, this course combines theoretical knowledge, real-world scenarios, and hands-on lab exercises to proficiently target and exploit the weakest link in an organization’s security—the employees.

title: Implementing Cisco SD-Access with DNA Center
description:
This comprehensive course is designed for network engineers and administrators looking for a hands-on approach to deepen their practical understanding of Cisco's Software-Defined Access (SD-Access) solution, and the Digital Network Architecture (DNA) Center / Catalyst Center management platform.

Participants will begin with an in-depth overview of SD-Access, exploring its components, capabilities, and the problems it solves in modern network environments, as well as the fundamentals of DNA Center / Catalyst Center, providing insights into its architecture, user interface, and integration capabilities. Key foundational concepts such as Network Hierarchy, Network Settings, and the processes of Device Discovery and LAN Automation are thoroughly examined to equip learners with the necessary skills to build and manage Cisco's SD-Access solution in a real-world environment.

Learners will then see how to provision new SD-Access Sites and Virtual Networks, and then dive deep into how the Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) is used for different device functions and their importance within the network. Next, this course guides participants through the SD-Access Host Onboarding process, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of how to integrate and manage devices securely and efficiently. Additionally, practical sessions on detailed verifications of the SD-Access solution provide critical skills for troubleshooting and maintaining the network.

By the end of the course, participants will possess the practical knowledge and skills required to implement, manage, and troubleshoot SD-Access deployments using DNA Center / Catalyst Center, preparing them for effective real-world application of Cisco's SD-Access solution.

title: Cisco Security Automation Solutions
description: This course is an invaluable resource for IT professionals aiming to harness the power of automation across Cisco's security portfolio, including both legacy ASAs and the new Secure Firewall, Umbrella, Secure Endpoint, and ISE. This course provides comprehensive overviews of each security solution, followed by detailed instructions on automating these solutions to ensure a robust, scalable, and efficient security posture. From configuring firewalls to automating threat intelligence and response with Umbrella and Secure Endpoint, to managing access and identity with ISE, participants will gain practical skills and insights into automating and enhancing their organization's security infrastructure. Perfect for security engineers, network administrators, and cybersecurity specialists, this course demystifies the complexity of Cisco security automation, preparing you for the challenges of modern network security management. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Cisco Collaboration Automation Solutions
description: This course is tailored for professionals seeking to master automation within Cisco's suite of collaboration tools, including Call Manager and WebEx. This focused course covers the intricacies of managing Unified Call Manager, Unity Connection, and IM & Presence, leading into how these components can be automated to streamline unified communications. Additionally, the course explores the features of Webex Meetings and delves into automating Webex services to enhance productivity and collaboration efficiency. Ideal for network administrators, communication specialists, and IT managers, this course provides the insights needed to deploy, manage, and automate Cisco's leading collaboration solutions effectively. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Cisco Software Defined Automation Solutions
description: Delve into the world of network automation with the "Cisco Software Defined Automation Solutions" course, a comprehensive guide to automating Cisco's leading enterprise solutions including SD-WAN, NSO, DNAC (Catalyst Center), and Meraki. This course offers a deep dive into setting up and automating Cisco SD-WAN, including service VPNs, policies, and Zero Touch Provisioning (ZTP), alongside practical steps for installing and leveraging Cisco NSO for network services automation. You'll also explore the capabilities of Cisco DNA Center (Catalyst Center) for SD-Access and Assurance, and discover the ease of managing network solutions with Cisco Meraki. Whether you're a network engineer looking to elevate your skills or a professional seeking to implement Cisco's automation solutions, this course provides the knowledge and tools necessary to streamline network operations. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Cisco Data Center Automation Solutions
description: This is an essential course for IT professionals aiming to leverage automation across Cisco's Data Center portfolio, including Nexus switches, ACI, UCS, and Intersight. Beginning with detailed overviews of each technology, the course methodically guides learners through the automation capabilities of Cisco Nexus and ACI, the management and orchestration offered by Cisco UCS, and the cloud-based operations of Cisco Intersight. Moreover, it includes a specialized segment on utilizing Terraform with Cisco Intersight, empowering you to automate infrastructure as code. Ideal for network engineers, system administrators, and cloud architects, this course equips you with the skills to optimize data center operations, ensuring efficiency, scalability, and reliability in the modern IT landscape. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Exploring Cisco IOS Automation
description: This course is designed for network engineers and developers looking to harness the power of automation in managing Cisco network devices. This course walks you through the basics of automating Cisco routers and switches using Python and Ansible, paving the way to more complex topics like RegEx, Unit Testing, and network testing methodologies. Delve into the practical aspects of OnBox automation for IOS-XE, manipulating data without APIs, and mastering YANG models for structured data. You'll also explore the use of NETCONF and RESTCONF protocols on Cisco IOS-XE, debug Python code, and apply Infrastructure as Code principles. With hands-on tutorials on setting up Ansible, creating playbooks, managing credentials, and utilizing Jinja2 templates, you're set to transform your network's efficiency and reliability through automation. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Using DevOps Solutions
description: Embark on a journey to master the nuances of DevOps and modern software development methodologies through our course, "Using DevOps Solutions". This course delves into the heart of DevOps, emphasizing the seamless integration of development and operations to facilitate continuous delivery with a keen eye on security. From the fundamentals of modular design to the complexities of deploying applications across various environments—including bare metal, virtualization, containers, and cloud & edge computing—you'll gain comprehensive knowledge to deploy your applications effectively. Furthermore, the course covers critical security principles, including an overview of OWASP and strategies for scaling and ensuring performance without compromising security. Whether you're aiming to refine your DevOps practices or implement secure deployment strategies, this course provides the expertise you need to navigate the dynamic landscape of software development. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation) Learning Path.

title: Security Architecture & Engineering for CISSP
description: This course delves into the intricacies of security architecture and engineering. It examines the design of security components, processes, services, and controls and how to implement those designs. The major topics covered are design principles, security capabilities, cryptography and physical security. This course covers Domain 3 of the CISSP.

title: Security+ Domain 5: Security Program Management & Oversight
description: CompTIA’s Security+ is a well-known, industry-standard certification that introduces the skills needed to succeed in an entry-level cybersecurity role. In this course we’ll take a look at the fifth domain of knowledge for the Security+ exam - Security Program Management and Oversight. Throughout this course, you’ll learn about the various methods that organizations use to maintain their security programs. We'll look at how organizations can use effective policies, procedures, and standards to build and maintain their security programs, including example policies and procedures that all companies should use. We'll go over how organizations are responsible for knowing and understanding the laws and regulations they are required to follow, and how they can monitor their compliance with those regulations using both internal and external assessments. You'll learn about proper risk management strategies, from identification and assessment of risks through analysis and responding to those risks, and how to manage risks associated with third-party vendors and business partners. We'll wrap up this course by looking at how effective security training for employees can help improve the effectiveness of an organization's security program and how that training needs to be efficiently developed and maintained.

title: Implementing Cisco SD-WAN
description:
The Implementing Cisco SD-WAN course covers the detailed theory and hands-on configuration, verification, & troubleshooting needed to implement Cisco’s SD-WAN solution (formerly Viptela, now Catalyst SD-WAN) outlined in the latest CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure v1.1 exam blueprint.

Topics covered in this course include onboarding Cisco SD-WAN Controllers & SD-WAN Edge Routers, implementing Service VPNs, using CLI, Device, & Feature Templates for managing SD-WAN Edge Routers at scale, implementing SD-WAN Centralized Policies & Localized Policies for filtering, traffic engineering, Direct Internet Access (DIA), isolating Guest Users, Route Leaking, Service Insertion, ACL Filtering, & Security, SD-WAN Quality of Service (QoS) & Application Aware Routing (AAR), SD-WAN Cloud integration, and more.

Whether you’re preparing for the latest CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure written and lab exams or looking for practical knowledge for implementing Cisco SD-WAN in your production environment, this course has you covered!

title: Web Application Penetration Testing
description: This course is designed to equip cybersecurity professionals with essential skills in securing digital assets. It will touch on comprehensive knowledge and practical techniques for identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities within web applications. Through a blend of theoretical insights and demonstration, students will learn the latest methodologies for conducting thorough assessments, including SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and session hijacking. Armed with industry-standard tools and best practices, participants will gain proficiency in analyzing application logic, assessing authentication mechanisms, and crafting robust security solutions.

title: PowerShell for Pentesters
description: This course will focus on the world of PowerShell scripting, looking at the skills used to conduct advanced penetration tests with efficiency and precision. You will explore the capabilities of PowerShell for reconnaissance, exploitation, and post-exploitation activities across diverse Windows environments. From scripting custom payloads to automating attack vectors, and with a focus on ethical hacking principles and defensive strategies, participants will gain proficiency in leveraging PowerShell as a potent tool for identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities.

title: Security+ Domain 4: Security Operations II
description: CompTIA’s Security+ is a well-known, industry-standard certification that introduces the skills needed to succeed in an entry-level cybersecurity role. In this course, we’ll look at the second half of the fourth domain of knowledge for the Security+ exam: Security Operations. Throughout this course, you’ll learn about different methods and tools to effectively secure endpoints and other systems in an organization’s infrastructure. We’ll look at email security methods and tools, including SPF, DKIM, and DMARC, and dive into why web filtering is important and some ways it can be configured. From there, we’ll go into identity and access management processes, such as access control methods, multifactor authentication, and privileged access management. To wrap up this course, you’ll learn about incident response procedures and processes, starting with detection and analysis and going through to eradication and recovery, including digital forensics concepts and methods.

title: Security+ Domain 4: Security Operations I
description: The CompTIA Security+ is an industry-standard, well-recognized certification that covers the skills needed to succeed in a cybersecurity career. In this course, we'll cover the first half of the fourth domain: Security Operations. Starting with security hardening, we'll look at how to secure different types of devices including endpoints, servers, and embedded systems. Moving on from there, you'll learn about wireless security authentication and authorization models and how to properly plan out a wireless infrastructure. Since every network contains vulnerabilities, we'll go over how to properly identify those vulnerabilities as well as some options for responding and remediating them, and what's involved in monitoring and logging those systems to ensure incidents are identified and responded to quickly. To wrap it up, we'll look at various types of network security devices and strategies starting with firewalls and IPS systems, going into network access control and DNS filtering.

title: Building a Home-Based Wi-Fi Lab
description: In this course, you’ll learn how to provision a Cisco 9800-CL Wireless LAN Controller as a virtual machine within Microsoft Azure. Once your virtual machine is running and accessible, you’ll be taught how to upgrade its software (and why that is necessary for a home-based lab).  Finally, you’ll learn how to select and purchase the appropriate wireless Access Points and infrastructure to complete a home-based lab that can fully integrate physical Wi-Fi Access Points with your Azure-based 9800-CL Controller.

title: Traffic Control with Wi-Fi QoS
description: In this course, you will learn about why Wi-Fi QoS is needed and the benefits you can gain from it. Starting with a detailed explanation of the historical DCF process (Distributed Coordination Function) you will learn how EDCA (Enhanced Distributed Channel Access) was introduced in 2016 bringing Wi-Fi QoS to the 802.11 standard. You will learn about how EDCA/WMM works to classify and prioritize data access as well as how it modified the 802.11 Contention Windows and Inter-Frame spaces. You will also gain exposure and experience with configuring various Wi-Fi features such as Rate-Limiting, DSCP marking, AVC, and AutoQoS on Cisco AireOS and 9800 Wireless LAN Controllers.

title: Introduction to Network Automation
description: Dive into the essentials of network automation with our comprehensive course, designed to equip beginners with the fundamental skills necessary for the evolving world of networking. Starting from the ground up, this course guides you through the intricacies of operating systems with a thorough exploration of Linux and Windows, setting a solid foundation for network automation tasks. You'll gain experience with Bash scripting, Git, software repositories, and crucial tools like Postman, alongside understanding REST and various data formats. With a focus on Python programming, you'll learn to manipulate variables, data types, lists, tuples, dictionaries, and control structures, enabling you to automate networking tasks efficiently. Whether you're new to coding or looking to apply your skills in network automation, this course is your first stepping stone to mastering the art and science of network automation. This course is part of the DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation)

title: Asset Security for CISSP
description: In Domain 2, discussions center around protecting organizational assets and, more importantly, how security practitioners must approach them. This includes identifying and classifying assets, data handling, as well as storage and disposal of assets. Also discussed is implementing and enforcing access controls to protect sensitive information. These controls ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all organizational assets, but undoubtedly the focus is on data. Exam topics covered include data classification, ownership, and handling, as well as the enforcement of asset management policies. Understanding the data management lifecycle in combination with the state of the data helps determine appropriate security controls whether physical, logical/technical, or administrative. Finally, data ownership and retention are discussed in depth. The topics covered, provide ample real-world examples to ensure you understand and can apply Asset Security concepts that the CISSP examination will test you on.

title: Security+ Domain 3: Security Architecture
description: The CompTIA Security+ is an industry-standard, well recognized certification that covers the skills needed to succeed in a cybersecurity career. In this course, we'll go over the third domain of topics covered in the exam: Security Architecture. We'll start by taking a look at what makes up an organization's IT systems, the various architectures that are available, and then infrastructure that they consist of. We'll look at cloud-based technologies as well as on-premise systems, virtualization and embedded systems, plus what sort of considerations should go into the selection and securing processes. In addition, you'll learn about various data types and how they can be classified and some of the options for properly securing and protecting an organization's data. Since no systems can have 100% uptime, we'll wrap up this course by discussing options for deploying and configuring a resilient architecture to ensure business operations can continue in the event of systems failures or disasters.

title: Cisco ACI Foundations & Core Concepts
description: This course introduces Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) v5 and builds the foundation for understanding its architecture, initialization, and management. You’ll explore ACI system components, fabric discovery, and policy models, along with how to configure tenants, access policies, and virtual port channels. The course also covers automation with Postman and APIC APIs, giving you the skills to simplify management and streamline deployment. By the end, you’ll be prepared to configure and manage core ACI features effectively in enterprise environments.

title: Security+ Domain 2: Threats, Vulnerabilities & Mitigations
description: The CompTIA Security+ is an industry-standard, well-recognized certification that covers the skills needed to succeed in a cybersecurity career. In this course, we'll go over the second domain of topics covered in the exam: Threats, Vulnerabilities, and Mitigations. We'll start by taking a look at the various types of threat actors and attackers, and some of their various motivations. In addition, you'll learn about various attack surfaces and threat vectors and some methods to protect them. We'll cover several different types of vulnerabilities from application vulnerabilities to hardware and physical ones, in addition to the multiple types of attacks that can target these various vulnerabilities. To wrap up this second domain, you'll learn about how to spot possible malicious activity, and how to introduce some mitigations and hardening techniques to better protect an organization's infrastructure.

title: Security & Risk Management for CISSP
description: The first domain of CISSP covers Security and Risk Management. This course will get you up to speed on all of the key concepts related to that topic, including the CIA triad, risk management concepts, threat modeling, and third party risk. We will also delve into organization governance and compliance as well as the laws and regulations that govern international technology.

title: Security+ Domain 1: General Security Concepts
description: The CompTIA Security+ is an industry-standard, well recognized certification that covers the skills needed to succeed in a cybersecurity career. In this course, covering the first knowledge domain - General Security Concepts, you'll learn about fundamental security controls and the various types of controls that can be used. In addition, we'll go over topics related to zero trust infrastructure, identity and account management, and various cryptography concepts. You'll learn about why change management is important in an organization, and the various parts of a successful change management program. We'll wrap up this first domain looking at PKI environments, and the various ways encryption can be used to support an organization's confidentiality and integrity needs.

title: Assessment Methodologies: Footprinting & Scanning
description:
In the realm of penetration testing, Network Scanning & Footprinting stands as a crucial phase, wielding significant influence over the test's success. This process involves identifying hosts, scanning for open ports, and discerning services and operating systems—a skill pivotal for the subsequent exploitation phase. To master these techniques, a foundational understanding of networks and protocols is imperative. This comprehensive course begins by introducing Networking and the OSI model, progressing to the Network and Transport Layers, covering key protocols like TCP/IP, ICMP, and UDP.

Armed with this knowledge, participants delve into practical applications with Nmap, the industry-standard tool for network mapping. From host discovery to in-depth port scanning using techniques like TCP SYN and UDP scanning, learners gain proficiency in identifying live hosts and open ports. Geared towards penetration testers, cybersecurity professionals, network administrators, and enthusiasts, this immersive journey equips individuals to harness Nmap effectively for penetration tests and security assessments, fostering expertise in the field.

title: Understanding the Precision Time Protocol
description: Time synchronization between device clocks is becoming more and more critical in the modern world. For the Network Engineer, understanding protocols that facilitate clock synchronization has moved beyond NTP which was typically used to provide accurate timestamps to SYSLOG and debugging messages. Now, Network Engineers building and maintaining networks connected to industrial and robotics devices, and even Cellular backhaul networks, have to synchronize with those device down to the nanosecond level. This is where the Precision Time Protocol has a role to play. This course will familiarize you with PTP, all of its relevant terminology, clock types and synchronization processes.

title: QOS for Cisco Collaboration
description: This course covers Quality of Service. This course teaches you about QOS Mechanisms, Methods and Models, Congestion Avoidance, and Congestion Management Mechanisms.

title: Mastering Collaboration Applications
description: This course covers Collaboration Applications required when building the Collaboration Infrastructure. This course teaches you about Configuring Unity Connection using SIP, Configuring Unity Connection using SCCP, Cisco Unity Connection Call Handlers, and the Webex App.

title: Call Control Tactics
description: This course covers Call Control required when building the dial plan and preventing toll fraud. In this course, you will learn about Understanding the Need for Globalized Call Routing, Implementing Globalized Call Routing with CUCM, Configuring COR to Prevent Toll Fraud on Voice Gateways, Configuring Forced Authorization Codes in CUCM, Configuring Client Matter Codes in CUCM, Configuring Time of Day Routing in CUCM, Understanding Expressway MRA Solution, Configuring MRA, and Overview of Webex Calling.

title: Implementing IOS Gateways & Media Resources
description: This course covers the IOS Gateways, and Media Resources required when building the dial plan. In this course, you will learn about H.323 Trunks, Gatekeepers and Gateways, Introduction to MGCP, Introduction to CUBE, Configuring SIP Trunks to CUBE, Voice Translation Rules and Voice Translation Profiles, Partitions and Calling Search Spaces, Outbound calls to Emergency services, Outbound calls to Local and National Numbers, Outbound calls to International Numbers, Media Resources, and Using Media Resources with CUCM.

title: Dial Plan Elements in Action
description: This course covers the critical elements required when building the dial plan. In this course, you will learn about the need for device pools, configuring device pools, interdigit timeouts, translation patterns, external phone number masks, alternate numbers, ILS, route lists, route groups, and configuring inter-site SIP trunks.

title: Collaboration Solutions: IM&P, Protocols, Codecs & Endpoints
description: This course covers the critical elements in the design for implementing the Cisco Collaboration Solution. Here in this course, you will learn about Jabber logins, Phone registrations, Audio Codecs, Video Codecs, Regions, IP Phone boot process, Call setup and Call teardown process, Call signaling protocols, and verifying the SIP messages.

title: Infrastructure & Design for Collaboration
description: This course covers the critical elements in the design for implementing the Cisco Collaboration Solution. In this course, you will learn about Cisco Collaboration Infrastructure, Cisco Collaboration Deployment Models, Cisco Collaboration Deployment Factors, NTP, DHCP, TFTP, Access VLANs, Voice VLANs, CDP, LLDP, DNS Records, LDAP with CUCM, Webex Control Hub and Expressways.

title: Final Lab Practice for CCNP CLCOR
description: Welcome to the immersive and dynamic learning experience of CLCOR Labs! This course is designed to take your theoretical knowledge to the next level by providing a hands-on, practical approach to learning. Through carefully crafted labs, you can apply and reinforce the concepts covered in lectures, enhancing your understanding and proficiency in CLCOR.

title: BGP for the Enterprise
description: As Enterprise, Government and Campus networks grow, it becomes increasingly necessary to implement the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP). BGP might be required due to scalability concerns, multihoming requirements or simply a desire to have more control over routing. One might even require BGP on only a single router connecting to an ISP or Cloud Provider. Regardless of the reason, an in-depth knowledge of BGP is critical for Network Engineers working within these types of networks. This course provides details of BGP, starting with the problems it was designed to solve and how it is different than Interior Gateway Protocols. You will then proceed onto learning about iBGP and eBGP differences, BGP Path Attributes, the BGP Best Path Selection Algorithm, Filtering, Summarize, Communities, BGP Security…and a whole lot more. This course is your one-stop-shop to learn everything necessary to implement BGP for the Enterprise.

title: Defensive Security Concepts
description: We live in a world where every click, keystroke, and log-on is a potential battleground. Are you ready to take the helm and protect what matters most? This course will transform you into a digital guardian by exploring foundational cyber security defensive topics, including the CIA triad, defense-in-depth strategy, access control models, the CVSS scoring system, the 5-tuple approach, and more.

title: Email Security Management & Strategy
description:
Email is one of the most common forms of electronic communication for businesses, but it is also one of the most abused by malicious threat actors. For those reasons, organizations must understand how to effectively secure their email infrastructures, in addition to training their users to recognize suspicious or malicious messages.

In this course, we'll go over why email security is critically important with some examples of how email has been abused over the years. We'll discuss what type of email filtering systems should be in place and what they should look for. In addition, we'll demonstrate how to set up SPF, DKIM, and DMARC to attempt to properly identify phishing messages. Organizations always have data that must stay private, so we'll take a look at encryption methods and techniques as well.

title: Active Directory Security Configuration & Management
description: Active Directory is the central piece of most organizations' identity and authentication infrastructure. Properly securing it from attackers is a critical step in protecting your organization from a costly compromise. From the basics of an AD structure, to specific Group Policy settings to restrict authentication types, this course will take you through the necessary steps to properly secure your AD infrastructure. You'll learn about the most common types of attacks against Active Directory systems, as well as how to protect against them. In addition, we'll cover some of the common misconfigurations you may encounter when working with AD and how to correct those configurations to be more secure. To wrap it up, we'll take a look at best practices for monitoring and logging Active Directory, and some high priority Event IDs that should be monitored.

title: Authentication, Authorization, & Identity Engineering
description: Anyone who uses a computer on a daily basis needs to have an account. For organizations of any size, those accounts need to be properly secured and managed using a well-designed identity management program. This course will go into detail about various authentication types and authorization mechanisms that are used to grant needed access to an organization's resources. In addition, we'll look at how to securely set up and identity management system - from creation of accounts, to integrating with other systems, all the way through logging and monitoring. We'll also go over the identity and access management lifecycle, and how it plays a critical part in securing the authentication and authorization systems for any organization.

title: Actionable Information from Aggregated Log Data
description: A centralized logging system is only one part of a complete logging infrastructure.  In order to properly protect an IT infrastructure from malicious actors, useful information needs to be extracted from that log data.  Throughout this course, we will examine various logging formats and sources, and how proper aggregation and correlation strategies can help pull that actionable intelligence that is required for proper countermeasure construction.  In addition, we'll look at various tools that can be used throughout the process and the importance of continuous monitoring of not only logs and alerts, but also countermeasure effectiveness.

title: Web Application Security Testing: Web Service Security Testing
description:
In the complex world of web applications, web services play a pivotal role in enabling the seamless exchange of data and functionality between applications over the internet. Web services, particularly those built using the SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol) framework, have become essential components of modern web applications. However, the convenience they offer comes with inherent security challenges that demand expert attention.

In this course you will uncover the core principles of web application service security testing with a specialized focus on SOAP-based web services. This course will dive deep into the world of web services, the backbone of modern applications, enabling seamless data exchange and functionality sharing across the digital landscape.

It will explore the critical security vulnerabilities that threaten these services, including SQL Injection, Command Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). This course will provide you with hands-on experience in identifying, assessing, and exploiting these vulnerabilities and will equip  you with essential skills required to test web applications and their underlying SOAP-based web services in an ever-evolving cyber threat landscape.

title: Cloud Security Principles
description: Cloud Security Principles is the first course of a learning path that’s designed to empower beginners to protect cloud deployments from evolving cyber threats and contribute to enhancing overall cloud security posture. The course begins by introducing the fundamentals of cloud defensive security, highlighting the unique challenges and considerations associated with securing cloud environments, as well as the Shared Responsibility Model. Next, the course will cover common cloud vulnerabilities identified by the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP), which students will learn how to mitigate. Students will also learn about frameworks and models that provide a structured approach to proactively securing cloud environments from advanced cyber attacks. Finally, the course concludes with an overview of the NIST incident response life cycle. By the end of this course, students will have a solid understanding of cloud defensive security concepts, be able to identify common cloud vulnerabilities, understand the stages of the Cyber Kill Chain and the MITRE Adversarial Tactics, Techniques, and Common Knowledge (ATT&CK) Cloud Matrix, create cloud attack graphs, understand defense-in-depth strategies, and recognize the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) incident response life cycle.

title: Prescribe Security Controls
description:
The "Prescribing Security Controls in AWS" is an on-demand course designed to provide knowledge and practical skills necessary to excel in the AWS Solutions Architect Professional certification exam (SAP-C02) with a specific focus on security controls. This course offers a deep dive into foundational security concepts and equips learners with the expertise to design secure and compliant architectures on the AWS platform.

Throughout the course, participants will explore various essential topics, including security control foundations, AWS Organizations, AWS Control Tower, AWS Security Hub, and AWS IAM Access Analyzer. By gaining a thorough understanding of these crucial elements, learners will be able to prescribe robust security controls that safeguard AWS resources, applications, and data.

To ensure comprehensive coverage of the material, the course also includes prescribed whitepaper reviews. Learners will be guided to review key whitepapers, enabling them to expand their knowledge and stay updated on the latest security best practices and guidelines endorsed by AWS.

title: Web Application Security Testing: CMS Security Testing
description:
In the world of modern, ever-evolving web applications, Content Management Systems (CMS) are the backbone of countless websites, with WordPress being one of the most widely used Content Management Systems. However, the ubiquity of WordPress also makes it a prime target for cyberattacks given its market share. This course is designed to equip security professionals, web application pentesters, and developers with the skills and knowledge needed to identify, assess, exploit and mitigate security vulnerabilities in WordPress websites.

This course will start off by introducing you to the CMS Security Testing process and will provide you with a comprehensive methodology that you can use as a guide to thoroughly test CMSs for common vulnerabilities and misconfigurations. This course will then introduce you to WordPress and will outline the process of performing information gathering and enumeration on a WordPress site both manually and automatically. The information obtained from this enumeration phase will set the stage for the next phases set to follow.

You will then learn  how to put to use the information gathered in the enumeration phase by learning how to perform a vulnerability scan on a WordPress site in order to identify vulnerabilities in themes and plugins. Armed with this knowledge, you will then learn how to exploit vulnerabilities identified in themes and plugins. This course also covers the process of performing various types of authentication attacks that will involve enumerating user accounts on a WordPress site, and will demonstrate how to utilize these usernames to perform a brute force attack to obtain valid login credentials.

title: Web Application Security Testing: Testing for Common Attacks
description:
The ability to thoroughly assess and test a web application for common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities will mark you out as a good web application penetration tester. Common attacks and vulnerabilities usually get overlooked by web application penetration testers, and as a result, these vulnerabilities are missed during assessments or pentests. It is imperative to factor common vulnerabilities into a penetration test to ensure that a client or organization has a strong foundation to build on.

This course is designed to equip you with the knowledge and skills needed to identify and exploit common misconfigurations and vulnerabilities in web applications. This course will delve deep into the intricacies of HTTP method tampering, attacking basic HTTP authentication, HTTP digest authentication, session hijacking, and Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) to provide you with the knowledge and skills required to operate effectively as a web app pentester and improve your ability to perform thorough and comprehensive web application security testing.

title: Web Application Penetration Testing: File & Resource Attacks
description:
In the ever-evolving landscape of web application security, it's essential to stay ahead of the curve when it comes to protecting your web applications from potential threats. This comprehensive course delves deep into the critical aspects of file upload, directory traversal, Local File Inclusion (LFI), and Remote File Inclusion (RFI) vulnerabilities. This course is designed for cybersecurity professionals, web application penetration testers, and anyone interested in web application security testing. It focuses on file and resource-based vulnerabilities commonly encountered in modern web applications. It will also give you practical knowledge and hands-on experience in identifying, exploiting, and mitigating vulnerabilities related to file and resource handling in web applications.

This course will start by introducing you to Arbitrary File Upload vulnerabilities and will teach you how to identify and exploit these vulnerabilities for remote code execution (RCE). You will also get an introduction to Directory Traversal vulnerabilities, and you will get an insight into what causes Directory Traversal vulnerabilities and how they can be identified and exploited. The course will then close off by covering inclusion vulnerabilities, specifically Local File Inclusion (LFI) and Remote File Inclusion (RFI).

title: Web Application Security Testing: Encoding, Filtering & Evasion Basics
description:
In the ever evolving  world of cybersecurity, web applications continue to be prime targets for cyberattacks. To effectively attack and defend against these threats and vulnerabilities, you need to go beyond the basics of standard web application penetration testing.

This course is designed to take your web app penetration testing expertise to the next level by focusing on three essential aspects of web application security testing that frequently get overlooked: encoding, filtering, and evasion. In order to understand how to analyze and assess a web applications for vulnerabilities, you need to understand how web application developers implement encoding, input filtering and security mechanisms like WAFs (Web Application Firewalls) for improved security.

This course will start off by introducing you to the practice of characterset encoding, URL encoding, HTML encoding and Base64 encoding and will explain how and why these encoding techniques are utilized in web applications. You will then be introduced to the process of server-side and client-side input filtering, where you will get a tacit understanding of the different types of input filtering techniques used to prevent vulnerabilities like XSS, SQL Injection and command injection. The course will then outline how these filtering techniques can be bypassed through manual and automated techniques. Finally, this course will introduce you to WAFs (Web Application Firewalls), Proxies and server-side IDSs (Intrusion Detection Systems). You will learn about how they work, how they can be identified and how they can be bypassed.

title: Azure Advanced Identity & Access Management
description: This INE on-demand course is for cloud professionals responsible for managing and protecting identities in Azure AD and managing access to Azure resources. The course covers creating and managing Azure AD users and groups, protecting Azure AD users, managing service principals, and managing Azure AD applications. The course also covers controlling access to Azure resources through the use of roles and policies. The course explains several security tools available for Azure AD tenants and Azure subscriptions. This course is aligned with the AZ-500 certification exam and is a useful resource for anyone preparing for that exam.

title: Introduction to Web Application Security Testing
description:
In today's digital age, web applications have become an integral part of our daily lives, enabling us to perform various tasks online, from shopping and banking to communication and entertainment. However, with the increasing reliance on web applications, the importance of web application security has never been more critical. Web application security testing is a process that involves evaluating and assessing the security of web applications to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses that could be exploited by attackers.

The "Introduction to Web Application Security Testing" course is a comprehensive and hands-on course designed to introduce you to the Web Application Security Testing process and underscores the critical role of security testing in the realm of web applications. It will provide you with a solid understanding of essential web application security concepts and practices, including common attack vectors, security risks, and the importance of secure coding practices. This serves as an excellent starting point for individuals interested in pursuing a career in web application security testing or for professionals seeking to enhance their understanding of web application security.

title: Final Lab Practice for CCIE Service Provider
description: This course is the last step in your preparation for achieving the prestigious CCIE Service Provider certification. This lab-oriented course consists of lab tasks focusing on technologies like OSPF, IS-IS, MPLS, Segment Routing, Intra-AS L3VPN, Inter-AS L3VPN Option-A, Inter-AS L3VPN Option-B, Inter-AS L3VPN Option-C, Carrier Supporting Carrier, EVPN, L2VPN, Unified MPLS, Multicast, and Network Services Orchestrator (NSO). All labs are accompanied by solutions to help you understand the right way of configuring the requirements.

title: Web Application Penetration Testing: SQL Injection Attacks
description:
SQL Injection is one of the most commonly exploited injection vulnerabilities in web applications and poses a serious security risk to organizations. As a web application pentester or bug bounty hunter, it is vitally important to understand what causes SQL Injection vulnerabilities, how they can be identified, and how they can be exploited. The ability for attackers to run arbitrary queries against vulnerable systems can result in data exposure, modification, and in some cases, entire system compromise. SQL Injection vulnerabilities are often misunderstood and overlooked by developers primarily due to a lack of knowledge on how SQL queries can be weaponized by attackers.

This course will take you through everything from introducing you to SQL Injection, explaining the difference between In-Band, Blind, and Out-of-band SQLi, and will show you how to identify and exploit SQL Injection vulnerabilities in web applications through a mix of both manual and automated techniques.

title: Web Application Penetration Testing: XSS Attacks
description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) is one of the most commonly exploited vulnerabilities in web applications. As a web application pentester or bug bounty hunter, it is vitally important to understand what causes XSS vulnerabilities, how they can be identified, and how they can be exploited.

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities are often misunderstood and overlooked by developers primarily due to a lack of knowledge on how Javascript can be weaponized by attackers.

This course will introduce you to Cross-site scripting, explain the difference between Stored, Reflected, and DOM-Based XSS, and will show you how to identify and exploit XSS vulnerabilities in web applications through a mix of both manual and automated techniques.

title: WAPT: Web Proxies and Web Information Gathering
description:
Testing and modifying web requests being sent to web servers or web applications make up the majority of Web Application Penetration Testing. In order to intercept and modify the requests being sent between browsers and web applications we need to utilize Web Proxies.

Web Proxies like Burp Suite and OWASP ZAP play a vital role in web application penetration testing and are pivotal in identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities in web applications.

Web Proxies make the process of intercepting and replaying web requests much more efficient. As a result, web proxies are considered among the most important tools for any web app pentester.

 This course will introduce you to web proxies like OWASP ZAP & Burp Suite and will cover the process of utilizing these web proxies in order to identify and exploit common vulnerabilities or misconfigurations in web applications. The goal of this course is to get you comfortable with using both OWASP ZAP and Burp Suite for web app pentesting.

title: Implementing Check Point Firewall Advanced - Part II
description: As cyber-attacks become increasingly evasive, more controls are added, making security more complicated and tedious to the point that user workflows are affected. Not any longer with Check Point. Check Point provides customers of all sizes with the latest data and network security protection in an integrated next-generation threat prevention platform, reducing complexity and lowering the total cost of ownership. In this course, you will learn how to deploy common types of supported Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) and how to monitor system activities using SmartEvent.

title: Implementing Check Point Firewall Advanced - Part I
description: As cyber-attacks become increasingly evasive, more controls are added, making security more complicated and tedious to the point that user workflows are affected. Not any longer with Check Point. Check Point provides customers of all sizes with the latest data and network security protection in an integrated next-generation threat prevention platform, reducing complexity and lowering the total cost of ownership. In this course, you will learn how to optimize system performance and ensure high availability of the management and policy enforcement platforms.

title: Architect Network Connectivity Strategies
description:
Welcome to the Architecting network solutions course explicitly designed for individuals preparing to take the AWS Solutions Architect Professional certification test. This course focuses on crucial networking concepts and technologies within the Amazon Web Services (AWS) ecosystem. Throughout this course, you will delve into networking topics, gaining a deep understanding of how to design, implement, and manage networking solutions in AWS. By the end of the course, you will gain the knowledge and skills necessary in the networking aspects of the AWS Solutions Architect Professional certification.

At the end of the course, you will engage in a hands-on exercise, based on a real-world scenario and practical example questions that will reinforce your understanding of the topics covered. By the end of the course, you will have the confidence and knowledge to design and implement networking solutions in AWS that align with best practices and meet the requirements of the AWS Solutions Architect Professional certification exam.

Join us on this exciting journey to become a skilled AWS Solutions Architect Professional with a solid foundation in networking within the AWS environment and take your AWS networking skills to new heights!

title: Cloud Service Models & Connectivity
description: Because of its resiliency, global availability, and elasticity, many companies have decided to move some or most of their data storage, applications, and servers into the cloud. As a Network Design Engineer for Enterprise networks, you’ll need to know your various options for connecting on-premise data centers and networks to the cloud, and that’s what this course covers. Starting with a brief introduction to the Cloud and Cloud Service Models, you'll then learn about the two primary methods of connecting to the Cloud…Internet-based VPNs and Direct Connect. You’ll then be exposed to a feature of SD-WAN called “Cloud OnRamp” and how that feature (paired with SD-WAN) can help automate and simplify cloud connectivity. For any engineer working for a company with a presence in the Cloud…this course is for you!

title: WAN Technology Overview & Design Principles
description: As an Enterprise Networking Design Engineer (or one who aspires to that role), you need to be aware of a variety of WAN technologies as well as their relative strengths and weaknesses. Without this knowledge, you would be unable to make informed choices about connecting your offices via WANs. This course was created to assist you with that goal. In this course (structured around Cisco’s CCNP Enterprise Design certification [ENSLD]), you will become exposed to a great variety of WAN technologies such as Optical WANs (SONET, DWDM, CWDM and more), MPLS, Metro Ethernet, Mobile Wireless WANs and more. You’ll be able to compare and contrast these WAN types, differentiate between different types of VPN models, as well as learn helpful tips related to selecting and designing WANs.

title: Implementing Arista EOS for Cisco Engineers
description: Implementing Arista EOS for Cisco Engineers is a course targeted at professional-level network engineers who are familiar with implementing standards-based networking protocols on Cisco IOS, IOS XR, and/or NX-OS, and want to quickly learn how to deploy networks on switches running Arista EOS. This course explores the nuances of the Arista EOS command-line interface (CLI) and APIs, in addition to protocols such as Ethernet Switching, Multi-Chassis Link Aggregation (MLAG), OSPF, IS-IS IGP Routing, BGP Routing, BFD, VXLAN, BGP EVPN, MPLS, and Segment Routing, among others. A CCNP-level of knowledge in these topic areas is recommended for this course as it mainly focuses on implementation and not background theory.

title: DevSecOps Bootcamp
description:
In today’s world of continuous integration and continuous delivery, it has become imperative to involve security checks at every step of the process. The automation of build, deployment, and setup preparation processes using DevOps process as well as automating code review, security scanning, security testing, and vulnerability management using DevSecOps processes improves the quality and security posture of the project while decreasing the chances of human error and overall delivery timeline. Hence, knowledge of DevSecOps has become an essential skill for system administrators, security professionals, and DevOps professionals.

This bootcamp starts with DevOps basics and covers building blocks/components used to create a DevOps pipeline. Then we learn about security integration in different phases to convert a DevOps pipeline into a DevSecOps pipeline. We will then learn to design and implement a DevOps pipeline end-to-end using threat modeling to identify the threats, plan security measures, and integrate security tools/scanners into the pipeline. In the last session, the attendees will learn to use publicly available CI/CD setups like GitLab for creating a DevSecOps pipeline. At the end of this bootcamp, you will have job-ready skills to begin your journey as a DevSecOps Professional.

title: WiFi Pentesting Bootcamp
description:
WiFi networks are widely used and they’re getting better all the time. To stay relevant as a security professional, you need an in-depth understanding of WiFi security and the ability to audit a WiFi network.

In this bootcamp, you will learn WiFi protocol basics, security standards, limitations, and attacks. At the end of this bootcamp, you will have job-ready skills to begin your journey as a WiFi pentester.

title: Container Security Bootcamp
description:
Though Linux Containers have existed for nearly twenty years, Docker-backed adoption has ensured that containers are now being used in almost all stages of software production, including development, testing, and deployment. The flexibility to develop and share applications using Docker and to deploy them at scale using Kubernetes is widely used in the software industry. This makes a sound understanding of container security a vital skill for every security professional.

In this bootcamp, we start with container basics and cover various attack techniques such as container breakouts, privilege escalation, host system compromise, malicious image creation, and cross-container attacks. The learning focus then shifts to securing the different components of this ecosystem and discussing industry best practices. At the end of this bootcamp, you will have the job-ready skills to begin your journey as a Container Security Professional.

title: Webapp Security Bootcamp
description:
With the ubiquity of web applications, understanding their security and being able to audit them is a critical skill all security professionals should possess.

In this beginner bootcamp, we will take you through the basics of modern web applications, their architectures, essential components, and common deployment scenarios on servers and in the cloud. This ensures that at the end of this bootcamp you will have job-ready skills to begin your journey as a junior web application pentester.

title: AWS Cloud Security Bootcamp
description:
Enterprises are increasingly running their IT and application infrastructure natively in the cloud. This fundamentally changes security models and the enterprise threatscape. It’s important that as a security professional you are able to pentest these cloud-native deployments and help secure organizations.

This hands-on bootcamp teaches you the security basics of the five most popular cloud-native components on AWS. You will learn how to discover vulnerabilities and propose security fixes in applications and infrastructure leveraging AWS IAM, API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB and S3. Completing the bootcamp and passing the certification exam will prepare you for pentesting production cloud deployments in AWS.

title: Linux Privilege Escalation Bootcamp
description:
Linux powers the Internet today, making it a favorite target for attackers. Linux security mechanisms are fairly comprehensive when it comes to coverage, but they are also equally complex to get right unless you are an expert. As Linux offers multi-user tenancy, the common perception is that it is impossible to escalate privileges to root.

The focus of this bootcamp is to familiarize you with beginner-to-advanced privilege escalation techniques on Linux. You will learn to identify and leverage misconfigurations to perform horizontal/vertical escalation. The bootcamp will cover techniques starting from traditional privilege escalation methodologies to advanced concepts such as Linux capabilities. Completing the bootcamp and passing the certification exam will prepare you for performing privilege escalation effectively on Linux-based machines.

title: Managing Check Point Firewalls
description: As cyber-attacks become increasingly evasive, more controls are added, making security more complicated and tedious to the point that user workflows are affected. Not any longer with Check Point. Check Point provides customers of all sizes with the latest data and network security protection in an integrated next-generation threat prevention platform, reducing complexity and lowering the total cost of ownership. In this course, you will learn how to control traffic with policies, enable NAT and enhance inspections with some of the Check Point's advanced security engines.

title: Check Point Firewall Fundamentals
description: As cyber-attacks become increasingly evasive, more controls are added, making security more complicated and tedious to the point that user workflows are affected. Not any longer with Check Point. Check Point provides customers of all sizes with the latest data and network security protection in an integrated next-generation threat prevention platform, reducing complexity and lowering the total cost of ownership. This course will help you start your journey with Check Point Firewalls and guide you through the product installation and initial deployment.

title: AWS CLI
description: The AWS Command Line Interface, or CLI, is a powerful tool that enables you to manage AWS resources and services from the command line. The course will teach you how to use the AWS CLI effectively and efficiently, so you can streamline your workflows and automate your AWS-based operations. By mastering the basics of the AWS CLI, you will gain the fundamental knowledge required to manage and monitor AWS resources efficiently. You will also be able to begin determining how to deploy complex infrastructure more streamlined and automated manner. Whether you are an experienced AWS user or just starting with cloud computing, the INE AWS CLI course provides the basic knowledge and skills to master the AWS CLI and take your AWS-based operations to the next level. So let's start your journey to becoming an expert in AWS today!

title: Azure Compute Services
description: This INE on-demand course is intended for IT professionals responsible for managing Azure compute resources and those preparing for the AZ-104 exam. This course covers deploying, managing, and scaling virtual machines; provisioning and managing Azure web apps; and managing container solutions with Azure container instances, Azure Container Services, and Azure Kubernetes services.

title: AZ-104 Exam Overview
description: Attaining Microsoft's Certified Azure Administrator Associate certification requires passing the AZ-104 exam. This course is an overview of the Microsoft AZ-104 exam and reflects the author's experience taking the exam. The course highlights areas that students need to focus on while studying for the exam, as well as recommendations for taking the exam itself.

title: Design Principles for IPv4 & IPv6 Addressing
description: Whether studying for a network design-related exam or preparing to design a new network for your company, knowing how to formulate a logical IP addressing plan (for IPv4 or IPv6) is critical. This course will lay out for you the steps one should take from doing an initial evaluation of your network up to how to logically implement IPv4 and IPv6 prefixes within that network. You'll learn about NAT best practices, how contiguous prefix allocation facilitates address summarization, how RFC1918 addressing space is your best option for IPv4 implementation, and where IPv6 prefixes can be purchased. This course will teach you everything you need to know so you are fully prepared to come up with the best IPv4 or IPv6 addressing design possible.

title: Practical Design for Enterprise IP Routing
description: You've taken the time to learn how to configure, implement and troubleshoot your favorite routing protocol. Perhaps it's EIGRP or OSPF. Maybe you're a BGP configuration expert. But do you know the best practices and guidelines to design an Enterprise network with these protocols such that they can scale and be secure? This course will take you to the next level in your Network Engineering journey by going over the best practices and design guidelines for EIGRP, OSPF, IS-IS, BGP, and Route Redistribution for Enterprise networks. You'll learn how to implement a routing protocol in such a way that it can grow as your network grows. You'll learn how to secure your protocols against rogue routers or malicious intent. You'll learn how to add BGP to an Enterprise network that has grown beyond the capabilities of its IGP and much, much more.

title: Final Lab Practice for CCIE Security
description:
This course is the last step in your preparation for achieving the prestigious CCIE certification. This lab-oriented course comprises 30+ labs and 50+ tasks focusing on technologies like ASA, VPNs, FTD/FMC, WSA, ISE, and StealthWatch.

Solution videos accompany each LAB to help you understand why, when, and how you do things in the lab exam.

title: Windows System Programming: Security
description: In this course, we will start with fundamental concepts in Windows security, followed by learning how to work with security IDs and access tokens. Finally, we will look at how to secure kernel objects.

title: Windows System Programming: Memory Management
description: This course focuses on the fundamentals of memory management. We will learn how to use Windows API to interact with and manipulate memory. Once we have covered the fundamentals we will look at memory-mapped files, which is a very powerful feature of Windows for working with memory.

title: Windows System Programming: Processes and Threads
description: This course focuses on threads and processes. We will learn everything about processes, jobs, and threads. At the end of the course, we will look at creating multiple threads applications with Windows API.

title: Windows Kernel Programming: Fundamentals
description: In this course, we will learn the fundamentals of Windows kernel programming. We will start with I/O systems and learn how to write simple device drivers. We will also take a look at the I/O request packet to write more complex drivers.

title: Windows Kernel Programming: Processes and Threads Monitoring
description: In this course, we will start with general kernel programming techniques and then take a look at various notifications supported by the kernel. In the last module, we will cover how to build a process and thread monitoring driver and client.

title: Cisco Telemetry Concepts: Overview & Design
description: A foundation of network management is the ability to retrieve statistical data from your networking devices so that you can establish baselines and trends, and hopefully identify problems before they become critical. Historically this has been done using a "Pull" model which involved pulling the data via commands or SNMP from your devices. Telemetry provides the same (if not more detailed) data using a "Push" model in which telemetry subscriptions cause your networking devices to push relevant data to you. This course reviews some of the foundational elements required for telemetry to work (such as APIs, NETCONF and YANG) and then introduces you to the concepts and terminology behind model-driven telemetry. You will also see a lab demonstration of creating a dynamic, dial-in telemetry subscription and even have lab opportunities to experience for yourself what it is like to create dial-in and dial-out telemetry subscriptions!

title: Management & Governance of AWS Environments
description: As businesses and enterprises grow, they must be able to manage the security and compliance of their AWS accounts at scale. In this course, you’ll learn about the services you can use to build compliant, multi-AWS account environments and the different types of security controls that you can implement. You’ll also learn about services that can help you manage corporate user access to AWS accounts and applications, as well as provision and manage resources and licenses and create cost-optimized architectures on AWS.

title: Azure Resource Monitoring & Protection for Administrators
description: This INE on-demand course is intended for IT professionals who monitor and protect Azure resources, as well as those preparing for the AZ-104 exam. This course focuses on resource monitoring solutions and recovery services. monitoring topics include resource diagnostics, alerts, Azure Monitor, log analytics, and Application Insights. Resource protection topics include recovery services, file and folder backup, virtual machine backup, and backup reports.

title: AWS Serverless Solutions
description: One of the best features of the cloud is serverless functionality. Whether it is serverless databases, serverless code execution, or serverless event handling, there is almost no need that the cloud doesn't have a serverless option. And that's especially true for AWS!In Serverless for AWS, we dive into the core serverless services available from AWS. You'll start with Lambda, including best practices and how to implement functions with infrastructure as code (IaC). Then you dive into learning about Event Bridge, including how to use it to schedule calls to Lambda. From there, you study the Simple Notification Service and Simple Queue service. After that, you finish the tour of the major serverless services with the API Gateway. But this is more than just a theory and lecture series; you'll also build using serverless services. By the end of the course, you will have a complete system for monitoring the availability of websites that require monitoring. So if you get a solid understanding of the core serverless services in AWS, this is the course for you. Dive in today, and let's start building!

title: Web Application Penetration Testing: Web Fingerprinting and Enumeration
description: Information gathering is the first step of any penetration test and is arguably the most important as all other phases rely on the information obtained about the target during the information gathering phase. This course will introduce you to web enumeration and information gathering and will cover the process of performing both passive and active information gathering on websites and web applications by leveraging various tools and techniques to obtain as much information as possible from a target web application.

title: Azure Storage Services
description: This INE on-demand course is for IT professionals responsible for data storage in Azure, as well as those preparing for the AZ-104 certification exam. This course covers storage accounts, file services, and storage access control.

title: PKI Design
description: Understanding and implementing a secure infrastructure is a key skill for any security engineer, and PKI is a core component of any secure environment.  In this course, you'll take a look at a brief history of encryption and the various algorithms involved.  You'll also learn about how a PKI environment functions, from the time a certificate is requested through expiration or revocation.  In addition, you'll learn how to install and configure CAs, how the trust between them functions, and how to properly maintain and secure the environment.

title: FortiGate Integrations
description: With a constantly expanding attack surface, enterprises are looking for proven protection, without limiting the speed or capacity of network operations. FortiGate Next-generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This course explains how to integrate FortiGate with other Fortinet appliances to enable centralized management, automation, better detection, improved visibility and scalable policy enforcement.

title: CCNP Enterprise - ENARSI Practice Labs
description: Are you considering pursuing a Cisco CCNP Enterprise certification?  If so, then after passing Cisco’s “Enterprise Core” exam (ENCOR), you’ll also need to pass one “Concentration” exam, and the Cisco 300-410 ENARSI exam is one of the most popular of these concentrations. The ENARSI exam primarily tests your ability to troubleshoot advanced routing and services-related networking features, but how does one prepare for this? How do you gain practical, hands-on experience with troubleshooting?  With THIS course!  INE’s ENARSI Practice Labs course has almost 50 labs designed to cover all of the topics described as either “configure” or “troubleshoot” in the ENARSI exam blueprint. In our course, you’ll be given dozens of opportunities to identify what is wrong with a network, fix it, and then view a solution to see if you resolve the problem correctly. There are also several “configuration” labs to ensure you can configure topics required to pass the ENARSI exam, such as advanced IGP redistribution, DMVMP, and IPsec. So dive right in and let the troubleshooting begin!

title: Azure Storage Services Bootcamp
description: In this bootcamp, we will cover how to store and protect information in Azure. You will learn how to design, provision, and manage Storage Accounts. You will learn options for defining storage, how to provide high availability for objects in storage, how to protect objects in storage, and how to use Storage accounts to provide common functions such as file shares and static websites. You will also learn how to implement relational data in Azure. You will learn about the cost and feature options for Azure SQL Databases, how to protect SQL databases, and how to provide high availability for SQL databases.
