You will also learn about the platform options for hosting MySQL and PostgresQL databases in Azure. Finally, you will learn non-relational data storage using Cosmos DB, Data Lake storage, Azure Synapse, and Azure Cache for Redis.

title: Azure Identity Management & Governance for Administrators
description: This INE on-demand course is intended for IT professionals who administer Azure implementations as well as those preparing for the AZ-104 certification exam. This course focuses on basic resource management, identity, and governance. Topics include the Azure Resource Manager model, Azure AD administration, role-based access control, policies, and cost management.

title: AWS Container Services
description: In this course, you will learn the benefits and use cases of container technology. You will also learn about the different AWS container services. The majority of the time we will focus on working with Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS). The goal of this course is to help prepare you for the AWS Solutions Architect-Associate exam by being able to identify the correct AWS container services that you would use given various scenarios.

title: FortiGate Technologies
description: With a constantly expanding attack surface, enterprises are looking for proven protection, without limiting the speed or capacity of network operations. FortiGate's next-generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This course introduces the concepts of certain firewall technologies and demonstrates various Virtual Private Network (VPN) capabilities of the FortiGate platform.

title: Databases, Caching, & Big Data in AWS
description:
AWS has some great options for persistent storage. Whether it’s a structured database, a data lake, or global caching, AWS has a solution. In this course, we will look at those solutions together. As builders, we will go beyond surface details and examine how we can create solutions that improve performance or the supported applications. And in some cases, we will change how we look at a particular service to better understand its potential.

Together we will look at the following:

-Relational databases using the Amazon Relational Database Service

-Building resilient solutions in Amazon RDS

-Understanding the performance and architectural implementation of Amazon Aurora

-A quick talk on the evolution of NoSQL

-Building in Amazon DynamoDB, including performant table design, data modeling, streaming, concurrency, etc.
-Working with Amazon CloudFront to build global caching systems
-How caching for Amazon DynamoDB can be cached using DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX)
-Support for database caching using ElasticCache
-Big data support using RedShift, EMR, QuickSight, and Kinesis

It’s a course with many drill-downs to improve your knowledge and understanding of databases, big data, and caching in AWS. So whether you are building a primary MySQL database to support a small application, explaining the difference between SQL and NoSQL, starting a big data project, or improving the performance of your database applications, this is the course for you.

title: Final Lab Practice for CCIE Collaboration
description:
This course is the last step in your preparation for achieving the prestigious CCIE certification. This lab-oriented course consists of 30+ tasks focusing on technologies like IM&P, Dial Plan, Cisco Expressway, Cisco Meeting Server, Unity Connection, and UCCX.

Solution videos accompany each lab to help you understand why and when you do things and how you do it in the lab exam.

title: AWS Advanced Security Topics
description: Businesses and enterprises must be able to monitor and secure their AWS environments and prove compliance. In this course, you will learn about the AWS services that you can use to manage federated user access to your AWS resources. You will also learn about services that can help you secure your network infrastructure, data, and applications. Finally, you will learn about services that can help you monitor and detect threats in your AWS environments and prove compliance.

title: Azure Fundamentals: Introduction to Infrastructure Services
description: This on-demand course is intended for managers, directors, and IT professionals who need to understand the Microsoft Azure cloud works. Infrastructure as a Service is an important service on many organizations' cloud portfolios. This course focuses on the key Azure infrastructure components - Virtual Machines, Virtual Networks, and Storage.

title: Azure Fundamentals: Introduction to Identity & Access Management
description: This on-demand course is intended for managers, directors, and IT professionals who need to understand the Microsoft Azure cloud works. Security needs to be the beginning and end of any discussion on cloud. This course introduces key cloud security concepts as they are implemented in Azure. These concepts include identity management, resource access control, and Azure security services.

title: Azure Fundamentals: Management & Governance
description: This on-demand course is intended for managers, directors, and IT professionals who need to understand the Microsoft Azure cloud works. The course focuses on resource management tools and concepts. The course includes monitoring Azure resources, using tools to optimize your Azure environment, and tools and techniques for implementing good cloud governance in Azure.

title: Security Engineering for Business Operations
description: Now that you've completed the Enterprise Defense Administrator learning path, let's take a few minutes and go over what we've covered so far.  In this course, we'll take a look at two different scenarios that will help tie all of the topics and skills together.  We'll talk about how to use everything you've learned to evaluate existing infrastructure and ensure it's secure, and we'll take a look at setting up a new environment from the ground up.

title: FortiGate Advanced Policies
description: With a constantly expanding attack surface, enterprises are looking for proven protection, without limiting the speed or capacity of network operations. FortiGate's next-generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. The main subjects of this course are more advanced inspection engines, such as Web Filtering or Intrusion Prevention.

title: Azure Fundamentals: Azure Architecture
description: This on-demand course is intended for managers, directors, and IT professionals who need to understand the Microsoft Azure cloud works. This course focuses on Azure architectural components and the tools available to manage Azure resources.

title: Azure Fundamentals: Cloud Concepts
description: This on-demand course is intended for managers, directors, and IT professionals who need an overview of cloud computing and the Microsoft Azure cloud. This course focuses on understanding what cloud computing is, what options are available within cloud computing, and why organizations choose to move some or all of their IT workloads into Azure. The course will cover core cloud concepts, the Azure cloud, cloud benefits, and service models, and cloud pricing models.

title: CCNP Enterprise - ENCOR Practice Labs
description: Ask anyone and they’ll tell you…Cisco’s CCNP Enterprise Core 350-401 exam (aka “ENCOR”) is a beast when one considers the scope and depth of topics contained within the exam. Once you have completed watching all of the videos in INE’s CCNP Enterprise Learning Path and think you might be ready to sit for that exam, it’s time to put your skills to the test. This course is designed to do just that, by helping you to assess your configuration and verification skills across a broad spectrum of topics tested within the CCNP ENCOR exam. You will be presented with more than two dozen labs testing your Cisco IOS configuration skills in topics such as BGP, MSTP, EEM, NETCONF, CoPP, Crypto-Maps, and much much more.

title: Azure High Availability & Fault Tolerance Bootcamp
description: In this bootcamp, you will learn how to build highly available, fault-tolerant solutions in Azure. We start with an explanation of fault tolerance in Azure, as well as basic Azure high availability concepts. We then dive into high-availability options for data. You will learn how to implement high availability in Storage Accounts, Azure databases, and Azure Cosmos DB. We then transition to high-availability options for compute. You will learn about virtual machine availability zones, and using load balancers and application gateways to provide availability. You will also learn about high-availability options for app services and Azure Kubernetes Services. Finally, you will learn about global availability options, including Traffic Manager, Front Door, and cross-regional load balancers.

title: AWS Storage Services
description: This course focuses on Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), which is the object storage service offered by AWS. In this course, you’ll learn how to work with buckets and objects and different strategies for controlling access to and securing your content. You’ll also learn how to monitor your environment and configure event-driven workflows. We’ll discuss how to optimize storage costs and improve the performance of your applications that write to and read from Amazon S3. Finally, you’ll learn about a few additional AWS storage services.

title: Resiliency in AWS
description: Resiliency is how we design systems to handle disruptions, scale to meet demand and mitigate transient issues. AWS provides architects, engineers, and developers with fantastic services to increase the resiliency of IT solutions. And that’s what we dive into in INE’s “Resiliency in AWS” course. In this course, resiliency is viewed as a spectrum from highly available, scaling architectures to disaster recovery scenarios.

title: Final Lab Practice for CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure
description: This course is the last step in your preparation for achieving the prestigious CCIE certification. This lab-oriented course consists of 60+ tasks focusing on technologies like LAN switching, IGPs like OSPF and EIGRP, redistribution, MPLS, BGP, L3VPNs, Network Automation,  Multicast, IPv6, and SD-WAN. Solution videos accompany each lab to help you understand why, when, and how to do things in the lab exam.

title: Azure Network Services Bootcamp
description: In this bootcamp we will cover how to create, manage, protect. and connect Azure virtual networks. You will learn the components of virtual networks, as well as the services that are available for networking in Azure. You will learn how to provision virtual networks through the portal, the CLI, and templates. You will learn the options for controlling traffic in Azure virtual networks including network security groups, Azure Firewall, and firewall appliances, as well as routing and DNS options. You will also learn how to connect Azure virtual networks to other networks by using network peering as well as virtual network gateways. Finally, you will learn the built-in options for monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting virtual networks.

title: CCNA 200-301 Practice Labs
description: Whether preparing to take Cisco CCNA 200-301 exam, or just trying to refresh your skills, hands-on practice within a lab environment is a must. This course provides you with exactly that. In this course you are presented with over a dozen hands-on lab tasks which test your skill at configuring various features and protocols on Cisco IOS switches and routers. Using real Cisco IOS, you will gain practice configuring things such as IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, VLANs and 802.1q VLAN Trunks, Spanning-Tree, OSPF routing and Static Routes, Access-Control Lists and much much more. Then, to take it to the next level you are presented with ten Troubleshooting Labs. Each Troubleshooting Lab presents something that is broken and it's your job to hunt down the root cause(es) of the problem and fix it. In addition, each of the labs in this course provide a video-based Lab Solution Walkthrough in which INE's Keith Bogart walks through each step of the lab with you to demonstrate how you were supposed to achieve the lab's objectives. Once you've completed all of the labs in this course you should be able to handle any CCNA-level network engineering career.

title: Azure Network Services
description: The infrastructure as a service (IaaS) market is expected to reach over $201 billion US by 2027 (source: datamation.com). The focus is often on computing with IaaS, but all the computing power must run across virtual networking. This course will cover the skills and concepts necessary to build networking correctly in Azure. This course covers the components of virtual networks, as well as the services that are available for networking in Azure. You will learn how to provision virtual networks through the portal, the CLI, and templates. You will learn the options for controlling traffic in Azure virtual networks including network security groups, Azure Firewall, and firewall appliances, as well as routing and DNS options. You will also learn how to connect Azure virtual networks to other networks by using network peering as well as virtual network gateways. Finally, you will learn the built-in options for monitoring, logging, and troubleshooting virtual networks.

title: Engineering Cisco Meraki Solutions (ECMS)
description: The Engineering Cisco Meraki Solutions (ECMS) course is designed for candidates who are looking to take the Cisco Meraki Solutions Specialist certification, as well as for the everyday Network Engineer that wants to learn how Cisco Meraki solutions work.  This course will cover the design, implementation, configuration, monitoring, and troubleshooting of Cisco Meraki MX Security Gateways, Meraki MS Switches, and Meraki MR Wireless Access Points through the Cloud-Managed Meraki Dashboard. This course will be most beneficial for candidates with at least a CCNA-level understanding of networking principles.

title: FortiGate Essentials
description:
As the threat landscape rapidly expands, traditional firewalls fall further behind and are unable to offer protection at scale which leads to poor user experience and weak security posture. Next-generation firewalls, such as FortiGate, include paths for future updates; they not only filter network traffic but also identify and block malware and other threats.

This introductory-level course focuses on the fundamental aspects of the FortiGate Next-Generation Firewall platform, such as its characteristics, management, or initialization.

title: Azure Identity and Access Management Bootcamp
description: In this bootcamp, we will cover how to securely manage identities in Azure and control access to resources and data hosted in Azure. You will learn how to provision and manage Azure AD users and groups. You will also learn how to assign the correct Azure AD roles to users and groups, and how to protect user accounts with features such as multi-factor authentication (MFA). You will also learn how to control access to Azure resources such as resource groups, networks, databases, and many other resources by using Azure roles and policies. You will also learn how to integrate Azure AD with other identity systems such as on-premises Active Directory, as well as using Azure AD as an identity source for applications.

title: AWS Compute Services
description:
As more and more companies migrate to the cloud, they are leveraging the power and versatility of virtual machines like those available using the AWS Amazon EC2 service. In the course, you will dive into understanding Amazon Machine Images, including automating the build and deployment of new images, strategy for choosing an instance type along with the AWS Compute Optimizer, and changing instance types. Next, you dive into data storage as it applies to EC2 instances. You’ll look at instance stores, Elastic Block Storage disks, and Elastic File Systems. You will go hands-on in this section to update an EC2 instance’s volume to improve performance. Finally, you will look at ensuring data resiliency with the Data Lifecycle Manager and EBS snapshots.


As you might expect, networking is a big part of EC2 instances. In this course, we will look at essential topics such as elastic IP addresses, elastic network interfaces, elastic network adapters, and placement groups. You will work directly with an EC2 instance that requires network modification to meet security requirements. This course will cover the critical topics of security and infrastructure as code throughout the course. Instead of a “one and done” approach, where applicable, you will focus on the security of EC2 instance features as they are presented. For IaC, you will use AWS CloudFormation and expand your knowledge of Terraform, a very much in-demand skill! Finally, we will look at a critical and often overlooked subject by engineers around EC2 instances: costs! In this section, you will understand instance lifecycles, purchase options, savings plans, and more. So if you want to develop real-world, concrete skills with EC2 instances, this is the course for you!

title: AWS Networking
description: Building a networking environment in the cloud is quite different than building one on-premises. As a cloud engineer, you need to understand how to set up a basic networking environment on AWS. In this course, you’ll learn about IP addressing and subnet sizing, which will help you create a virtual private cloud (VPC). You’ll also learn how to use AWS services and features to control and inspect network traffic, privately connect to AWS services, build an elaborate virtual network, and configure DNS and a content delivery network (CDN) distribution.

title: Final Lab Practice for SPCOR
description: Final Lab Practice for SPCOR is an intensive hands-on course designed for learners preparing for the Service Provider CORE Exam: 350-501 SPCOR. You’ll practice implementing OSPFv2, OSPFv3, IS-IS over IPv4 and IPv6, BGP, MPLS with L3VPNs, multicast, and network automation using Python on both IOS-XE and IOS-XR. Guided by Rohit Pardasani, CCIEx5 #21282, these labs consolidate key blueprint technologies from INE’s CCNP Service Provider learning path, ensuring you build the technical confidence and practical skills needed to excel in the exam and real-world service provider environments.

title: Deploying IP Multicast on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers implementing and enabling basic Multicast services for Enterprise or Service Provider environments. In this course, you will learn about Multicast and its components. You will learn about different modes of PIM like PIM Sparse mode, PIM Dense mode, PIM Sparse-Dense mode, Auto-RP, and Anycast RP. Students who want to deepen their understanding of Multicast will benefit from this course.

title: CCNA Exam Assessment: Network Fundamentals
description: So you think you're ready to schedule your Cisco CCNA exam? This self-assessment will help you determine if that is true. This assessment covers all topics within Section-1 (Network Fundamentals) of Cisco's CCNA certification exam from topic 1.1, "Explain the role and function of network components" through the last topic in this section, topic 1.13, "Describe switching concepts". As you move through this course you will be presented with a variety of questions (multiple-choice, drag-and-drop, reorder, etc). You can then pause the video after each question, answer it, and resume the video to see the answer.  In some cases the instructor will also provide some additional insight into the answer for particular questions. This course also contains hands-on labs for you to assess your skills with Cisco IOS CLI commands that are introduced in this section.

title: Penetration Testing: Exploitation and Post-Exploitation Tactics
description: Exploitation and post-exploitation are an important part of the penetration testing lifecycle and will ultimately define the overall success of a penetration test. This course is designed for beginners and intermediates that have some experience in pentesting and are looking to improve their exploitation and post-exploitation skills. This Bootcamp will start off by exploring various initial access tactics and techniques used by penetration testers to gain access to both Windows and Linux targets. You will then learn how to perform various post-exploitation techniques like local enumeration, privilege escalation, persistence, and hash dumping on Windows & Linux targets. Lastly, you will also learn how to perform internal reconnaissance on a target network in order to pivot from one system to another and move laterally through a target network.

title: Introduction to Identity & Access Management (IAM)
description: User and system accounts are a necessary part of any IT infrastructure, and properly securing those identities is a critical piece to any successful cyber security program. This course will take you through the basics of authentication, authorization, and accounting - including what they are and how each is used with identity and access management. You'll learn about the various types of authentication that are commonly used, including how to better protect the identities in your environment. In addition, we'll cover different systems that are used for authentication and authorization and how they fit into an overall IAM program. To wrap it up, we'll see why logging and auditing are important and how everything comes together to build the IAM lifecycle.

title: MS 500.4 Governance and Compliance in Microsoft 365
description: This course is designed for students to work with Microsoft governance and compliance components within in Microsoft 365 security and compliance centers. Much of the course revolves around keeping your data protected and in accordance with your organization’s internal compliance and retention policies. While we cover other topics such as Microsoft Graph, we will go through audit management and reporting, information retention capabilities, as well as content searches, and eDiscovery.

title: Azure Compute Services
description: In this course, we’ll cover the hosting model for a variety of cloud-based application use cases, including virtual machines, managed web apps, containers, serverless functions, and more. These hosting models make up the suite of Azure Compute services available for building modern applications.

title: Juniper SRX Technologies
description: With the increasing reliance on technology, it is becoming more and more essential to secure every aspect of online information and data. The INE's JNCIA-SEC series provides you with the opportunity to practically explore the skills required for entry into the world of Juniper Networks security solutions. The students attending this course will be presented with some of the important concepts and technologies Juniper Networks adopted on the SRX, such as Application Firewall, IPS, Content Filtering, or VPNs.

title: Secure Architecture Design
description: Knowing how to properly design a secure infrastructure is just as important as being able to properly configure the security controls themselves. In this course, we go through what should be considered during the planning process, including network design, authentication and authorization controls, and the importance of a well-thought-out logging infrastructure. In addition, you'll also learn about how to identify threats to your infrastructure and methods to choose proper countermeasures for those threats through a process known as threat modeling.

title: Controlling Traffic with Juniper Stateless Firewall Filters
description: Networks are frequently subdivided into different sections such as private and public networks, or perhaps divided based on device types (IP Phones, printers, laptops, etc). No matter what logic is used to divide a network, once the division occurs, there is frequently a need to classify traffic as it passes through your network to enforce various objectives such as restricting traffic between subnets, prioritize traffic, or applying other types of action to that traffic. Within Juniper devices, implementation of Firewall Filters can be used to accomplish this task. This course will teach you about the theory, implementation and monitoring of stateless firewall filters as well as other features that can be paired with them such as Policing and uRPF enforcement. Throughout the course you'll have the opportunity to practice what you've learned using INE's embedded Lab Tasks and real Junos software.

title: Network Address Translation on JunOS
description: With the increasing reliance on technology, it is becoming more and more essential to secure every aspect of online information and data. The INE's JNCIA-SEC series provides you with the opportunity to practically explore the skills required for entry into the world of Juniper Networks security solutions. This course was designed to familiarize students with the concept of Network Address Translation (NAT) and show them how to use this technology on Juniper SRX.

title: AWS Security Basics
description: The AWS Security Basics course covers the basics of the AWS Identity Access Management service's users, groups, roles, policies, and shared responsibility in the cloud. This course is a basic introduction that will build the skills needed to understand more complex security scenarios as we look into the various AWS services part of the AWS Administrator Learning Path.

title: Advanced BGP on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers Advanced BGP deployments on Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about understanding and configuring BGP Aggregation, BGP Aggregation with AS-Set, BGP Community No-Export, BGP Community No-Advertise, BGP Community Tags, and BGP Regular Expressions. Students who want to deepen their understanding of BGP will benefit from this course.

title: The Metasploit Framework Bootcamp
description:
The Metasploit Framework is one of the most widely utilized exploitation tools used by penetration testers and security researchers. For anyone looking to get started with a career in cybersecurity and penetration testing, the ability to use the Metasploit framework to conduct penetration tests and security audits is an essential skill to master on your path to becoming a competent penetration tester. This course will introduce you to the Metasploit framework and will teach you how to utilize the framework for penetration testing. You will learn how to perform information gathering and enumeration with the Metasploit framework and how to identify vulnerabilities in target systems. We will also cover the process of exploiting Windows and Linux systems with the Metasploit framework and the fundamentals of using Meterpreter. Lastly, you will learn how to perform various post-exploitation techniques like privilege escalation, establishing persistence, and dumping credentials. All of the labs in this course will involve the use of several vulnerable virtual machines that can be downloaded as well as labs from the Attack Defense lab environment.

Join INE Offensive Security instructor Alexis Ahmed for an intensive and interactive course on learning how to use the Metasploit Framework (MSF) for penetration testing.

This course is ideal for those who:

* Are interested in becoming a penetration tester
* Want to learn how to use the Metasploit framework for penetration testing
* Are preparing for the OSCP, eJPT certification
* Want to learn more about exploiting Windows and Linux systems
* Want to learn about privilege escalation techniques

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Setup and configure the Metasploit framework
* Perform information gathering and enumeration with the Metasploit framework
* Generate Metasploit payloads for Windows and Linux targets
* Exploit Windows and Linux systems with the Metasploit framework
* Perform post-exploitation techniques like privilege escalation, persistence, and credential harvesting with the Metasploit framework

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Familiarity with Linux terminal commands 
* Familiarity with TCP and UDP protocols
* Familiarity with Windows commands

title: Implementing Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Bootcamp
description:
The Implementing Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) course will take you from zero to hero in deploying the solutions that power the next-generation of Enterprise Data Centers. From the Day-0 planning phases to Day-1 implementation, you will learn how to design, deploy, and troubleshoot Cisco UCS-based solutions. Topics include UCS Ethernet Connectivity, UCS Storage Connectivity, Cisco SAN Switching, and UCS Pools, Policies, Service Profiles, & Templates.  This course is targeted at CCNP Data Center and CCIE Data Center candidates, as well as the everyday Network Engineer that wants to learn more about Data Center Computing. An A+ level knowledge of computer hardware, and a CCNA level understanding of Ethernet Switching are recommended prerequisites for this course.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Describe the components of the Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS)
* Implement UCS Ethernet Connectivity
* Implement UCS Storage Connectivity
* Implement Cisco SAN Switching
* Implement UCS Pools, Policies, Service Profiles, and Templates

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* An A+ level knowledge of computer hardware
* A CCNA level understanding of Ethernet Switching

title: Implementing Cisco SD-WAN Bootcamp
description: In this course, you will learn the technical details of how to configure, verify, and troubleshoot a Cisco SD-WAN based environment. From building the test topology on a hypervisor to implementing traffic engineering with multiple exits, this course includes everything you need A-Z to get a Cisco SD-WAN topology up and running. ATTENTION! For the latest up-to-date content please see our newest course here. .

title: Implementing Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) v4 Bootcamp
description: Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) is one of the industry-leading software-defined networking (SDN) solutions for the Data Center. In INE’s Implementing ACI course, you will learn both the theory and practice of running Cisco’s Nexus 9000 series switches in ACI-mode, from Day-0 initialization of the fabric to Day-1 operations. This course takes a hands-on approach to learning. The vast majority of the course utilizes the Application Centric Infrastructure Controller (APIC) GUI and CLI interfaces for live configuration, verification, and troubleshooting examples. This course applies to CCNP and CCIE Data Center candidates and the everyday network engineer who wants to add Cisco ACI knowledge to their skillset. At the end of this course, students will be able to: * Understand the components that make up the ACI system * Explain the main features and functionality of the ACI system * Build an ACI fabric from scratch * Manage an already existing ACI fabric Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course * Layer 2 Ethernet Switching * Layer 3 IP Routing * Basic Virtualization knowledge Note: An updated version of this course is available here.

title: Best Practices for Implementing BGP Bootcamp
description: The Implementing BGP with Best Practices course will provide students with an in-depth understanding of Border Gateway Protocol v4 (BGP), the protocol that runs the Internet. With Best Common Practices (BCP) in mind, engineers will learn how to deploy BGP the right way. This course covers BGP theory, configuration, verification, and troubleshooting, and will allow students to gain real-world skills that can be put into practice in Enterprise, Service Provider, and Data Center environments.

title: Security Engineering and System Hardening Bootcamp
description: As the world becomes more and more connected and technology becomes even more ingrained into business and home life, properly protecting that infrastructure has become more important than ever before. From Windows servers to workstations, Linux to Mac, and IoT to ICS, it’s critically important that systems be deployed securely to reduce the available attack surface. Security hardening is the process of configuring settings on servers and other devices and systems to make them as secure as possible, while still providing proper business functionality. In the past, cybersecurity has been an often neglected area of an organization, and qualified security engineers are needed to help prepare and protect an organization against cyber threats and criminals. By properly configuring systems and crafting in-depth solutions to harden their environment, you can become that professional After this course, you will understand the fundamentals behind security engineering, understand how to properly secure common types of systems and devices, and be prepared to move forward in your career.

title: IHRP Cloud Foundations Bootcamp
description: This course will delve into the phases of incident handling and response and apply that knowledge to use in fundamental general for detection, analysis, and containment. Students will have the opportunity to see how they can detect and respond to intrusion attempts in a cloud environment, with no particular focus on a specific cloud. The course will also cover some key configuration challenges to improve the effectiveness of Cloud Deployment. Students will find this a useful introduction to the configuration and use for incident handling and response clouds.

title: Data Analysis, Visualization and Predictive Modeling Bootcamp
description:
This interactive course will lead students through the fundamentals of data analysis and modeling using Python data science libraries. We will focus on the Pandas data frame library as a means of reading, cleaning, and organizing data and explore the Python programming language that underlays its framework. We will explore visualization capabilities, both within Pandas and using the Seaborn statistical visualization library. On the final day, you will learn how to model data using basic linear regression techniques within Pandas and scikit-learn, with an introduction to the sophisticated scikit-learn machine learning framework.

LEARNING OBJECTIVES:

*Understand data acquisition and cleaning, using Python tools (Pandas and others).
*Be able to choose useful visualizations of data sets or aspects, and use relevant tools for their creation (Matplotlib and Seaborn).
*Learn to create and evaluate regression and classification models using supervised learning techniques (scikit-learn)

RECOMMENDED SKILLS PRIOR TO TAKING THIS COURSE:

*Basic statistics knowledge
*Basic familiarity with Python programming

title: Digital Resistance: Basic Incident Response with a Wartime Focus Bootcamp
description:
The modern cyber threat landscape has changed with the current conflict between Ukraine and Russia. This course will get you up to speed with the relevant incident response techniques including:

1. A briefing and overview of the historical threat actors coming from Russia, including advanced persistent threat groups and other threats.
2. Known threat assessments of their capabilities.
3. Incident detection techniques and mitigations.
4. Various open-source tools that can assist you.
 
You will leave this course with the knowledge of free and open-source technologies that you can implement that will increase your ability to defend your environment. 

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Classify the threat posed by Russian cyber actors.
* Summarize incident response techniques.
* Implement threat hunting techniques to find indicators of compromise

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:

* Operating systems- Windows and Linux
* Basic digital forensics 
* Cybersecurity fundamentals

title: Incident Handling and Response Process for AWS Cloud Bootcamp
description:
Learn the ins and outs of the uniqueness of performing incident response in the AWS environment. We will be covering performing IR with native AWS services and technologies such as GuardDuty, Security Hub, Detective, Macie, Inspector, and a selection of open-source tools. We will also cover forensics preservation and cloud evidence management techniques.

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Demonstrate knowledge of AWS evidence sources.
* Preserve evidence in the AWS environment.
* Use Amazon AWS tools to detect threat actor TTPs.
* Perform analysis of AWS network logs using 3rd party tools.
* Demonstrate techniques to locate threat actors in an AWS environment.

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* INE Cloud Fundamentals
* Incident Response Essentials 
* Digital Forensics Essentials

title: Digital Forensics & Incident Response in the Cloud Bootcamp
description:
Digital forensic and incident response is an ever-changing field. With the transition to the cloud, new challenges to cyber forensic practitioners have been unveiled. Cloud forensic techniques are similar to existing cyber forensic methodologies. With the addition of cloud services and the shift of endpoints into the cloud, our collection, handling, and analysis techniques also have to adapt.

At the end of this course, students will:

* understand the challenges that the cloud presents and how to adapt to them
* be able to adapt forensic techniques and tools to the cloud
* demonstrate best practices when preserving cloud evidence
 
Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:

* Introductory level digital forensics--operating systems, networking, and memory, 
* Introductory Cybersecurity (Security+ level)
* Cloud technology administration skills

title: Mastering IP Addressing, Subnetting & Services Bootcamp
description:
Join INE instructor Keith Bogart for an interactive, 3-day, live Bootcamp on Mastering IPv4/v6 Addressing, Subnetting & Services.

This Bootcamp is ideal for those who:
-Are preparing for the CCNA exam
-Want to learn more about Internet Protocol addressing
-Need to add, or modify, an IP addressing scheme to a new or existing network
-Want to gain entry into the field of Network Administration

Learning Objectives
-At the end of this Bootcamp, students will be able to:
-Recognize the structure of IPv4 and IPv6 addresses
-Identify the different kinds of IPv4/IPv6 addresses
-Subnet IPv4 and IPv6 networks
-Summarize the operation of IPv6 SLAAC and DHCP
-Implement IPv6 and IPv6 networks on Cisco routers
-Configure Cisco routers as DHCPv4/v6 servers
-Implement HSRP (for IPv4 and IPv6) for gateway redundancy
-Recommended Knowledge or Skills Before Taking this Course
-Basic knowledge of the purpose and history of the Internet Protocol (IP)
-Familiarity with IPv4/v6 packet formats

title: Loop-Free Switching with Spanning-Tree, VLANs and Trunks Bootcamp
description:
Any Layer-2 switched network with two or more switches providing redundant paths between endpoints will have to deal with the problem of bridging loops.  It was for this reason that Spanning-Tree was developed, as a protocol to mitigate this problem.  In this course you will be exposed to two flavors of Spanning-Tree and various ways to implement them...802.1w RSTP and 802.1s MSTP. Cisco IOS-based switches will be utilized to demonstrate the operation of RSTP as well as MSTP. You will learn how to verify the proper operation of these protocols using Cisco IOS-based commands, as well as various ways to manipulate their operation. From the deterministic placement of the STP Root Bridge to manual load-balancing of VLAN traffic you will become proficient with the Cisco implementation of RSTP and MSTP.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Verify Spanning-Tree Root Bridge Operation
* View Spanning-Tree Port State and Port Role on any given switch interface
* Understand Spanning-Tree timers and usage 
* Explain the RSTP Topology Change process
* Modify the RSTP and MSTP for deterministic Root Bridge placement
* Modify RSTP and MSTP to accomplish per-VLAN or per-Instance load-balancing 

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Experience with Cisco IOS command-line interface 
* Familiarity with Ethernet frame structure 
* Understanding of MAC Address-Table usage

title: Implementing OSPF For IPv4 & IPv6 Networks Bootcamp
description:
As a Network Engineer or Network Administrator, one of your very first responsibilities will be to monitor an existing IPv4/IPv6 routing implementation...or to implement one yourself. Or perhaps your network will begin to grow beyond the abilities of its current routing protocol. In all of these situations (and more) in-depth knowledge of a time-tested routing protocol is a must, and OSPF fits that category. As an industry standard IP Routing Protocol, OSPFv2 and OSPFv3 have been implemented within tens of thousands of global networks and this course will help you implement, or modify it, within your network as well. Using Cisco devices for demonstration purposes, you’ll learn not only the theory of how OSPFv2 and OSPFv3 works but the actual commands to form adjacencies between routers and monitor those adjacencies. You’ll learn about OSPF Areas, LSA Types, Virtual Links, Stub Areas and a whole lot more with demonstrations each step of the way that you can easily recreate yourself. Join us for this course and let INE help you...to become an OSPF expert!

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Configure Cisco routers to form OSPFv2 and OSPFv3 adjacencies
* Monitor OSPF operational status on Cisco routers 
* Describe the details of the OSPF adjacency process
* Troubleshoot issues that arise due to OSPF configuration inconsistencies
* Implement OSPF Stub Areas and Virtual Links
* Recognize the differences between OSPFv2 and OSPFv3 LSA types
* Utilize the OSPF Link State Database for monitoring and troubleshooting
* Perform OSPFv2/v3 LSA Filtering and Summarization 

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* IPv4/IPv6 Packet Header Structure & Addressing 
* Login account Cisco.com Devnet Sandbox Labs website (https://developer.cisco.com/site/sandbox/) 
* Basic knowledge of the Cisco IOS Command Line

title: Automating Cisco ACI with Python Bootcamp
description:
Automating Cisco ACI with Python is just one of the many use cases for today’s Network Engineers to learn programming.  In this course, we start with a hands-on Introduction to Python to learn the practical basics of the language. The second portion of this course focuses on Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI), and how to automate it using the built-in APIs and external Python scripts. 

This course is targeted at Data Center Network Engineers, Designers, or anyone who deals with Day 2 Operations of Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI).  In this course we show how to automate repetitive tasks in ACI with Python, such as creating Bridge Domains, EPGs, Contracts, etc.  Once completing this course, you will be able to modify existing Python scripts, create new ones, and apply your knowledge to other network automation tasks utilizing Python scripting.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:
- Write basic python scripts from scratch
- Interface with the Cisco APIC through Postman and Python
- Write python scripts with the ACIToolKit
- Automate the provisioning of an ACI Fabric through Python

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:
- Professional level of knowledge of Cisco ACI

title: GitHub for Everyone Bootcamp
description:
This is a beginner-friendly course that will teach you the basics of GitHub. You will learn how to use GitHub as a collaboration platform for your projects, implement repository access rules, communicate effectively using GitHub Flavored Markdown, leverage the built-in project management features and tools, and automate general workflow processes using GitHub Actions. You will have the opportunity to reinforce the essential concepts taught by interacting with one another through Github during the course.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:
*Write elegant and informative Markdown.
*Build a communication history within a project using Issues, Pull Requests, Branches, and Project Boards.
*Apply Security Controls to teams and repositories.
*Implement version control techniques for use cases outside of source code.
*Build automation pipelines to interact with project contributors.

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Before Taking this Course:
*Basic knowledge of how to use a web browser

title: Cloud Pentesting Bootcamp
description:
Around the globe, cloud solutions have become more mainstream in organizations large and small. Cloud has been seen as a more secure alternative to on-premises solutions, but with cloud not being well understood the risk of vulnerabilities can be high. Not only does cloud require proper security configuration, it also requires that it is thoroughly assessed for security weaknesses through pentests. In this course we will cover exploiting Azure Cloud by gaining initial access using multiple methods, as well as bypassing common security controls to gain access to sensitive data and resources.

LEARNING OBJECTIVES

* Identifying and exploiting critical vulnerabilities in Azure which could lead to a breach. 
* How to gain initial access using phishing and password attacks. 
* Learn how to escalate privileges using Azure attacks.

title: Recon and Vulnerability Detection Bootcamp
description:
Reconnaissance and vulnerability detection are foundational skills required for penetration testing, vulnerability assessments, and vulnerability management. These skills are the first steps of conducting a thorough and successful security assessment. In this course, we will cover reconnaissance tools and techniques needed to enumerate and discover security vulnerabilities, including automated vulnerability scanners and manual techniques.

Learning Objectives:

*Learn how to perform reconnaissance and vulnerability detection using automated and manual tools.
*Explore assessment and testing tools and techniques, such as information gathering, port scanning, operating systems (OS), software, and service enumeration.

Recommended Knowledge and Skills Prior to Taking This Course:

*Basic Linux and Linux command line skills 
*Basic understanding of TCP/IP networking

title: Deploying BGP on Cisco and Juniper Routers Bootcamp
description:
Join INE instructor Rohit Pardasani for an interactive course on Deploying BGP on Cisco and Juniper routers. 

This course is ideal for those who:

*Are preparing for the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure certification exam
*Are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider Lab certification exam
*Want to learn more about BGP
*Want a deeper understanding of how BGP attributes work

Working towards your CCIE Enterprise or the CCIE Service Provider Lab certification? Want to learn how BGP works within the Enterprise or Service Provider network? Want to learn about BGP Path Selection attributes?  Want to deep dive into implementing BGP on Cisco and Juniper Routers? If so, join INE instructor Rohit Pardasani for an interactive session on Deploying BGP on Cisco and Juniper Routers. All lab exercises are going to be performed on Cisco as well as Juniper routers. Familiarity with basic routing and basic BGP is advised, but not required to join this session.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:
 
*Understand and Configure basic BGP
*Understand BGP attributes
*Implement and Verify the BGP Weight Attribute
*Implement and Verify the BGP Local Preference Attribute
*Implement and Verify the BGP AS-Path Attribute
*Implement and Verify the BGP Origin-Code Attribute
*Implement and Verify the BGP MED Attribute

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this course:
*Basic Routing Terminologies 
*Basic BGP

title: Understanding and Deploying Cisco ExpressWay and Cisco Meeting Server Bootcamp
description:
Join INE instructor Rohit Pardasani for an interactive course on Understanding and Deploying Cisco ExpressWay and Cisco Meeting Server.

This course is ideal for those who:

* Are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration Lab exam
* Are preparing for the CCNP Collaboration certification exam
* Want to learn more about Cisco Expressway
* Want to learn more about Cisco Meeting Server
* Want a deeper understanding of how Cisco Expressway and Cisco Meeting Server fits into your network
* Want a deep dive into Cisco Expressway and Cisco Meeting Server integration
* Familiarity with basic CUCM is advised, but not required to join this session

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Initialize Cisco Meeting Server and setup Callbridge, XMPP and Webadmin.
* Create Spaces from Active Directory via API
* Allowing CUCM users and endpoints to communicate with users dialing into the CMS Space.
* Join CMS Space using IVR
* Configuring CMS WebBridge
* AdHoc Conference
* CMS Local Space
* TLS Certificates for Cisco Expressway
* Cisco Expressway MRA
* Configure CMS Connection via Expressway-E Proxy
* Outbound B2B Call

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:

* Basic CUCM Knowledge
* Basic Cisco Expressway Knowledge
* Basic CMS Knowledge

title: Optimizing Networks with MPLS and Segment Routing Bootcamp
description: Optimize your network infrastructure with Optimizing Networks with MPLS and Segment Routing Bootcamp, an advanced-level course designed for aspiring CCIE candidates and network engineers. You’ll explore MPLS fundamentals, LDP configuration, authentication, label filtering, and traffic engineering with OSPF and ISIS. The course then dives into Segment Routing, Fast ReRoute, and SR-TE implementations. By combining real-world scenarios and practical labs, you'll gain the skills to troubleshoot and deploy scalable, resilient networks across enterprise and service provider environments. Whether you're targeting certification or deepening your MPLS and SR expertise, this course equips you with the tools to succeed.

title: Understanding, Implementing, and Optimizing L3VPNs Bootcamp
description:
Working towards your CCIE Enterprise or the CCIE Service Provider Lab certification? Want to learn how L3VPN works within the Enterprise or the Service Provider network? Want to learn how many different types of L3VPN solutions are available?  Want to deep dive into L3VPN troubleshooting? If so, join INE instructor Rohit Pardasani for an interactive session on Understanding, Implementing, and Optimizing L3VPNs. Familiarity with basic routing, basic BGP, and basic MPLS is advised, but not required to join this session.

This course will help you solve L3VPN issues in your work environment. In this course, we will deep-dive into the concepts of L3VPN, implement different solutions of L3VPN and verify and troubleshoot L3VPNs. This course will help you prepare for the CCIE Enterprise and the CCIE Service Provider Lab Exam.

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Understand basic MPLS implementation.
* Understand basic BGP implementation.
* Implement and Troubleshoot basic Intra-AS L3VPN.
* Implement and Troubleshoot basic Inter-AS L3VPN.
* Implement and Troubleshoot Inter-AS Option A L3VPN
* Implement and Troubleshoot Inter-AS Option B L3VPN
* Implement and Troubleshoot Inter-AS Option C L3VPN
* Implement and Troubleshoot Carrier Supporting Carrier L3VPN

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Basic Routing Terminologies 
* Basic BGP 
* Basic MPLS

title: Identity Management using Cisco ISE Bootcamp
description:
Join INE instructor Rohit Pardasani for this interactive course on Deploying Security Features using Cisco ISE.

This course is ideal for those who:

* Are preparing for the CCIE Security Lab exam
* Are preparing for the CCNP Security certification exam
* Want to learn more about Identity Management
* Want a deeper understanding of Cisco ISE protects your infrastructure and fits into your network
* Want a deep dive into DOT1X and MAB authentication
* Want to learn about ISE integration with Active Directory
* Want to learn about device authentication

Familiarity with basic ISE is advised, but not required to join this session.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Understand basic how ISE secures your network infrastructure.
* Understand and Implement DOT1X authentication
* Understand and Implement MAB authentication
* Integrate ISE with Active Directory
* Implement device login authentication using ISE
* Understand and Implement Cisco ISE Profiling for IP Phones and PCs
* Understand and Implement Wired and Wireless Central WebAuth
* Implement BYOD

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Basic ISE
* Basic Switch Security

title: Python Concurrency In Practice Bootcamp
description:
In this interactive course, you will learn how to apply concurrency to your own programs from beginning to end. We’ll start with the fundamentals and discuss how your computer architecture supports concurrency as well as the role of the Operating System. Once those key topics have been discussed, we'll go over multithreading concepts and how to use them on your own programs, including the associated challenges such as race conditions, synchronization techniques, and more. Next, we will dive into the GIL and learn how multiprocessing can overcome the limitations of CPU-bound, multithreaded apps. Last, but not least, we will guide you through learning several popular patterns for concurrency and parallelism, such as deadlocks (and how to prevent them), the producer/consumer model (using queues) and much more!

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Understand the basics of concurrency and the role of hardware and operating systems 
* Create multithreaded programs using different architectures and synchronization primitives
* Understand the limitations and risks associated with multithreaded programs
* Write multiprocessing models and understand the advantages/disadvantages compared to multithreading

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Python programming (or other dynamic programming language)

title: Cloud Fundamentals Bootcamp
description:
This is a course on cloud fundamentals. It introduces students to the cloud and is intended to familiarize students with basic operations within the cloud. The course covers a wide array of concepts and features common to multiple cloud providers, but it does not go deeply into any one topic.

WHAT’S NOT INCLUDED:

1. Lab environment. This course has hands-on exercises but does not provide the lab environment. Students will register for a trial account with one or more cloud providers on the first day of the bootcamp. A credit card may be required for identification with the cloud provider, but there will be no costs accrued during the bootcamp. 
2. Detailed, deep coverage of topics. This is a fundamentals course.

RECOMMENDED SKILLS AND/OR KNOWLEDGE PRIOR TO TAKING THIS COURSE:

* Basic awareness of computing concepts

title: Hybrid Cloud Networking Bootcamp
description:
This course takes a hands-on approach to designing and implementing a hybrid-network. We will cover topics including the options for integrating cloud and on-premises networks, designing a hybrid network, and configuring a hybrid network. Our experts will explain and demonstrate the process of implementing a hybrid-network topology that includes on-premises resources and resources in the two most popular cloud platforms - Azure and AWS.

At the end of this course, students will be able to: 

* Explain the options for connecting data centers and cloud networking
* Describe the requirements for establishing secure, reliable communication between data centers and the cloud 
* Implement a hybrid network between a data center and cloud networks in Azure and AWS

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:

* IP routing fundamentals 
* Cloud foundations 
* Cloud networking fundamentals

title: Cloud Application Management Bootcamp
description:
As organizational investment in cloud technology matures, organizations often migrate to platform services to host their data and application needs. Utilizing platform services tends to reduce operational costs and complexity, however, relying on the cloud for platform hosting does introduce its own administrative requirements. This course covers what application management looks like in the cloud. We will cover the reasons organizations move their application workloads to the cloud, define common application services provided by the cloud vendors, and get hands-on experience configuring and administering cloud application services. The majority of the course will be focused on common cloud-provided services such as web application hosting, serverless applications, container services, and messaging systems. The course will also cover application diagnostics as well as introduce infrastructure as code as a means to deploy and maintain application infrastructure.

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Enumerate common application services available in the cloud
* Deploy and manage common cloud application hosting resources 
* Deploy and manage common cloud application support services
* Execute a simple templated cloud resource deployment 

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course:

* Cloud foundations 
* Web application hosting 
* Container fundamentals

title: Implementing Cisco SD-WAN II Bootcamp
description: Cisco’s SD-WAN overlay WAN architecture allows us to connect remote sites to data centers and hybrid cloud environments through a single fabric and single management “pane of glass”. In this course, you will learn the technical details of how to configure, verify, and troubleshoot a Cisco SD-WAN-based environment. From building the test topology on a hypervisor to implementing traffic engineering with multiple exits, this course includes everything you need to get a Cisco SD-WAN topology up and running. At the end of this course, students will be able to: Describe the components of a Cisco SD-WAN-based solution Implement a Cisco SD-WAN-based solution Verify a Cisco SD-WAN-based solution Troubleshoot a Cisco SD-WAN-based solution Note: For the latest up-to-date content please see our newest Cisco SD-WAN course here. .

title: Assessment Methodologies: Information Gathering
description: Information gathering is the first step of any penetration test and is arguably the most important as all other phases rely on the information obtained about the target during the information gathering phase. This course will introduce you to information gathering and will cover the process of performing both passive and active information gathering by leveraging various tools and techniques to obtain as much information as possible from a target.

title: Host & Network Penetration Testing: System/Host Based Attacks
description: The ability to exploit host-based vulnerabilities is an important skill set to master on your journey to becoming a skilled penetration tester. In this course, you will learn about the various services, protocols, and vulnerabilities in both Windows and Linux systems and how they can be exploited. You will also learn about the various inherent filesystem and privilege escalation vulnerabilities in both Windows and Linux systems and how they can be exploited. Furthermore, you will also learn about how Windows & Linux systems store password hashes and how they can be dumped for password cracking or Pass-The-Hash attacks in the case of Windows. The objective of this course is to give you in-depth hands-on skills necessary to exploit Windows and Linux systems. By the end of this course, you will have the skills necessary to exploit inherent vulnerabilities in both Windows and Linux systems.

title: Host & Network Penetration Testing: Exploitation
description:
Exploitation consists of the tactics, techniques, and procedures that attackers/adversaries utilize to gain an initial foothold on a target system and consequently the target network. The ability to identify and exploit vulnerabilities is an important skill to master on your journey to becoming a skilled penetration tester. In this course, you will learn about how to identify vulnerabilities on a target by performing banner grabbing and vulnerability detection. In addition to identifying vulnerabilities, you will also learn how to search for and modify exploit code that will be used to exploit a particular vulnerability on a target system. Furthermore, this course will also introduce you to bind and reverse shells and will demonstrate how they work and how they can be used to gain remote access to a Windows or Linux target.


After identifying vulnerabilities on a target system, you will learn how to exploit these vulnerabilities both manually and automatically through the use of exploitation frameworks like Metasploit and PowerShell-Empire. This course also covers the process of encoding and obfuscating exploits and payloads to avoid detection by signature-based AV’s. The objective of this course is to give you in-depth hands-on skills necessary to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in a target system both manually and automatically.

title: Host & Network Penetration Testing: Post-Exploitation
description:
Post-exploitation is the final phase of the penetration testing process and consists of the tactics, techniques, and procedures that attackers/adversaries undertake after obtaining initial access to a target system. In this course, you will learn about how to perform local enumeration on target systems to identify critical information like users and groups, credentials, and services. You will also learn how to elevate your privileges on Windows and Linux targets, as well as how to maintain access to target systems after compromise.

You will also learn how to dump and crack hashes for legitimate authentication or lateral movement. Furthermore, you will also learn how to perform internal network discovery and how to pivot to systems you have discovered on the target’s internal network. The objective of this course is to give you in-depth hands-on skills necessary to perform all the tasks that make up the post-exploitation phase of the penetration testing lifecycle.

title: Host & Network Penetration Testing: The Metasploit Framework (MSF)
description: The Metasploit Framework is one of the most widely used exploitation tools used by penetration testers and security researchers. This course will introduce you to the Metasploit framework and will teach you how to utilize the framework for penetration testing and vulnerability assessments.

title: Introduction to Security & Risk Management
description: Before security controls can be selected and implemented, a proper assessment must be conducted to see what an organization needs.  But how does an organization go about this process? This course discusses all of the basics of security management and risk management, including GRC. Starting with organizational roles and responsibilities, and pivoting to risk analysis and response, you will learn what steps are required for minimizing risk in your organization. You will also learn about various frameworks that exist for ensuring compliance with laws and regulations and for properly selecting and implementing security controls.

title: AWS Infrastructure as Code
description:
Being a consummate cloud engineer requires many skills needed at various times: network troubleshooting, tuning virtual machines, and diagnosing poor application performance, just to name a few. But there are critical core skills used by engineers constantly. One of them is utilizing infrastructure as code, or IaC. Cloud engineers lean heavily on IaC to ensure fast and accurate deployments of resources. And the best way to learn IaC is in the context of cloud services as we learn about them, not in an isolated IaC video or module. But to do this, you need the basics, and that’s what this course is all about!

The AWS IaC Basics course aims to give you basic knowledge of AWS CloudFormation and Hashicorp’s Terraform. We will look at using CloudFormation to build out basic templates and stacks in AWS. Then with Terraform, we will look at syntax, breaking the template across files, and the infrastructure lifecycle. As new AWS engineer courses are released, we will dive into more complex IaC solutions for each. And with the basic infrastructure as code knowledge provided in this course, you’ll be ready to tackle them.

title: Deploying OSPFv3 on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers deploying OSPFv3 with Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about the basics of OSPFv3 neighborship, OSPFv3 network types, DR/BDR election, Single Area, Multi Area, Summarization, Filtering, Authentication, Virtual-links, LSA types, and more. Students who want to deepen their understanding of OSPFv3 will benefit from this course.

title: Introduction to Security Sensors & Logging Management
description: Security sensors are a necessary, and critical part of any complete security infrastructure. They are the "data collectors" in a network and are responsible for gathering the critical information required for proper logging. With those logs, a centralized logging system can help put that data into perspective and help tell a better story about the events and possible security incidents occurring in your network. This course will cover what security sensors are, how to use them for proper logging, and how automated analysis can help detect and possibly mitigate, potentially damaging security incidents.

title: Deploying OSPF on Cisco and Juniper Routers Bootcamp
description:
OSPF is arguably the most widely deployed interior gateway routing protocol and is ubiquitous across the platforms of numerous networking equipment vendors. For someone seeking employment as a Network Engineer, understanding the mechanics and operation of OSPF for IPv4 networks is a must. This course will introduce you to the fundamental concepts of OSPF and show you how to deploy basic to complex OSPF configurations on Cisco and Juniper routers.

In this course, you will learn:

* Common characteristics of Link State Protocols
* Usage and restrictions concerning OSPF areas
* The relationship between the SPF Tree and OSPF Link State Database
* OSPF adjacency requirements
* LSAs: What they are, how they vary, and their functional usage
* Implementation of single-area and multi-area OSPF
* Monitoring data structures used by OSPF
* Protecting OSPF with authentication
* …and a whole lot more!

Learning Objectives

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

* Explain the main concepts used in OSPF
* Configure Cisco and Juniper routers for single-area and multi-area OSPF 
* Explain in detail the process involved in building OSPF adjacencies
* Explain the functionality of different LSA types
* View and search for LSAs within the Link State Database of Cisco and Juniper routers 
* Monitor OSPF status on Cisco and Juniper routers.
* Identify OSPF routes within the IP Routing Tables of Cisco and Juniper routers.
* Configure OSPF virtual links on Cisco and Juniper routers
* Apply OSPF filtering and summarization to Cisco and Juniper routers.

Recommended Knowledge or Skills Prior to Taking this Course

* Understanding of IPv4 addressing 
* Familiarity with the basics of the Cisco IOS and Juniper Junos command-line interface 
* Understanding of basic routing concepts of packet forwarding and rewriting

title: Juniper SRX Objects & Policies
description: With the increasing reliance on technology, it is becoming more and more essential to secure every aspect of online information and data. The INE's JNCIA-SEC series provides you with the opportunity to practically explore the skills required for entry into the world of Juniper Networks security solutions. This course will guide you through the concept of objects and security policies which are both at the heart of every SRX deployment.

title: Foundations Of Juniper Routing
description: If you need to learn about IP Routing from the ground up, and you need to implement this feature on Juniper routers...this course is for you. This course begins by explaining why routing is necessary for networks and what happens to IPv4 packets as they are routed. Then you'll learn about Static Routes, their various options, and how to implement them on Juniper routers. To scale your network to the next level, you'll learn about Dynamic Routing and the problems it overcomes. You'll then learn about the functionality and much of the theory of OSPF and BGP and how to configure a basic implementation of these routing protocols. With your knowledge of routing firmly in place, you'll learn how to manipulate your routing protocols by implementing Routing Policies. You'll learn how to configure Policy-Options Policy-Statements to implement route matching and filtering and lastly, how to tie all of this together with route redistribution. Throughout it all, you'll have multiple opportunities to practice what you learn with INE's embedded Lab Tasks.

title: Deploying IP Tunnels on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers Deploying IP Tunnels on Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about the basics of GRE and IP-IP Tunnels. You will also learn troubleshooting techniques for GRE and IP-IP Tunnels. Students who want to deepen their understanding of IP Tunnels will benefit from this course.

title: Introduction to Vulnerability Management
description: Vulnerabilities are the cracks in the castle walls of the IT world - if not quickly discovered and properly remediated, they can lead to disaster. Proper understanding of vulnerabilities and knowing how to search for them on your network is a key skill for any cybersecurity professional. This course will walk you through the process of understanding and discovery, starting with the history of vulnerabilities and their outcomes. You'll learn how to use a vulnerability scanner to find vulnerabilities in your environment, how to properly score and classify the ones you find, and how to build comprehensive, yet efficient reports. In addition, you'll know what resources are available for more information on current and new vulnerabilities as they are announced.

title: Deploying BGP on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers deploying BGP on Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about the basics of BGP, eBGP rules vs iBGP rules, Route Reflectors, BGP Path Attributes, Local Preference, AS-Path Prepending, Origin Code, and MED.  Students who want to deepen their understanding of BGP will benefit from this course.

title: Juniper Security Foundations
description: With the increasing reliance on technology, it is becoming more and more essential to secure every aspect of online information and data. The INE's JNCIA-SEC series provides you with the opportunity to practically explore the skills required for entry into the world of Juniper Networks security solutions. This introductory level course will help networking professionals with beginner knowledge of the Juniper Networks Junos OS for SRX devices to obtain their JNCIA-SEC certification.

title: Investigating Juniper's Junos CLI
description: If a Network Administrator is working for an Internet Service Provider they will likely encounter routers, switches, and firewalls from Juniper Networks at some point. Juniper devices are even becoming more popular within Enterprise networks as well. This course will start from ground zero and teach you how to access the Command Line Interface (CLI) of Juniper's Junos Operating System and how to configure various parameters within this CLI. You'll learn a variety of ways of manipulating, renaming, copying, and deleting configuration files. You'll also be exposed to methods of filtering output from common "show" commands for monitoring your Juniper devices and diagnosing issues. We'll also walk you through the process of recovering lost "root" passwords, the software upgrade process, various ways to reboot and power-cycle your Juniper devices, and much, much more. By the time you're done with this course, you'll feel much more comfortable with the CLI so that you can move on to more intermediate and advanced topics.

title: Introduction to Cyber Security Hardening
description: As the world becomes more and more connected and technology becomes even more ingrained into business and home life, properly protecting that infrastructure has become more important than ever before. From Windows servers to workstations, Linux to Mac, and IoT to ICS, it’s critically important that systems be deployed securely to reduce the available attack surface. Security hardening is the process of configuring settings on servers and other devices and systems to make them as secure as possible, while still providing proper business functionality. This course will provide you with an introduction to security hardening across multiple types of systems, as well as briefly discussing more general guidelines and frameworks.

title: Deploying IS-IS on Juniper Routers
description: This course covers understanding and implementing ISIS on Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about single-level ISIS implementation, Multilevel ISIS implementation, ISIS network types, ISIS authentication, route leaking, summarization, and single-topology vs multi-topology.  Students who want to deepen their understanding of ISIS will benefit from this course.

title: Deploying OSPFv2 with Juniper Routers
description: This course covers understanding and implementing OSPFv2 on Juniper Routers. In this course, you will learn about different LSA types, Single Area OSPFv2 implementation, different OSPF network types, DR/BDR election process, path manipulation by changing cost, Inter-Area OSPFv2 implementation, Redistribution and External LSA types, Summarization, Filtering OSPF routes, Virtual-Links, Authentication, Stub Area, Totally Stubby Areas, Not-So-Stubby Areas and Totally NSSA. Students who want to deepen their understanding of OSPFv2 will benefit from this course.

title: Understanding Juniper JunOS OS Architecture
description: Everyone has to start somewhere, and if you're considering working with Juniper devices, or pursuing their JNCIA-Junos certification, this course is for you. In this course you'll be explosed to a high-level overview of the architecture of the Junos Operating System and its major components. We'll start by explaining how the Junos OS is actually an application that relies on an underlying OS of either FreeBSD or Linux, and why this is to your benefit. You'll hear about some of the differences between legacy Junos OS and Junos OS Evolved. You'll be introduced to the Forwarding Plane, Data Plane and Management planes...their relevance to Juniper devices, and where they are implemented. We'll introduce you to the importance of Juniper's Routing Engine (RE) and Packet Forwarding Engines (PFE) and their interactions with each other. And finally you'll learn how Junos OS implements protocol daemons, how to identify problematic daemons, and how to restart them.

title: MPLS for Network Engineers
description: This course covers MPLS from basic to advanced and will allow engineers to deploy and maintain MPLS within the Enterprise or Service Provider environment. In this course, you will learn about the need for MPLS and its mechanics, deploying MPLS manually and using autoconfig, troubleshooting LDP neighborship, LDP authentication, LDP synchronization, LDP session protection, LDP TTL propagation, Intra-AS L3VPN’s, and Inter-AS L3VPN’s using Option A/B/C. Lastly, we will focus on point-to-point L2VPNs. Students who want to deepen their understanding of MPLS will benefit from this course.

title: Remote Access VPN
description: This course covers the Remote Access VPN technologies required for allowing remote employees to connect to the corporate network. In this course, you will learn about Clientless SSL VPN and SSLVPN using Anyconnect. We will also look at FLEXVPN which allows remote employees to connect to the corporate network using Anyconnect with ISKEv2. Students who want to deepen their understanding of Multicast will benefit from this course.

title: Azure PowerShell: The Ultimate Beginners Course
description: Delivered by Microsoft MVPs Mike Pfeiffer, Tim Warner, and Jeff Hicks.

title: Docker JumpStart Virtual Workshop
description: Learn everything you need to know to become proficient with Docker containers and orchestration with Mike Pfeiffer and Dan Wahlin.

title: DevOps Foundations
description: Learn the foundations of DevOps and how to collaborate on projects within your team.

title: Azure Administrator (AZ-104) Exam Prep Course
description: Learn Azure administration with Microsoft MVPs Tim Warner and Mike Pfeiffer and prepare for the Microsoft Azure Administrator (AZ-104) certification exam.

title: Terraform on Azure (2020)
description: Learn how to use Terraform to provision and manage Azure infrastructure in this LIVE virtual workshop event. Discover the patterns and best-practices for writing infrastructure code to manage Azure virtual machines, storage accounts, networking, and more.

title: Terraform on Azure (2021)
description: Embark on a comprehensive journey through the intricacies of Terraform within the Azure ecosystem. This course demystifies the foundational concepts of Terraform, guiding you from the basics of Azure CloudShell to the complexities of advanced HCL (HashiCorp Configuration Language). Gain hands-on experience with Terraform's core functionalities, including configuration files, providers, and state management. Navigate through the critical stages of Init, Plan, Apply, and Destroy, understanding the importance of state files and how to manage them. Master the art of defining and deploying variables, and delve into the modular architecture of Terraform, exploring how to construct, utilize, and source modules. The course culminates in an exploration of advanced HCL features, such as functions, conditions, and dynamic blocks, solidifying your ability to manage and scale Azure infrastructures efficiently. Engage in practical challenges and solutions throughout the course, ensuring a deep, applied understanding of Terraform's capabilities on Azure.

title: Azure Solutions Architect (AZ-30x) Exam Prep Course
description: Learn Azure architecture with Microsoft MVPs Tim Warner and Mike Pfeiffer and prepare for the AZ-303 and AZ-304 certification exams.

title: Azure Certified Developer (AZ-204) Accelerated Exam Prep
description: Join us for this crash course with Microsoft MVPs Tim Warner and Mike Pfeiffer and prepare for the Microsoft Azure Developer (AZ-204) certification exam.

title: Become Ansible Workshop
description: This self-paced on-demand course will show you exactly what you need to know to hit the ground running with Ansible, based on the new book 'Become Ansible' by author Josh Duffney.

title: Azure Functions For DevOps Engineers
description: Learn how to use serverless functions and PowerShell to build, manage, and deploy your own event-driven solutions in the Azure cloud.

title: Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900) Accelerated Exam Prep
