The course also covers the basic unit of cloud Storage - block blobs. Finally, the course looks at content caching options available in Azure

title: Understanding and Implementing MPLS, Traffic Engineering & Segment Routing
description: This course covers MPLS Traffic Engineering basics and the basics of Segment Routing, which is one of the topics in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. In this course, you will learn about LDP, RSVP TE, Segment Routing, Segment Types, Unified MPLS, LDP Sync, LDP Session Protection, FRR, ISIS and OSPF extensions, and also about TI-LFA. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of MPLS LDP and Segment Routing.

title: Azure Development - Compute Solutions
description: There is tremendous momentum for moving application hosting to the cloud. and many organizations will start the journey by shifting workloads to virtual machines running in the cloud. This course covers the compute components in Azure, focusing on working with virtual machines, as well as the basics of containerized solutions, and the fundamental Platform as a Service compute resource, the web app.

title: Microsoft Certified: Azure Developer Associate Exam Preparation - AZ-204
description: Attaining Microsoft's Certified Azure Developer Associate certification requires passing the AZ-204 exam. This course reviews the Microsoft AZ-204 exam and reflects the author's experience taking the exam. The course highlights areas that students need to focus on while studying for the exam, as well as recommendations for taking the exam itself.

title: Cisco SD-WAN Use Design, Cloud & Advanced Features
description: Cisco SD-WAN solutions can be designed in a number of ways, we will explore various use cases to understand the value of different solutions. We will investigate SD-WAN Cloud solutions for connecting branch offices to cloud infrastructure and cloud service providers. Multi-tenancy from a user and service provider perspective will be discussed. Cloud based analysis with vAnalytics will be explained. Finally, we will see how the vManage API works to integrate SD-WAN with other solutions.

title: SD-WAN Configuration & Troubleshooting
description: In Cisco SD-WAN Configuration & Troubleshooting, we start by discussing the two major types of templates and how to use them to deploy 10's or 100's of devices. Cisco SD-WAN supports numerous types of policies, we will explore data, application-aware route, VPN memberships, and others. Finally, we will learn how to troubleshoot and debug the control plane and data plane. At the end of this course, you should understand the basic configuration and troubleshooting of the SD-WAN network.

title: Cisco SD-WAN Fundamentals
description: The Cisco SD-WAN Fundamentals is intended to build an understanding of the SD-WAN architecture and its components. We begin by discussing the Cisco SD-WAN fabric and how it is designed. We will learn about the control plane and how to build and configure it. We will understand the data plane options and why Cisco recommends a VXLAN solution. Finally, we will investigate the Overlay Management Protocol (OMP) and discover that it is much more than just a routing protocol.  At the end of the course, we will know the SD-WAN fundamentals and what it takes to deploy an SD-WAN fabric.

title: Beginning Routing with EIGRP
description: Cisco's Enhanced Interior Gateway Protocol (EIGRP) is categorized as an Interior Gateway Protocol that is used in many networks today.  It is also a routing protocol that you must learn, in order to pass related questions on the Cisco CCNA Certification Exam.  This course will provide you with an introduction to the protocol and teach you everything you need to know (and more) in order to confidently answer any related question you might see when taking your Cisco CCNA Exam. You'll learn topics such as EIGRP Neighborships, Route Advertisement and configuration, viewing the EIGRP Topology Table, and understanding the concepts of Successors and Feasible Successors and much, much more.

title: Date and Time Management with Python
description: This course explains the datetime module, including datetimes, dates, times and timedeltas. It also explains timezones and the pytz module, as well as highlights some higher level libraries like dateutil, arrow, Maya, etc.

title: Python Standard Library
description: This course will summarize the most widely used modules in the Python standard library and provide quick mention of the general purpose of less widely used modules. It will cover the OS tools: sys, os, pathlib, stat, shutil, tempfile; the file formats: csv, zlib, gzip, zipfile, pickle, sqlite3; the programming tools: itertools, functools, operators, collections, dataclass; and the tools for writing scripts: argparse, time, and secrets.

title: Data Center Security
description: Security is an important part of all Data Center designs. In this series we explore Data Center Network Security, Compute Security, and Storage Security with topics such as AAA, First Hop Security (Dynamic ARP Inspection and DHCP Snooping), Control Plane Policing (CoPP), and Port Security, among others.

title: Implementing High Availability
description: This course covers high availability which is one of the topics in the CCNP SPCOR exam. Here in this course, you will learn how to configure etherchannels for obtaining high availability for link failures. You will also learn the difference between static vs protocols. Lastly you will also learn how to configure PAGP and LACP. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of PAGP or LACP.

title: Understanding NAT44, NAT64, 6RD, MAP & DS Lite
description: This course covers understanding NAT44, NAT64, 6RD, Mapping Address and Port, and DS-Lite which is are core topics in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of IPv6 transition techniques.

title: Enterprise & Campus LAN Switching Fundamentals
description: Candidates studying for Cisco's CCNP Enterprise or Cisco's CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure certifications need to be aware of the usage, configuration, monitoring, and troubleshooting of common LAN Switching features. This course will give you that knowledge. In this course, you'll learn about such topics as TCAM and MAC Address-Table usage. The purpose, configuration,  and verification of VLANs, VLAN trunks, VTP, and Etherchannels. You'll also be presented with Cisco IOS commands so you can practice all of these features and become proficient with them. This course is a "must watch" course for anyone preparing to take the Cisco ENCOR exam.

title: Palo Alto Firewall Technologies
description: Securing your enterprise starts with your firewall. Palo Alto Next-Generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This course discusses some of the most valuable technologies available on the Palo Alto platform. In this course you will learn how to tune your policies to identify and allow correct Applications, how to deploy authentication for better control and visibility and how to enhance your system's attack detection capabilities.

title: Troubleshooting Routing Protocols & Connectivity Issues
description: This course covers troubleshooting and establishing connectivity, which is one of the topics in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. Here in this course, you will learn how to troubleshoot OSPF adjacency issues and establish end-to-end connectivity. You will also learn how to troubleshoot ISIS adjacency issues and establish end-to-end connectivity. Lastly you will also learn how to troubleshoot BGP neighborship issues and establish end-to-end connectivity. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of troubleshooting techniques.

title: Understanding, Optimizing & Configuring Border Gateway Protocol
description: This course covers understanding, optimizing and configuring BGP, which is the core topic in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. In this course, you will learn to build EBGP/IBGP neighborship, how route-reflectors work, and BGP Path attribute basics. You will also learn how to do path manipulation in BGP using attributes like Weight, Local Preference, AS-Path, Origin Code and MED. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of BGP.

title: Manage Teams & Policies in Microsoft Teams
description: This INE on-demand course covers managing teams and policies in a Microsoft Teams environment. The course is intended for IT professionals responsible for managing Microsoft Teams, and those seeking the Microsoft 365 Certified: Teams Administrator Associate certification. This course covers creating and managing teams, managing team membership, implementing app policies.

title: Introduction to Microsoft 365: Teams Administrator
description: Microsoft Teams is Microsoft 365's communication and collaboration platform allowing for chat, screen sharing, calling, meetings, file sharing, and more. When you purchase a Microsoft 365 subscription you can get access to this amazing platform to keep your employees communicating and keeping your client relationships moving in the right direction. This course is divided into three sections: plan and configure your environment, communications, and teams and policies. Plan and configure your environment guides admins through Teams deployment and migration, implementing security, and implementing governance and lifecycle management. Communications will delve into managing chat and collaboration experiences, managing meeting experiences, managing phone numbers, and managing the phone system feature of Microsoft Teams. The final section of Teams and Policies will explore managing teams and their membership, implementing policies for Teams apps, as well as monitor and analyze service usage with built in reporting from Microsoft 365. This course covers all facets of Microsoft Teams preparing IT administrators to become a Microsoft 365 Certified: Teams Administrator Associate.

title: Implementing & Optimizing OSPF v2/v3 Protocol
description: This course covers implementing OSPF routing protocol which is the core IGP in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. Here in this course, you will learn OSPF basics, Implementing OSPF with IPv4 and IPv6, LSA Types, Network Types, and Implementing MultiArea OSPF. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of OSPF.

title: Regular Expressions with Python
description:
This course will explain the relevance of regexes in programming, cover their history and background, explain the
fundamentals of regexes in Python, including Match objects, searching, groups, etc. and explain variations like compilation flags and performance considerations.

title: Implementing & Optimizing IS-IS Protocol
description: This course covers implementing Integrated System-Integrated System (ISIS) routing protocol which is the core IGP in the CCNP SPCOR Exam. Here in this course, you will learn ISIS basics, Implementing ISIS with IPv4 and IPv6, Single Topology and MultiTopology. Students who are preparing for the CCNP SPCOR Exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of ISIS.

title: Implement a Microsoft Teams Environment
description: This INE on-demand course covers the planning and configuration of a Microsoft Teams environment. The course is intended for IT professionals responsible for managing Microsoft Teams, and those seeking the Microsoft 365 Certified: Teams Administrator Associate certification. This course covers upgrading from Skype for business, configuring networking, implementing governance, securing access, managing endpoints, and monitoring Teams.

title: Genomic Data Analysis using Python and JupyterLab
description: This course will introduce students to beginner to intermediate level biological data analysis. We will cover the basics of sequence data types, how to interpret the files and associated metadata, and analyze the data using python. This course builds on the data science and python concepts taught in the data science pass.

title: Data Serialization with Python
description: This course will explain different file formats and the modules to process each one of them: JSON, XML, CSV. It will also address binary serialization formats used for numeric computation such as NPZ, Parquet, HDF5, and demonstrate the use of language-neutral formats like JSON and XML to communicate between Python and other systems.

title: Implement Chat, Calling & Meetings in Microsoft Teams
description: This INE on-demand course covers managing communications in a Microsoft Teams environment. The course is intended for IT professionals responsible for managing Microsoft Teams, and those seeking the Microsoft 365 Certified: Teams Administrator Associate certification. This course covers managing chat, meetings, and phone operations. Topics include configuring the policy, access and email integration for a chat; configuring policies for meetings and live events, and managing phone numbers; managing call resources; and setting call policies.

title: SQL Fundamentals: Working with Data
description: This course is designed to introduce learners to the fundamental concepts of working with data in relational database systems.  The course covers a brief introduction to what relational databases are and the language - SQL - designed to work with relational data.  The course then dives into data interaction using SQL to retrieve data, insert data, update data, and delete data.  The course also covers troubleshooting some common SQL issues.

title: Data Center Management & Monitoring
description: Managing and monitoring the network is a necessary part of day 2 operations in the network. In this series we explore the management of NX-OS configurations, and how to monitor the network with protocols such as NetFlow, SNMP, SPAN, and Streaming Telemetry.

title: CCNP ENCOR Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCNP Enterprise Learning Path. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the CCNP ENCOR exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Palo Alto Firewall Policies
description: Securing your enterprise starts with your firewall. Palo Alto Next-Generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This course discusses the most important configuration blocks of the Palo Alto platform: the Policies.

title: Data Center Firmware Management
description: Firmware upgrades are a part of everyday network operations. In this series, you'll see first-hand how to upgrade NX-OS firmware, UCS firmware, and ACI firmware, and learn the differences between disruptive and non-disruptive upgrades.

title: Azure Architect: Design Monitoring
description: This short on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience who design Azure monitoring solutions. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-304 exam and covers logging, auditing, and monitoring of Azure resources.

title: Azure Architect: Design Identity and Security
description: This on-demand course is for IT professionals with Azure experience who design Azure identity and security solutions. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-304 exam and includes Azure AD authentication design, role-based access control including access reviews, resource policy design, identity protection, privileged identity management, Azure blueprints, and application security design. The content is beneficial even for professionals who are not explicitly tasked with designing security solutions.

title: Azure Architect: Design Data Storage
description: This short INE on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience who design data solutions. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-304 exam and covers options for SQL Server solutions in Azure, data encryption at rest and in transit, integrated enterprise data solutions such as Azure Synapse analytics, HDInsight, Azure data lake, Azure data factory, and Azure storage.

title: Applying Data Center ACI Concepts
description: Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) is the workhorse of the modern Cisco Data Center design. In this series, we explore the basic operations and concepts of ACI, including Fabric Initialization, Access Policies, Tenant Policies, and Virtual Machine Manager (VMM) Integration.

title: Azure Security - Managing Security Operations
description: This on-demand course is intended for IT and security professionals who need to understand options for securing resources in the Azure cloud. The course focuses on resources for managing security across Azure subscriptions including Azure monitor, vulnerability scanning, Azure Security Center, and security alerts.

title: Azure Security - Securing Data and Applications
description: This on-demand course is intended for IT and security professionals who need to secure data and applications in the Azure cloud. The course focuses on data security policy, data infrastructure security, encryption of data at rest, application communication encryption, and general data protection using Azure Key Vault.

title: Azure Security - Protecting the Platform
description: This on-demand course is intended for IT and security professionals who need to know how to use the security tools integrated into the Microsoft Azure cloud.  This course focuses on understanding security, privacy, compliance, and trust in Azure.  The course will cover Azure network security, Azure Identity Services, Azure security tools, and features, Azure monitoring and reporting, and privacy, compliance, and data protection standards in Azure.

title: Azure Security - Managing Identity and Access
description: This on-demand course is intended for IT and security professionals who need an overview of identity management in the Azure cloud. The course focuses on the user and application security in Azure, implementing multi-factor authentication, Azure AD privileged identity management, and subscription security.

title: Preparing for the AZ-500: Azure Security Engineer Associate Exam
description: This on-demand course is intended for IT and security professionals who plan on taking the AZ-500 certification exam.  This short course focuses on exam preparation and serves as a roadmap for those planning on taking the AZ-500 certification exam. The course includes exam preparation tips, tips for taking a certification exam, and a roadmap for preparing for each objective domain covered in the exam.

title: CCIE Service Provider v5 Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCIE Service Provider v5.0 Learning Path of courses. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure v1.1 Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure v1.1 Learning Path. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Palo Alto Firewall Essentials
description: Securing your enterprise starts with your firewall. Palo Alto Next-Generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This introductory-level course focuses on the fundamental aspects of the Palo Alto platforms, such as its characteristics, management, or initialization.

title: Azure Architect: Infrastructure Management and Monitoring
description: This INE on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience who need to dive deeper into infrastructure and monitoring. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-303 exam and covers topics including Azure AD authentication and Identity, cloud infrastructure monitoring, Azure storage accounts, virtual machines, and virtual networks. This course provides a wide scope of detailed implementation information for those who will be designing and building infrastructure solutions in Azure.

title: Azure Architect: Management and Security Solutions
description: This on-demand course is for IT professionals with Azure experience looking to learn more about key management solutions in Azure. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-303 exam and covers topics including governance, networking load balancing and security, application security, business continuity, and virtual machine migration and update management.

title: Azure Architect: Application Solutions
description: This INE on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience who need to deepen their understanding of Azure application solutions. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-303 exam and covers two critical topic areas - application services and container services. This course provides a wide scope of detailed implementation information for those who will be designing and building application solutions in Azure.

title: Azure Architect: Data Platforms
description: This short INE on-demand course is for IT professionals with Azure experience who are designing SQL server-based, or NoSQL-based data solutions. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-303 exam and covers options for deploying scaling and accessing SQl server in Azure as well as NoSQL options including tabular storage and Cosmos DB.

title: Azure Architect: Design Business Continuity
description: This INE on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience responsible for business continuity solutions in Azure. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-304 exam and covers topics including site recovery, data retention, and scalability, and availability of applications. This course guidance for protecting both Azure and on-premises workloads with Azure site recovery.

title: Azure Architect: Design Infrastructure
description: This on-demand course is designed for IT professionals with Azure experience who design workload solutions based on Azure infrastructure. The course aligns with objectives for the AZ-304 exam and covers virtual machine deployment, and management; platform services such as web applications, function apps, and logic apps; container solutions; virtual networking deployment, connectivity, and security; workload migration, and API management. This course provides a wide scope of detailed implementation information for those who will be designing and building solutions in Azure.

title: CCNP ENARSI Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCNP Enterprise Learning Path. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the CCNP ENARSI exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Applying Data Center Overlay Protocols & Packet Flow Analysis
description: Overlay Protocols allow applications to transparently communicate at Layer 2 and Layer 3, which is a key function of any Data Center design. This series covers two of these main overlay protocols, Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV), and Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN).

title: CCIE Data Center Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCIE Data Center Learning Path of courses. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Applying Data Center Switching Protocols
description: Switching is the backbone on which Data Center networks are built. This series covers core switching concepts such as Spanning-Tree Protocol (STP), Rapid Spanning-Tree Protocol (RSTP), STP Features, Port-Channels, and Virtual Port-Channels on Cisco's Nexus NX-OS Operating System.

title: CCIE Security v6 Exam Review
description: The CCIE Security v6 Exam Review was designed to be part-lecture and part-hands-on technology-oriented training covering the most important aspects of the current v6 exam blueprint. It will be especially useful for advanced students, who are looking to refine and consolidate their technical knowledge into an organized and effective strategy required to pass the CCIE Security v6 lab exam. This class is taught by an expert INE instructor, Piotr Kaluzny.

title: Global Dial Plan
description: This course covers basics to advanced level topics related to Dial Plan in the Telephony environment. Here in this course, you will learn Dial Plan Fundamentals, Elements of Dial Plan, Traditional Dial Plan, Traditional vs Globalized Dial Plans, Outbound Dialing, Inbound. Dialing, SME and much more. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the Dial Plan.

title: CCIE Collaboration Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCIE Collaboration v3.1 Learning Path of courses. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Applying Data Center Routing Protocols
description: Routing is the core function of all networks, and Data Centers are no different. This series covers the application of Routing Protocols in a Data Center environment, specifically covering Open Shortest Path First (OSPFv2 and OSPFv3), Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM), Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD), and the First Hop Redundancy Protocols (FHRPs) on Cisco's Nexus NX-OS Operating System.

title: CCNA 200-301 Exam Review
description: This course serves as a final review of the various topics you've studied as you've progressed through INE's CCNA 200-301 Learning Path of courses. Meant to be viewed perhaps two-to-three weeks prior to sitting for your actual CCNA 200-301 exam, this course provides a final overview of many of the major topics covered in the exam so you can ascertain those last few topics for which you need to polish your skills.

title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) Traces
description: This course covers topics related to troubleshooting in the UCM environment. Here in this course, you will learn how to take traces using RTMT and also how to analyze "debug ccsip messages" on a CUBE router. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course.

title: Intercluster Lookup Service (ILS)
description: This course covers topics related to Intercluster Lookup Service. Here in this course, you will learn about SIP URI Dialing Intracluster, Inter-Cluster URI Dialing without ILS, Inter-Cluster  URI Dialing with ILS and much more. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the Intercluster Lookup Service.

title: Introduction to CCIE Collaboration
description: This course covers topics needed to study and pass the CCIE Collaboration v3.1 Lab Exam. Here in this course, you will learn what to expect in the lab exam? What should you study? How should you study? and How to practice to prepare for the CCIE Collaboration v3 lab exam. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course.

title: Data Cleaning with Pandas
description:
Data Cleaning is fundamental for every Data Science project. Regardless of where you're getting the data from, it's never perfect. Some invalid values, some odd types, outliers or statistically insignificant values will arise at some point.

This course will teach you all the common issues found with messy data, and how to fix it with simple and clear techniques.

title: Network Services
description: This course covers topics related to Cisco Network Services in the Telephony environment. Here in this course, you will learn DHCP on CUCM, DHCP on Cisco IOS, CDP/LLDP, VLANs/DOT1Q, NTP, Phone Registration, Phone View Setup, UTILS Commands, DBReplication and Repair and much more. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course.

title: Cisco Unified Border Element (CUBE)
description: This course covers basic to advanced level of the Cisco CUBE.  Clients who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Cisco CUBE.

title: Identity Services Engine (ISE)
description:
Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) is recognized as one of the industry's leading integrated and open security solutions. It helps provide comprehensive visibility of all entities using the network (including users, devices, and applications), as well as technology integration, automation, and granular policy control. ISE reduces the network management complexity and provides your organization with a single centralized platform to automate context-aware access to connect trusted devices with trusted services.

By completing this course, you will understand and know how to use most of the widely adopted and valued Identity Services Engine features and technologies, such as Device Administration, Network Access Control or Profiling.

title: Unity Connection
description: This course covers basic to advanced level of the Cisco Unity Connection.  Here in this course, you will learn Unity Connection pre-setup, SIP integration between CUCM and Unity Connection, SCCP integration between CUCM and Unity Connection. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the Unity Connection.

title: Dynamic Multipoint VPN (DMVPN) - Deep Dive
description: Dynamic Multipoint VPN (DMVPN) Deep Dive approaches the technology in a task-oriented format that delves deep into show commands, debug commands, packet captures, and technology explanations to prepare you for whatever situation you face in the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam related to DMVPN. Topics covered include Troubleshooting IPsec Phase 1, Troubleshooting IPsec Phase 2, Access-List Filtering, Troubleshooting Multicast over DMVPN, Troubleshooting EIGRP over DMVPN, and Troubleshooting OSPF over DMVPN, just to name a few.

title: Cisco Unified Communications IM and Presence (IM&P)
description: This course covers basic to advanced levels of the Cisco IM&P.  Here in this course, you will learn importing users from LDAP, Persistent Chat, UC Service and Service Profile, Troubleshooting Jabber login, Presence status and much more. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the IM&P.

title: Introducing VPNs
description: Exclusive content for the CCNA 200-301 Learning Path.

title: Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) - Deep Dive
description: Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) Deep Dive approaches the technology in a task-oriented format that delves deep into show commands, debug commands, packet captures, and technology explanations to prepare you for whatever situation you face in the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam related to MPLS. Topics covered include Troubleshooting LDP Adjacencies, Troubleshooting LDP Advertisements, Troubleshooting VPNv4 Route Reflectors, Troubleshooting OSPF PE-CE Routing, Troubleshooting EIGRP PE-CE Routing, Troubleshooting BGP PE-CE Routing, and Troubleshooting MPLS Load Balancing, just to name a few.

title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express (UCCX)
description: This course covers basic to advanced level of the Cisco Contact Center Express.  Here in this course, you will learn UCCX basics, Integrating CUCM and UCCX, One-Button Login with Finesse Setup. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the UCCX.

title: Cisco Meeting Server (CMS)
description: As part of the CCIE Collaboration v3 learning path, this course dives deep into topics needed to pass the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab Exam. This course covers basic to advanced level of the Cisco Meeting Server.  Here in this course, you will learn CMS basics, GUI Access to CMS, Importing Users from LDAP, API Calls to CMS, Creating coSpaces, Rendezvous Conferencing and Ad hoc Conferencing. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the Cisco Meeting Server.

title: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) - Deep Dive
description: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Deep Dive approaches the technology in a task-oriented format that delves deep into show commands, debug commands, packet captures, and technology explanations to prepare you for whatever situation you face in the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam related to BGP. Topics covered include Troubleshooting BGP Peerings, Troubleshooting TCP, Troubleshooting BGP NLRI Advertisements, Troubleshooting BGP Route Reflectors, Troubleshooting BGP Full Mesh, Troubleshooting BGP Next-Hops, BGP Bestpath Selection, and BGP Traffic Engineering, BGP Communities, BGP Outbound Route Filtering (ORF), BGP Conditional Advertisement, BGP Conditional Route Injection, BGP Prefix Independent Convergence (PIC), and BGP Multipath, just to name a few.

title: Expressway
description: This course covers basic to advanced level of the Cisco Expressway.  Here in this course, you will learn Expressway basics, Intrusion Protection, Expressway solution, MRA, B2B, Maintenance and Bandwidth Control on the Expressway. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Collaboration v3 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Voice or Telephony environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of the Cisco Expressway Solution.

title: Cisco Network Access Security
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Reading Data with Python and Pandas
description: Every data science project begins with importing data. In this course, you’ll learn the basics and beyond, starting with how data is imported using Python and Pandas. From there, you’ll focus on reading external data into Pandas data structures, using different methods. You’ll also be able to deal with data that contains wrong delimiters, encoding, or quote charts. We’ll cover all the steps, options, and issues you need to be aware of to successfully handle the data you’re working with.

title: Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) - Deep Dive
description: Enhanced Interior Gateway Protocol (EIGRP) Deep Dive approaches the technology in a task-oriented format that delves deep into show commands, debug commands, packet captures, and technology explanations to prepare you for whatever situation you face in the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam related to EIGRP. Topics covered include Troubleshooting EIGRP Adjacencies, Troubleshooting EIGRP Advertisements, EIGRP Filtering, Unequal Cost Load Balancing, EIGRP Add-Path, Control Plane Policing, Policy Routing, and ACL Filtering just to name a few.

title: Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) - Deep Dive
description: Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Deep Dive approaches the technology in a task-oriented format that delves deep into show commands, debug commands, packet captures, and technology explanations to prepare you for whatever situation you face in the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam related to OSPF. Topics covered include Troubleshooting OSPF Adjacencies, Troubleshooting OSPF Advertisements, OSPF Authentication, OSPF Network Types, OSPF Area Types, OSPF Forwarding Addresses, OSPF NSSA Filtering, OSPF Virtual Links, OSPF Path Selection Manipulation, and OSPF Summarization, just to name a few.

title: Intro to Pandas for Data Analysis
description: Pandas is the most popular library for Data Science in Python. In this course we'll take it to the next level, explaining all the fundamental data structures, including Data Frames, Series, Indices, Plotting and more.

title: Introduction to Enterprise Network Design Principles
description: Proper network design is the first step for all successful network deployments. This section explores various campus design principles such as layer 2 access and layer 3 access, and important functional differences between them. These designs are the basis for building the network and for all upper-layer protocols.

title: Enterprise Wireless Concepts & Implementation
description: So you know a little about Wi-Fi.  You know what an SSID is.  You’re familiar with the terms access point, controller and 802.11n.  If you want to take your knowledge to the next level, this course is for you.  In this course, you’ll learn the nuts-and-bolts of how electromagnetic energy is manipulated to create radiofrequency. You’ll learn details of Wi-Fi modulation and encoding and what a “chipping sequence” is. We will discuss RF power and how it can be measured using Decibels, dBi, dBm and the “rule of 10s and 3s”. You’ll then be exposed to some of the ways that 802.11n, ac, and ax have increased Wi-Fi throughput exponentially in the past several years.  We’ll move on to lightweight access points, how they discover their WLAN controllers and how controller failover is achieved. You’ll also learn about the components that make up antennas, different types of antennas and how to measure their gain (or loss) using Polar Plots. We’ll teach you about WLAN Roaming, Web authentication, 802.1x with EAP…and a whole lot more!

title: Introduction to CCIE Service Provider
description: This course covers implementing Interior Gateway Protocols like IS-IS and OSPF which is the core IGP in the Lab Exam. This course also focuses on BGP, MPLS, MPLS TE, L3VPN's, Segment Routing, Multicast VPN's, Carrier Ethernet, Network Assurance, and Network Automation. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Azure Business Continuity Services for Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources.  This course focuses on business continuity services that are available within Azure.  The course focuses on the capabilities provided by the Azure Site Recovery service.  This includes backups for both Azure-based and on-premises computers as well as real-time protection through site recovery replication and failover.

title: Network Security Automation
description: This course focuses on the implementation of Security automated solutions. APIs of certain security appliances are also discussed, including their capabilities, characteristics, and components.

title: Endpoint Services with ISE
description: Cisco's flagship Identity Management solution, Identity Services Engine (ISE), already has a well-established position in the networking industry. Its capabilities are known to simplify the delivery of consistent, highly secure access control across wired, wireless, and VPN connections. This course focuses on additional functionality offered by this powerful platform - learn how to use ISE to secure your endpoints with Client Provisioning, Posture, and more.

title: Designing and Implementing Border Gateway Protocol
description: This course covers implementing BGP which is the main section in the Lab Exam. Here in this course, you will learn IBGP, EBGP, MPBGP, BGP route-policy enforcement and BGP path attributes. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Overview and Preparation for Microsoft certification exam AZ-103
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who plan on taking the AZ-103 certification exam.  This short course focuses on exam preparation and serves as a roadmap for those planning on taking the AZ-103 certification exam. The course includes exam preparation tips, tips for taking a certification exam, and a roadmap for preparing for each objective domain covered in the exam.

title: Implementing Interior Gateway Protocol
description: This course covers implementing Interior Gateway Protocols like IS-IS and OSPF which is the core IGP in the Lab Exam. Here in this course, you will learn to design and implement OSPF, OSPFv3, IS-IS with IPv4, and IS-IS with IPv6. Here we will also focus on Segment Routing control-pane with IS-IS and OSPF. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Azure Identity Management for Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources.  This course focuses on managing identities with Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). The course includes managing Azure AD, managing Azure AD identities, implementing hybrid identities, and implementing multi-factor identification.

title: Optimizing IGP Route Redistribution
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Implementing & Troubleshooting OSPF
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Implementing & Troubleshooting EIGRP
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Implementing Loop Prevention Mechanisms
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Gateway Redundancy With FHRP
description: Gateway Redundancy with FHRP provides a clear, practical introduction to the three major First Hop Redundancy Protocols—HSRP, VRRP, and GLBP—and how they ensure resilient default-gateway availability in enterprise networks. Through structured explanations and configuration-focused examples, the course explores each protocol’s purpose, election processes, state machines, timers, authentication options, load-sharing capabilities, and failure-detection mechanisms. You’ll learn how these redundancy protocols operate, how to implement them on Cisco devices, how features like object tracking and preemption influence failover behavior, and how to verify proper functionality using real IOS commands. This course delivers the essential knowledge needed to design, configure, and troubleshoot reliable gateway redundancy in modern Layer-3 campus environments.

title: Hardware & Software Switching Mechanisms
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: IPv4 Routing With OSPFv2
description: Exclusive content for the CCNA 200-301 Learning Path.

title: Implementing Interswitch Connectivity Using VLANs & VLAN Trunks
description: Exclusive content for the CCNA 200-301 Learning Path.

title: Traffic Monitoring with SPAN (Webinar)
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: REST API Security
description: Exclusive content for the CCNP Enterprise Learning Path.

title: Access-Control Lists
description: Exclusive content for the CCNA 200-301 Learning Path.

title: Introduction to IPv6
description: Exclusive content for the CCNA 200-301 Learning Path.

title: VXLAN BGP EVPN Configuration & Verification Review
description: Exclusive content for the CCIE Service Provider v5.0 Learning Path.

title: E-VPN
description: Exclusive content for the CCIE Service Provider v5.0 Learning Path.

title: FortiGate Policies
description: With a constantly expanding attack surface, enterprises are looking for proven protection, without limiting the speed or capacity of network operations. FortiGate Next-generation Firewall is recognized as one of the industry's leading security systems that you can easily deploy and operate. This course focuses on the axis around which most of the other features of the FortiGate firewall revolve - the Policies.

title: Perimeter & Network Security Engineering
description: The perimeter of a network is often the most attacked area, and sometimes the most overlooked. With the introduction of even more cloud-hosted resources, this line is becoming more blurred every day. In addition, a properly secured internal network is a key backbone to an overall secure IT infrastructure. This course will introduce you to properly configuring and securing not only the network perimeter but also your internal network infrastructure. We’ll start with edge firewalls, and work through switches, routers, wireless infrastructure, printers, and more. Learn not only how to secure your network, but also WHY certain security practices are needed.

title: Azure Storage Management for Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources.  This course focuses on managing data storage.  The course will cover storage accounts, moving data into and out of Azure storage, using the Azure file services, and implementing Azure backup.

title: Introducing NETCONF & RESTCONF for Enterprise Networks
description: SNMP is a great tool for obtaining statistics about your network such as packet counts, interface status and overall device health.  And the Command Line Interface (CLI) has been used for decades for configuring devices.  But as Network Programmability and Automation become more than simply buzzwords both SNMP and the CLI fall short in providing a vendor-neutral, standardized way to represent data and securely configure devices.  This is where YANG, NETCONF, and RESTCONF come into play.  This course is designed to help you understand what role NETCONF, RESTCONF, and YANG play in this emerging realm of Network Automation and Programmability.  From an introductory session on Data Modeling, you’ll learn what YANG Modules are, where they can be found and how to view them.  We’ll then move into how NETCONF and RESTCONF are used as transport mechanisms to securely deliver data that meets YANG standards. So if you’ve wanted to learn what YANG, NETCONF, and RESTCONF are…this is the course for you!

title: Implementing Control Plane, Management Plane & Infrastructure Security
description: This course covers Infrastructure Security, implementing Management Plane & Control Plane Security. You will learn uRPF, ACL, RTBH, Router Hardening, and device management techniques like SSH, VTY, Logging, SNMP, and AAA, Control Plane Protection techniques, Routing Protocol authentication, LDP authentication, BGP prefix-based filtering, BGP attribute-based filtering, and BGP RPKI. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Azure Virtual Machine Management for Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources.  This course focuses on managing virtual machine workloads.  The course will cover provisioning Windows and Linux virtual machines, automating deployments, managing existing virtual machines, and managing virtual machine backups.

title: Intro to Scientific Computing with NumPy
description:
NumPy was the library that got started the Data Science / Python revolution. In this course we'll explore all the fundamental concepts it introduced: low level bindings (C, Fortran), multidimensional arrays, vectorized operations, etc.

The final project will involve matrix processing and a lot of thinking writing a Sudoku Solver!

title: Network Services
description: This series focuses on Network Services and System Management topics such as the First Hop Redundancy Protocols HSRP, VRRP, & GLBP, NTP, DHCP, NAT, VRF Aware NAT, IP SLA, Netflow, SNMP, and Syslog just to name a few.

title: IPv6 Routing
description: This series focuses on IPv6 with topics such as IPv6 Addressing, IPv6 Routing Protocols, EIGRPv6, OSPFv3, BGP for IPv6, and IPv6 over DMVPN just to name a few.

title: Dynamic Multipoint VPN (DMVPN)
description: This series focuses on Dynamic Multipoint VPN  with topics such as DMVPN Phase 1, 2, and 3, and IPsec over DMVPN just to name a few.

title: Traffic Analysis with Netflow
description: SNMP is a great tool for obtaining statistics about your network such as packet counts, interface status and overall device health.  But SNMP falls short if one desires visibility into more granular detail about the type of data flowing through your network.  NetFlow was introduced by Cisco to solve that problem. In this course, you’ll learn how NetFlow is able to sort data flowing through an interface into unique flows, obtain statistics about those flows, and export those flows to a NetFlow Collector.  You’ll learn about the fundamental concepts behind NetFlow such as NetFlow Records, NetFlow Cache, NetFlow Monitors, and NetFlow Exporters.  You’ll learn how to configure NetFlow using both Original and Flexible NetFlow IOS commands.  And you’ll learn how to restrict the quantity of data collected by NetFlow by using optional NetFlow Samplers and Input Filters.  If you’ve ever wanted to learn more about NetFlow and how it works, this is the course for you!

title: Quality of Service (QoS)
description: This series focuses on Quality of Service (QoS), with topics such as the Hierarchical Queueing Framework (HQF), Classification & Marking, Traffic Shaping, Traffic Policing, Congestion Management, and Congestion Avoidance, just to name a few.

title: Network Security
description: This series focuses on Switch and Router Security, including topics such as AAA, Control Plane Policing, Switch Access Lists, Port-Based Traffic Control, and First Hop Security just to name a few.

title: Understanding Multicast VPN
description: This course covers implementing Multicast. Here in this course, you will learn PIM-SM, PIM-SSM, PIM-BIDIR, Auto-RP, BSR, MSDP, MLDP, and P2MP RSVP-TE. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Cisco Umbrella
description: Cisco Umbrella is an advanced DNS inspection cloud-based platform meant to provide the first line of defense against threats on the Internet. This course discusses different Umbrella components, its configuration and deployment scenarios.

title: Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP)
description: This series focuses on using the Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP) as the IGP of choice, with topics such as EIGRP Classic vs. Named Mode, Path Selection,  Traffic Engineering, Authentication, Summarization, Stub Routing, and Route Filtering, just to name a few.

title: Routing Concepts
description: This series focuses on Routing Concepts such as Static Routing, Reliable Static Routing with IP SLA, and Policy Based Routing (PBR).

title: Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)
description: This series focuses on using the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) to route between Autonomous Systems (ASes), with topics such as BGP Peering, iBGP vs. EBGP Rules, Full Mesh, Route Reflection, Confederation, Next-Hop Processing, NLRI Origination, and modifying Bestpath Selection, just to name a few.

title: Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS)
description: This series focuses on Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS), with topics such as Label Distribution Protocol (LDP), Layer 3 VPNs, PE-CE Routing with OSPF, EIGRP, and BGP, and MPLS Load Balancing, just to name a few.

title: Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)
description: This series focuses on using Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) as the IGP of choice, with topics such as OSPF Areas, Troubleshooting Adjacencies, Network Types, Virtual Links, Stub Areas, Path Selection, Summarization, Authentication, and Route Filtering, just to name a few.

title: Multicast
description: This series focuses on IPv4 Multicast, with topics such as PIM Sparse Mode, Troubleshooting RPF Failures, Auto RP, BSR, Anycast, MSDP, Source Specific Multicast (SSM), Bidirectional PIM (BIDIR), and Layer 2 Multicast, just to name a few.

title: Switched Campus
description: This series focuses on Switched Campus topics, such as VLANs, Trunking, VTP, and Spanning-Tree Protocol.

title: Azure Virtual Network Management for Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources.  This course focuses on managing virtual networks. The course includes virtual network connectivity - both within Azure and with on-premises networks, managing networks, implementing name resolution, securing network communication, load balancing, and troubleshooting networks.

title: Data Encoding Formats
description: Inter-software communication requires a common language to understand each other and represent complex objects as a series of bits. This course illustrates some of the most commonly used data formats (XML, JSON, YAML) and the differences between them.

title: Data Center Security Features
description: This series focuses on Data Center Security Features, such as filtering with ACLs, First Hop Security Protocols, Port Security, Private VLANs, and Role-Based Access Control just to name a few.

title: Data Center Network Services
description: This series focuses on Data Center Network Services, such as SPAN & ERSPAN, Syslog, SNMP, and Policy Based Routing (PBR) just to name a few.

title: Network Programmability Foundation
description: Programming becomes one of the basic skills of a modern network engineer. This course walks you through the fundamental programming concepts using the Python programming language and covers all relevant topics, such as RESTful APIs or data models.

title: Data Center Quality of Service
description: This series focuses on Data Center QoS, such as Data Center Bridging Exchange (DCBX), QoS on Nexus 5000 & UCS, and Control Plane Policing just to name a few.

title: Introduction to CCIE Security v6.1
description: INE's CCIE Security v6.1 Technologies video course covers all fundamental or advanced topics and technologies you will need to know to pass the Cisco's CCIE Security v6.1 lab exam. This module provides an overview of the entire video series, discusses exam changes, requirements, hardware/software blueprints, and supplies students with a proven and effective test-taking strategy.

title: Azure Subscription and Resource Management for Azure Administrators
description: This on-demand course is intended for Azure Administrators and IT professionals who need in-depth knowledge and experience managing core Azure resources. This course focuses on managing resources at the highest level.  The course will cover subscription management, monitoring and alerting, managing resources, and managing access through role-based access control.

title: Enhancing Network Operations With QoS
description:
Computer networks are constantly in a state of flux. Their links
can be perfectly fine one moment, and the next moment
congested and dropping packets. For this reason QoS (Quality
of Service) as a set of features is mandatory so that you can
manage these times of congestion. This course is an
introductory course into the world of QoS. In this course, you’ll
learn about what makes buffers different than queues and how
QoS gives you control over queues. You’ll be exposed to the
concept of QoS classification and how this can be done at
either Layer-2 or Layer-3 of the OSI model. And you’ll learn
about many other QoS concepts such as Policing, Shaping,
Scheduling and Queuing.

title: Virtualization Fundamentals
description: Virtualization is here to stay. Whether it be virtualized servers, routers, firewalls or desktops, it seems that in today’s world more and more computing devices are becoming virtualized. Terms like VMware, virtual machines, hypervisors, and virtual switches are seen in more and more documents and websites…but what if this terminology is completely foreign to you?  Are you new to the world of virtualization and hoping to find a good place to start your journey?  Then this course is for you.  Learning about the fundamentals of virtualization starting with the problems solved by this technology and progressing you through various ways that virtualization is accomplished. You’ll learn about the differences between Type-1 and Type-2 Hypervisors, how Virtual Switches can be used to segment virtual machines, how cloud-based versus on-premises virtual machine hosting can influence your decision and a whole lot more! You’ll even see a demonstration of how you can experiment with virtualization using a Type-2 Hypervisor and Guest Operating System that are all completely free of charge! Join us in this course by INE, Virtualization Fundamentals.

title: Understanding Basic BGP
description: This course covers implementing BGP which is the main section in the Lab Exam. Here in this course, you will learn BGP basics, Peer neighborships, and BGP path selection. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Understanding Basic Routing Technologies
description: This course covers implementing Interior Gateway Protocols like IS-IS and OSPF which is the core IGP in the Lab Exam. Here in this course, you will learn OSPF basics, OSPFv3 basics, IS-IS with IPv4 basics, and IS-IS with IPv6 basics. Students who are preparing for the CCIE Service Provider v5 Lab exam or professionals who are working in the Service Provider environment will benefit from this course, as will anyone who wants to deepen their understanding of Service Provider Infrastructure.

title: Essentials of Network Address Translation (NAT)
description: Chances are very likely that whether you are working from home, within a campus, or at the office, NAT is translating your packets, and you don’t even know it. Network Address Translation is pervasive in today’s world, and if you want to know more about this technology, how it works, and how you can configure it using Cisco IOS, this course is for you! In this course, you’ll learn about the various problems that were solved by NAT, the three different types of NAT: Static NAT, Dynamic NAT, and PAT (also called “NAT Overloading”), and how to configure and monitor them all!

title: Network Monitoring With SNMP & SYSLOG
description: You have finally finished provisioning and configuring your network.  Now, how do you know that it is operating at its peak efficiency?  How will you know if there are problems in your network before your employees start to yell at you?  Welcome to the world of network monitoring with SNMP and Syslog.  Virtually every network monitoring platform today relies on the Simple Network Management Protocol to extract data from your network to determine its current health. Syslog is used along with SNMP to alert you to conditions, warnings and events as they happen. This course will introduce you to both protocols.  You’ll learn of the various SNMP versions, message types, and security models. You’ll learn IOS commands to enable SNMP on your router or switch. And you’ll learn how Syslog works, its severity levels, facility levels, and methods of exporting Syslog message to an external server.

title: Switching Security Features
description:
In today’s world of increasing network-based attacks, being familiar with multiple methods of security is a must for any network engineer. This course will teach you about three forms of network security that can be implemented on switches: Port Security, DHCP Snooping, and Dynamic ARP Inspection.
You’ll learn what types of attacks these features were designed to thwart, how to configure them, and how to monitor these features. You’ll also see a live demonstration in a Cisco lab environment of these features in action. Lastly, you’ll also be introduced to using AAA to protect the Management Plane of your switches
and routers.

title: The Rapid PVST+ Spanning-Tree Protocol
description:
If you have a layer-2 switched topology containing several
switches with multiple redundant links...you have the possibility
of bridging loops. Fortunately, virtually every switch on the
market defaults to running the Spanning-Tree Protocol to
remove those loops. But don’t you want to know how this
protocol actually works? This course will teach you the details
of the Rapid Spanning-Tree Protocol (RSTP) starting with an
explanation about why bridging loops are bad and then diving
into the details about how RSTP prevents such loops. You’ll
also learn the Cisco IOS commands that enable you to control
RSTP even to the extent of performing per-VLAN load-
balancing.

title: Understanding DHCP, DNS & NTP Services
description:
Virtually every network in existence is an IP-based network, and
to utilize that network, devices need IP addresses and other
critical IP-based information. This information is typically
obtained in a dynamic nature via the Dynamic Host
Configuration Protocol (DHCP). This course will introduce you
to DHCP, its operation, and how to verify its functionality on
client devices. You’ll also be given an overview of the Domain
Name Service (DNS) which is critical for allowing web browsing
as well as the Network Time Protocol which is used to
synchronize time-and-date information between network
devices and servers.

title: An Overview Of Wi-Fi Components & Architectures
description: An aspect of implementing any Wi-Fi network is understanding the components of that network by their names and roles. This course will present you with the roles and functions of Wi-Fi Access Points, Controllers, as well as understanding (from Cisco's perspective) different types of Wi-Fi architectures.

title: Jumping Into Wi-Fi Security
description: Wireless LANs are almost everywhere. However, without some form of Wi-Fi security, anything you send across that WLAN is visible for all to see. This course will give you exposure to some of the most common forms of Wi-Fi security and how they work including WPA, WPA2, and WPA3.  You'll learn about how Wi-Fi encryption can protect your data and see how to actually configure WLAN security on an Access Point's GUI using WPA2 with a Pre-Shared Key.

title: Introduction to Networking Technologies
description: So you've heard that there are jobs out there in the "Computer Networking" field and this has sparked your interest.  However, you don't really know anything about this topic and are wondering what resource you should turn to, to obtain some basic information.  Look no further, this course is for you! This course starts by answering the question, "What is a computer network" and from there you'll learn about a wide variety of terms and definitions.  You'll learn what common networking components are (such as routers, switches, and firewalls) and what they do. You'll learn how to count in binary and hexadecimal (standard skills for any aspiring Network Engineer). You'll even learn about Power Over Ethernet (PoE) and how this technology is helping to push networking devices into places that they could never go before! So if you're looking for an introduction to networking technologies, you've come to the right place!

title: Introduction to IPv4, TCP & UDP
description: There are billions and billions of devices connected to networks today, and each one of them is running the TCP/IP stack. As a Network Engineer, knowledge of how IPv4, TCP, and UDP operate is a must, and this course will give you that knowledge. You'll learn about the historic origins of the Internet Protocol, the structure of IPv4 addresses, the details of each of the fields within an IPv4 header and then proceed to learn about the differences between UDP and TCP. You'll also learn how to view the IPv4 information in your own system whether it be Windows-based, Mac or a Linux device.

title: Intro to Databases with Python
description: This course will teach you the fundamentals of Databases, including how to query your data using SQL as well as how to insert, delete, and update it. The course follows a Python-first approach, communicating with Databases from your Python programs.

title: File Management & HTTP
description: This course teaches you how to manage files for all your Data requirements. You'll learn how to create files, read files or directories, iterate file systems, and more. As in Unix-like systems, everything is a file. Using a similar structure, we'll be able to pull data from other sources.

title: Object Oriented Programming with Python
description: In Python, everything is an object. OOP is usually one of the most complicated topics to master, given the heavy conceptual load it carries. This course will take you from the very basics (the definition of an object and a class) to the most advanced concepts, such as multiple inheritance and polymorphism.

title: Exceptions with Python
description: The quality of a Python program is limited to its exception management. If you're not aware of an exceptional edge case, your data pipeline could blow up in the middle of processing, leaving you forced to start over. Creating your own exceptions to signal unwanted states in your code is the optimal approach when building scalable models.

title: Functional Programming with Python
description: Functional programming is the foundation of Data Management and pipelining. It's key to building workflows of data transformations (map operations) and filters (filter operations).

title: Modules and Packages with Python
description: Do you need to read JSON or CSV data? Do you need to work with HTTP, APIs, or XML? Python has a module for that. It's often said that Python comes with batteries included". That's because Python contains a huge number of supporting libraries and modules already 'builtin'. Even if your required module is not 'builtin', it's extremely simple to install. This course will also cover virtualenvs, the pip commands, and third party modules."

title: Python Collections
description: Learning how to use Python Collections is fundamental for understanding Data Science workflows. The same principles you use with 'builtin' collections will be applied to more advanced structures from Data Analysis libraries (such as pandas DataFrames, numpy arrays, and Spark DataFrames).

title: Intro to Programming with Python
description:
Python is the most popular programming language for Beginner Developers. It also happens to be the most popular language in Data Science. 

This course focuses on the fundamentals of Python programming and will get you started on the right foot.

title: Azure Architecture Design Advanced Topics
description: This course is intended for Azure architects, developers, and administrators who are preparing for the AZ-301 certification exam or are looking for deep coverage of select Azure topics. This course includes advanced topics on Azure identity and security, business continuity in Azure, and infrastructure management in Azure. Topics range from details on OAuth and OpenID security protocols to configuring and executing site recovery from an on-premises VMWare environment to Azure.

title: AZ-301 Microsoft Azure Architect Design Review and Preparation
description: The Azure Architecture Expert learning path is designed to help you gain the knowledge you need to be an Azure architect and to achieve the Microsoft Certified Azure Solution Architect Expert certification.  This short course serves as an overview of the AZ-301 exam and a guidepost for beginning the certification preparation process.  The AZ-301 exam focuses on designing and optimizing solutions based on Azure technologies.

title: Designing Azure Deployment, Migration & Integration
description: This course is intended for Azure architects, developers, and administrators who need to design deployment, migration, and integration strategies in Azure to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-301 certification exam. This dives deep into the deployment of infrastructure, container, and platform workloads, migration of workloads from an on-premises environment to Azure, and service integration strategies for cloud-based and hybrid environments.

title: Introducing Network Programmability & Automation
description: This course will introduce you to the fundamental concepts and platforms that are involved with network automation and programmability, focused primarily on Cisco's approach and solution. Starting with an overview of the traditional methods of network management (and their challenges) we'll then progress through such topics as the goals of automation, common languages, tools and protocols used for automation, the imperative and declarative approaches to SDN implementations, how SDN provides the ability to separate the Control Plane from the Data Plane, an introduction to Cisco's DNA Center solution, an introduction to APIs with emphasis placed on REST APIs, overviews of Ansible, Chef, and Puppet as well as a whole lot more.

title: CCIE Security v5.0 Written
description: Our CCIE Security Written Exam Bootcamp is over 18 hours of intensive, hands-on, instructor-led training. The instructor will alternate between presenting material and guiding attendees through hands-on, real-world exercises. The goal of our Written Exam Course is to equip students with a foundation-level knowledge of Cisco Security technologies. The primary focus of the class is core concepts and topics found on the CCIE written exam.

title: Analyzing Azure Workload Requirements
description: This course is intended for Azure architects, developers, and administrators who need a deep understanding of analyzing Azure workload requirements to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-301 certification exam. This course covers requirements gathering, including compliance, identity, availability, capacity planning, security, and sizing; Resource consumption optimizing for infrastructure and platform services, and auditing and monitoring.

title: Wi-Fi Fundamental Principles
description: If you are venturing into the world of Wi-Fi for the first time, this course will expose you to some of the fundamental concepts surrounding this technology. You will learn such things as; what exactly is Radio Frequency and how can it encode data? What is modulation in the context of Wi-Fi, and what aspects of an RF signal can be modulated? You'll learn about the concept of Wi-Fi channels and how to design a network by implementing non-overlapping channels. You'll also learn about what an SSID is, and why it is a critical component to joining any Wi-Fi network.

title: Designing Data Solutions with the Azure Data Platform
description: This course is intended for Azure architects, developers, and administrators who need to design data solutions in Azure to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-301 certification exam. This course covers data management strategy, data protection strategy, data flow documentation, and data monitoring strategies.

title: Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) - Part II
description: The second part of the "Firepower Threat Defense (FTD)" series focuses primarily on more advanced features and policies of an FTD system. Other topics discussed in this course include supported VPN technologies and centralized administration.

title: Developing Azure Cloud and Storage Solutions
description: This course is intended for Azure Architects, developers, and administrators who need a deep understanding of developing applications that leverage Azure storage and scalability features to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-300 certification exam.  This course covers relational and non-relational data storage in Azure as well as messaging and application scaling in Azure.  Deploying and integrating Cosmos DB will be covered as will various relational databases as a service.  Scaling and pricing Azure SQL databases are covered in depth.  Scalability topics including various messaging options, autoscale, and scalable design are also covered.

title: AZ-300 Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies Review and Preparation
description: The Microsoft AZ-300 certification exam is one of two exams required for the prestigious Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert certification.  The AZ-300 exam focuses on the mastery of the services and resources available within the Azure cloud.  This course serves as a guideline for preparing for the AZ-300 exam.  The course includes an overview of the exam, tips on studying and taking the exam, and recommendations on what to focus on across all of the exam objectives.  This course is designed to tie into the INE Azure Architect learning path and be a guide through the content across the AZ-300 aligned courses in the learning path.

title: Building Applications and Securing Data in Azure
description: This course is intended for Azure Architects, developers, and administrators who need a deep understanding of Azure applications and security to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-300 certification exam. This course will cover Azure App Services, including web jobs and container-based web apps.  The course will also explore several container-based compute options. The course will also cover application authentication options with Azure as well as data encryption options.  The course content aligns with two objective domains in the AZ-300 exam: Create and deploy apps, and Implement authentication and secure data.

title: Implementing Azure Workloads and Security
description: This course is intended for Azure Architects, developers, and administrators who need a deep understanding of Azure workloads and security to further their career or in preparation for the AZ-300 certification exam.  This course will cover platform services such as Azure Web Apps as well as both relational and non-relational data services.  The scalability of Azure applications is covered, including auto-scale options and messaging platform services.  The course will also cover server-less compute options including Logic Apps and Function Apps.  The course includes a deep dive on Azure AD and multi-factor authentication (MFA) as well as authorization via role-based access control and policy.

title: Introduction to Multicast Routing for CCNP to CCIE Candidates
description: This course is those looking to learn the basics of IPv4 Multicast Routing, to bridge the gap from CCNP Routing & Switching to CCIE Routing & Switching, or for anyone preparing for the new Implementing and Operating Cisco Enterprise Network Core Technologies (ENCOR 300-401)

title: Advanced Identity Services Engine (ISE)
description: This course discusses some of the typical Identity Services Engine configurations deployed for modern access control. You will learn how to use ISE to distinguish between corporate and non-corporate assets, and how to share contextual information in your network for a truly integrated experience.

title: TrustSec
description: Learn how to protect your critical business assets with software-defined segmentation. Scalability, consistent policy enforcement, simplified provisioning and management of secure network access are just some of the benefits offered by Cisco TrustSec. This course discusses TrustSec in detail and explains how to implement, verify and troubleshoot this technology on different Cisco platforms.

title: Cisco CCIE Evolving Technologies v1.1
description: This course is designed to cover the new topics under the 'evolving technologies' part of the written blueprint on most of the new CCIE tracks. Being that this is across multiple tracks, this course is designed to cover the topics from the viewpoint of all the blueprints, not a particular track. For example, it will not cover SDN to the depth needed for the Data Center CCIE, however, it will be sufficient for Route Switch or Security. If your particular CCIE track covers these topics in greater depth, you will need additional training in addition to this course.
