description: This course covers IPsec with Pre-Shared Keys (PSK), including its interaction with DMVPN.

title: IPv6 First Hop Security vSeminar
description: IPv6 First Hop Security vSeminar

title: AI in the SOC
description: AI in the SOC explores how artificial intelligence is reshaping modern security operations. You'll dive into the ways AI enhances threat detection, streamlines incident response, and automates repetitive tasks in the Security Operations Center. Through practical examples, you'll learn how machine learning supports log analysis, behavioral analytics, and anomaly detection. By understanding and applying AI tools in real-world SOC environments, you'll gain the skills to work more efficiently, make faster decisions, and strengthen your defenses against evolving cyber threats. This course is scheduled to launch in Q1 2026.

title: Core Skills for SOC Analysts
description: Core Skills for SOC Analysts lays the foundation for success in a Security Operations Center by building the essential knowledge and abilities every analyst needs. You'll develop key competencies in log analysis, network traffic review, threat identification, and alert triage, along with a strong understanding of common security tools and workflows. The course also covers effective communication, teamwork, and documentation practices critical to SOC environments. By strengthening both your technical and analytical skills, you'll be well-prepared to perform confidently in entry-level SOC roles and support day-to-day security operations. This course is scheduled to launch in Q1 2026.

title: Phishing Mail Analysis for SOC Analysts
description: Phishing Mail Analysis for SOC Analysts is an essential course in the SOC Level 1 Learning Path, designed to help you recognize, analyze, and respond to phishing threats. You'll learn how to dissect suspicious emails, identify common phishing techniques, and trace indicators of compromise. This course focuses on practical analysis methods used in SOC environments, including header inspection, link evaluation, and payload examination. By developing a structured approach to phishing detection, you'll enhance your ability to protect users and contribute effectively to your organization's security posture. This course is scheduled to launch in Q1 2026.

title: SOC Logging & Analysis
description: SOC Logging & Analysis focuses on the critical role of logs in detecting and investigating security events within a Security Operations Center. You’ll learn how to collect, parse, and analyze logs from various sources, including endpoints, networks, and cloud environments. The course covers techniques for identifying anomalies, correlating events, and using SIEM platforms to surface meaningful insights. By developing a strong understanding of log data and its applications, you’ll gain the analytical skills needed to detect threats, support incident response, and enhance overall security visibility. This course is scheduled to launch in Q1 2026.

title: Malware Analysis for SOC Analysts
description: Malware Analysis for SOC Analysts is a foundational course within the SOC Level 1 Learning Path, designed to introduce security analysts to the core principles of malware analysis and detection. You'll explore how to identify, investigate, and understand malicious code commonly encountered in real-world environments. This course equips you with the practical skills needed to assess threats and contribute effectively to incident response efforts. By focusing on malware behavior, basic static and dynamic analysis techniques, and SOC-relevant use cases, you'll build the confidence and competence needed for day-to-day operations in a security operations center. This course is scheduled to launch in Q1 2026.

title: Security Operations Certified - Level 1
description: Start your journey with Security Operations Certified - Level 1, an essential learning path designed for aspiring cybersecurity professionals and entry-level SOC analysts. This path introduces you to the foundations of SOC operations, including core analyst skills and the tools and technologies commonly used in modern security environments. You’ll learn how to handle logging and analysis, detect and respond to incidents, work with SOC ticketing systems, and explore the growing role of AI in security operations. By mastering these topics, you’ll build the practical knowledge and technical confidence needed to thrive as a Level 1 SOC Analyst. All courses in this Learning Path will be available by March 3, 2026.

title: Junior Data Scientist (eJDS)
description: Jumpstart your journey into data science with this comprehensive path designed for aspiring junior data scientists. You'll build a strong foundation in Python programming, master data handling with libraries like NumPy and Pandas, and explore core concepts in databases, probability, and machine learning. Whether you're new to the field or brushing up on essential skills, this path guides you through every step, from writing Python scripts to building classification models.

title: Automating & Programming Cisco Enterprise Solutions (300-435 ENAUTO)
description: This learning path is designed to prepare you for the Cisco 300-435 Automating and Programming Cisco Enterprise Solutions v2.0 exam by guiding you through a progressive journey of network automation skills. You will begin with the foundations of network automation, where you will learn about OpenConfig, IETF, and native YANG models, understand how to use protocols such as NETCONF and RESTCONF, and practice building JSON and XML payloads. You will also become comfortable interpreting YANG module trees and working with tools such as YANG Suite and pyang. Once you have a solid foundation, you will move into device-level network automation, focusing on hands-on automation with Python libraries like Netmiko and ncclient, as well as RESTCONF and Ansible. Here you will practice device provisioning, explore Day Zero automation, and troubleshoot NETCONF, RESTCONF, and YANG-based solutions. You will also learn on-box automation methods such as Embedded Event Manager (EEM), Guest Shell, and on-box Python scripting. The path then progresses to controller-based network automation, which is the largest portion of the exam. You will explore Day Zero provisioning through controllers, and apply both Python and Ansible to configuration and monitoring tasks. You will also create advanced Jinja2 templates using loops, filters, and conditionals, and dive into automation of security policies, compliance, and segmentation. Additionally, you will strengthen your ability to troubleshoot REST API–based automation solutions. Next, you will expand into network operations automation. At this stage, you will use Cisco platform APIs to validate configurations, simulate topologies, and automate device software management. You will configure and monitor model-driven telemetry subscriptions on IOS XE devices through CLI, NETCONF, and RESTCONF, and set up webhook-based monitoring solutions to enhance operational visibility and health monitoring. Finally, the path introduces you to the emerging field of AI in automation. You will study how AI is integrated into controller-driven platforms, explore AI-assisted code development for network automation, and evaluate security risks associated with AI-based solutions. You will also practice building an MCP server using Python FastMCP to relay network information to AI agents. By following this structured path, you will gradually build expertise from foundational concepts through device and controller automation, operational use cases, and AI-driven innovations. This balanced approach ensures that you are prepared not only for the exam but also for real-world enterprise network automation challenges.     ⚠ Attention This course is designed for the CCNP Automation Concentration Exam: ENAUTO (300-435) launching as part of Cisco’s updated CCNP Automation certification track on February 3, 2026.

title: Designing Cisco Enterprise Networks (300-420 ENSLD)
description: Designing Cisco Enterprise Networks (300-420 ENSLD) is a focused learning path built to help you prepare for the CCNP Enterprise concentration exam. You’ll explore the core principles of network design through in-depth coverage of IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, enterprise routing with OSPF, EIGRP, BGP, and IS-IS, and key technologies like SD-Access, SD-WAN, MPLS, and VPNs. The course also includes switching design, QoS, multicast, and network automation with NETCONF and RESTCONF. By combining foundational design concepts with modern enterprise solutions and Cisco best practices, this path equips you with the knowledge and skills to pass the 300-420 ENSLD exam and design scalable, secure enterprise networks.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Enterprise concentration exam trainings, which also include: Implementing Cisco Enterprise Advanced Routing & Services (300-410 ENARSI) — view learning path

title: Implementing & Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE)
description: Implementing and Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE) is a comprehensive learning path built for professionals preparing for the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll start with an overview of the exam, then explore the fundamentals of Cisco Identity Services Engine, progressing into advanced ISE features and TrustSec capabilities. Hands-on labs will guide you through configuring secure access policies, managing endpoint services, and integrating identity-driven security into enterprise networks. Combining practical, real-world exercises with focused exam preparation, this path equips you with the expertise to pass the 300-715 SISE exam and deploy robust identity-based security solutions.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) — view learning path Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA) — view learning path Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA) — view learning path Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN) — view learning path Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO) — view learning path

title: Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA)
description: Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA) is a targeted learning path created for professionals pursuing the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll begin with an overview of the exam requirements before exploring the Cisco Email Security Appliance and its role in protecting enterprise communications. Hands-on labs will guide you through content security policies, filtering, and advanced threat protection to build practical, real-world skills. With a strong balance of exam preparation and applied learning, this path equips you to succeed on the 300-720 SESA exam while gaining the expertise to secure email systems against evolving threats.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) — view learning path Implementing and Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE) — view learning path Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA) — view learning path Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN) — view learning path Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO) — view learning path

title: Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA)
description: Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA) is a focused learning path designed to prepare you for the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll begin with an overview of the CCNP Security exams, then dive into web content security with a strong emphasis on Cisco’s Web Security Appliance. Through hands-on labs, you’ll explore advanced malware protection strategies and learn to configure and manage secure web gateways effectively. This path combines practical, real-world exercises with targeted exam preparation, equipping you with both the knowledge and skills to succeed on the 300-725 SWSA exam and strengthen enterprise web security.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) — view learning path Implementing and Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE) — view learning path Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA) — view learning path Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN) — view learning path Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO) — view learning path

title: Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN)
description: Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN) is a comprehensive learning path designed for professionals pursuing the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll start with an overview of the CCNP Security exams before building a strong foundation in cryptography and PKI. From there, you’ll gain hands-on experience configuring and troubleshooting IKEv1 IPsec VPNs, Dynamic Multipoint VPNs, Group Encrypted Transport VPNs, and secure connectivity solutions. With practical labs and real-world scenarios, this path not only prepares you for the 300-730 SVPN exam but also equips you with the skills to deploy secure VPN solutions in Cisco environments.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) — view learning path Implementing and Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE) — view learning path Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA) — view learning path Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA) — view learning path Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO) — view learning path

title: Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO)
description: Automating Cisco Security Solutions (300-735 SAUTO) is an in-depth learning path designed for IT professionals preparing for the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll begin with an overview of the CCNP Security exams before diving into network programmability foundations and automation techniques. Through hands-on labs and real-world scenarios, you’ll explore core concepts such as Python-based network automation and security-focused automation workflows. This path equips you with the practical skills needed to streamline and secure Cisco environments while preparing you for success on the 300-735 SAUTO exam.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) — view learning path Implementing and Configuring Cisco Identity Services Engine (300-715 SISE) — view learning path Securing Email with Cisco Secure Email Gateway (300-720 SESA) — view learning path Securing the Web with Cisco Secure Web Appliance (300-725 SWSA) — view learning path Implementing Secure Solutions with Virtual Private Networks (300-730 SVPN) — view learning path

title: Implementing Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (300-620 DCACI)
description: Implementing Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (300-620 DCACI) is a focused certification course designed for IT professionals preparing for the CCNP Data Center Concentration exam. This course covers the core concepts of Cisco ACI, including fabric discovery, policy-driven networking, and integration with external networks. You'll dive into ACI architecture, configuration, and troubleshooting using real-world scenarios and version 5 features. With a strong emphasis on exam preparation and review, this course equips you with the practical knowledge and confidence needed to pass the 300-620 DCACI exam and advance your data center expertise.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Data Center concentration exam trainings, which also include: Designing Cisco Data Center Infrastructure (300-610 DCID) — view learning path

title: Incident Handling & Response Professional (New!)
description:
Are you interested in learning how to professionally detect, analyze, and respond to real-world security incidents across modern enterprise environments? The Incident Handling & Response Professional Learning Path is designed to introduce you to the full incident response lifecycle and the daily operations of an incident responder, combining practical skills with real-world scenarios and tooling.

This learning path will teach you how to prepare for incidents through planning and readiness, detect and triage threats using SIEM and endpoint data, and apply threat intelligence and threat hunting techniques to uncover stealthy attacks. You will also learn how to perform digital forensics to support investigations and response actions. The Incident Handling & Response Professional Learning Path also prepares you for the eCIR exam and certification.

title: Mobile Application Penetration Testing Professional (New!)
description: This immersive and comprehensive learning path is designed for penetration testers and IT security professionals aiming to master mobile security. It covers a wide spectrum of topics, including Android and iOS platforms, application security, static and dynamic analysis, and the OWASP Mobile Top 10. You'll gain hands-on experience with advanced tools like Frida, IDA Pro, and Ghidra, while exploring real-world attack vectors such as reverse engineering, obfuscation bypass, and malware analysis. With advanced modules on hybrid apps and secure mobile app development, you’ll be fully prepared for the eMAPT exam and certification, ensuring your expertise stays current in the rapidly evolving mobile threat landscape.

title: Threat Hunting Professional (New!)
description: The Threat Hunting Professional Learning Path is an in-depth collection of courses designed for cybersecurity practitioners seeking to develop proactive defense strategies. You’ll start by building a strong core foundation with the fundamentals, then advance through intelligence integration and hunting strategies. You’ll explore both network and endpoint threats, which will give you the practical skills needed to identify threats across a diverse array of environments. You’ll also learn how to effectively document and report findings in a timely and organized manner for post-investigation evidence gathering. By the end of this learning path, you’ll be equipped to carry out threat hunts quickly, efficiently, and in a way that improves and enhances organizational security posture.

title: Devnet Professional CORE EXAM - DEVCOR (CCNP Automation - AUTOCOR)
description: This is a comprehensive learning path designed to prepare you for the 350-901 DEVCOR certification exam. This learning path delves into essential software development and design concepts, covering software architecture, development lifecycle models, testing, version control, and quality attributes. You’ll explore network APIs, their development, and integration, along with crucial application deployment, CI/CD pipelines, and security principles. Dive into infrastructure automation with topics like NETCONF, RESTCONF, model-driven telemetry, and open-source solutions, while mastering software configuration management and edge computing. Finally, gain hands-on knowledge of Cisco platforms including Webex, Firepower, Meraki, Intersight, UCS Manager, DNA Center, and AppDynamics.     ⚠ Attention Cisco has announced that the DevNet Professional certification will be renamed CCNP Automation , and the 350-901 DEVCOR exam will be renamed 350-901 AUTOCOR starting February 3, 2026. The current DEVCOR exam blueprint remains in effect until that date. This training fully prepares you for the current 350-901 DEVCOR exam, and will be updated to reflect the new certification title and blueprint topics in 2026.

title: CompTIA Network+
description: Start your journey with the CompTIA Network+ Learning Path, designed for beginners eager to build a solid foundation in networking. No prior networking experience is required—just basic computer skills and familiarity with common tech terms. This path covers essential networking concepts, IP routing, switching, VLANs, Wi-Fi fundamentals, network security, and troubleshooting. Through engaging video lessons, quizzes, and optional hands-on labs, you’ll develop the knowledge needed to understand, configure, and troubleshoot modern networks. Whether you're preparing for the CompTIA Network+ certification or starting a career in IT, this learning path will equip you with the core skills to succeed.

title: Advanced Web Application Penetration Testing (New!)
description: Embark on the Advanced Web Application Penetration Testing learning path, crafted for professionals seeking to master cutting-edge techniques in web security testing. You’ll begin with essential skills in reconnaissance, mapping, and automation, followed by rigorous training in authentication and session management testing. Dive into advanced injection attacks and API penetration testing, explore sophisticated filter evasion and WAF bypass methods, and gain expertise in server-side attack strategies. This comprehensive learning path provides the advanced skills needed to effectively assess and protect modern web applications against evolving threats.

title: Implementing Cisco Service Provider VPN Services (300-515 SPVI)
description: Embark on your path to mastering advanced networking and obtaining the CCNP Service Provider certification. This Learning Path includes the CCNP Service Provider Concentration Exam "Implementing Cisco Service Provider VPN Solutions" v1.1 (SPVI 300-515), which delves into VPN architecture, guiding you through the fundamentals of Layer 2 (L2VPN) and Layer 3 VPNs (L3VPN), and the intricacies of IPv6 VPNs. You'll gain critical skills in service provider technologies, enhancing your ability to design and implement scalable VPN solutions. This Learning Path is ideal for professionals pursuing the CCNP Service Provider certification, and engineers looking to equip themselves with the technical knowledge required to excel in modern service provider network environments.

title: Network Programmability & Automation
description:
Network Automation has steadily become one of the most crucial components in managing increasingly complex network environments. As businesses adopt more IoT devices, move more services to the cloud, and expand their operations, the demand for scalable, automated solutions has greatly intensified, making it a critical component of any modern IT infrastructure.

This Learning Path is designed to equip learners with the practical skills needed to meet the demands of today’s and tomorrow’s growing network automation solutions. Starting with an introduction to network programmability and automation, this path progresses through the fundamentals and advanced techniques of using Python for network automation, maintaining configuration consistency with Ansible, and exploring automation techniques for Cisco Enterprise, Security, and Data Center network solutions.

The Network Programmability and Automation Learning Path will help you skill up for your career and ensure that you remain relevant in the ever-evolving field of Network Automation.

title: Cybersecurity Associate (CCNA Cybersecurity)
description: The "Cisco Cybersecurity Associate" Learning Path offered by INE is meticulously crafted to prepare learners for the Cisco Cybersecurity Associate certification exam. The Learning Path is based on the detailed topics and domains outlined by Cisco, ensuring comprehensive coverage of essential cybersecurity concepts. These domains include Security Concepts, Security Monitoring, Host-based Analysis, Network Intrusion Analysis, and Security Policies and Procedures. Each of these domains is systematically broken down into specific subtopics, such as the CIA triad, threat intelligence, access control models, and incident response, among others. The Learning Path consists of a series of video-based courses complemented by online quizzes designed to reinforce the learner's understanding and retention of the material. By aligning the course content with the official exam objectives, INE ensures that learners gain the knowledge and skills necessary to detect, analyze, and respond to cybersecurity incidents effectively. Whether you are starting your cybersecurity journey or looking to validate your skills with a recognized certification, the "Cisco Cybersecurity Associate" Learning Path provides the foundation and practice needed to succeed in the certification exam and advance in the field of cybersecurity.     ⚠ Attention Cisco has announced that the Cisco Cybersecurity Associate (200-201 CBROPS) certification will be renamed to CCNA Cybersecurity (200-201 CCNACBR) starting February 3, 2026. This change only affects the naming convention—there are no exam topic changes from 200-201 CBROPS to 200-201 CCNACBR . Therefore, this training fully prepares you for both the current CyberOps Associate certification and the upcoming CCNA Cybersecurity certification exams.

title: DevNet Associate (CCNA Automation)
description: This comprehensive collection of courses is designed to prepare IT professionals for the Cisco DevNet Associate Exam v1.1 (DEVASC 200-901), and to guide them through the nuances of automating and optimizing network and security infrastructures, deploying applications with best practices in security, and leveraging Cisco's specialized tools for enhanced operational efficiency. Starting from the basics of network automation, learners will quickly become proficient in using both Linux and Windows environments for coding, while gaining a solid introduction to Python programming. The journey continues with an exploration into DevOps methodologies, emphasizing the deployment of applications with a security-first mindset. Participants will then dive deep into automating Cisco's networking and security solutions, including routers, switches, and the latest in enterprise solutions like SD-WAN, as well as data center technologies such as Nexus switches and ACI. The curriculum also covers automation in collaboration technologies, focusing on tools like Call Manager and WebEx, and concludes with a thorough examination of automating security protocols for Cisco's range of security solutions. Tailored for those looking to streamline network operations and enhance security measures, this series offers invaluable insights into making IT environments more efficient, secure, and scalable.     ⚠ Attention Cisco has announced that the DevNet Associate (DEVASC 200-901) certification will be renamed to CCNA Automation (CCNAAUTO v1.1 200-901) starting February 3, 2026. This change only affects the naming convention—there are no exam topic changes from DEVASC 200-901 to CCNAAUTO v1.1 200-901 . Therefore, this training fully prepares you for both the current DevNet Associate certification and the upcoming CCNA Automation certification exams.

title: Penetration Testing Professional
description: Dive into the realm of cybersecurity with our updated Penetration Testing Professional learning path, tailored for those aspiring to master the art of ethical hacking and secure IT systems. This immersive path equips you with the expertise to uncover and mitigate vulnerabilities across various platforms, from web applications to wireless networks, and cloud environments. Through a blend of theoretical knowledge and hands-on exercises, you'll navigate the complexities of system exploitation, privilege escalation, and active directory attacks, culminating in the skills necessary for the eCPPT certification. Whether you're advancing your career or stepping into the world of IT security, this learning path lays the foundation for becoming a proficient penetration tester in today's digital landscape.

title: Wireless Enterprise Networking
description: Unlock the potential of wireless enterprise networking with our comprehensive learning path. Designed for IT professionals and networking enthusiasts alike, this curated collection of on-demand video courses provides a deep dive into the intricacies of building, securing, and optimizing enterprise Wi-Fi networks. Delve into fundamental principles of Wi-Fi architecture, gain insights into enterprise-grade concepts and implementation strategies, and explore the nuances of traffic control and quality of service management. Whether you're a seasoned network administrator or just starting out, this learning path offers invaluable knowledge and practical skills to navigate the complexities of modern enterprise Wi-Fi environments. Elevate your expertise and stay ahead in the dynamic world of wireless networking.

title: CISSP: Certified Information Systems Security Professional
description: Certified Information System Security Professional (CISSP) is the most globally recognized certification in the information security market. In fact, many consider CISSP the gold standard for industry cyber and information security professionals to obtain because it certifies they have the breadth of knowledge, skills, and experience required to build, manage, and deliver the protections organizations require today. This course provides a review of the security concepts and industry best practices included in the CISSP Common Body of Knowledge across the following domains: Security and Risk Management, Asset Security, Security Architecture and Engineering, Communications and Network Security, Identity and Access Management (IAM), Security Assessment Testing, Security Operations, and Software Development Security. Once you successfully pass the certification exam, career advancement and higher earnings likely follow. Most importantly, becoming a CISSP professional guarantees to colleagues, peers, employers, and potential employers that you have the commitment and cyber competence to deliver architecture, design, management, and security controls that protect business environments.

title: CompTIA Security+
description:
CompTIA’s Security+ certification is a widely recognized, industry-standard certification aimed at entry-level Cyber Security practitioners.  This certification and learning path starts by introducing general Cyber Security topics and terms to get you familiar with fundamental security concepts.  From there, we go into various types of threats and vulnerabilities that security administrators are responsible for analyzing and mitigating.  In addition, you’ll learn how to properly architect a typical security infrastructure, including options for different security controls to better protect an organization's systems, infrastructure, and data.  Alongside that knowledge, you’ll also learn how to manage security controls, detect and manage vulnerabilities, and how to respond to an incident once it occurs.  To wrap everything up, we’ll take a look at risk management and compliance topics, including third-party assessments and audits.

The Security+ learning path is broken down according to the published Domains and Objectives from CompTIA. After completing this learning path, you’ll be armed with the knowledge to not only get started as a security administrator but also to successfully pass the Security+ exam.

title: Collaboration CORE Exam: 350-801 CLCOR
description:
Embark on a comprehensive learning journey to master the skills required for the Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Collaboration Core (CLCOR) exam with our thoughtfully curated learning path. The CCNP CLCOR exam is a key certification for professionals aspiring to demonstrate their expertise in advanced collaboration technologies, ensuring they can design, deploy, configure, and troubleshoot complex collaboration solutions. 

By following this learning path, you will acquire the knowledge needed to pass the CCNP CLCOR exam and gain practical skills that are directly applicable to real-world collaboration scenarios. Whether you are an experienced professional or just starting your journey in collaboration technologies, this learning path provides a structured and comprehensive approach to achieving CCNP Collaboration certification.

title: Cloud Networking for Network Professionals
description: INE has built the Cloud Networking for Network Professionals learning path to help our networking students build the skillset they need to transition to a hybrid-cloud environment. Enterprises are moving into a hybrid cloud environment, where workloads are hosted both on-premises and in the cloud. For enterprises that haven’t yet brought cloud computing into their environment, it is usually a question of when and not if. The move to a hybrid cloud means that many networking professionals need to develop cloud networking skill sets. This is evidenced by the addition of cloud concepts on the newest Cisco certifications, as well as job requirements in the marketplace. The learning path includes content from our platform, including introductory cloud concepts, basic cloud networking, advanced cloud networking, and connecting the on-premises environment to the cloud to provide a seamless network.

title: Web Application Penetration Testing Professional
description: Interested in learning how to assess and mitigate real-world web application vulnerabilities an organization could potentially be exposed to? The Web Application Penetration Testing Learning Path is a comprehensive and structured journey designed to equip aspiring penetration testers, Web App Security Professionals, Bug Bounty Hunters, and web developers with the essential skills and knowledge required to plan and perform a thorough and professional web application penetration test and how to effectively identify, exploit, and mitigate vulnerabilities in modern web applications.  The Web Application Penetration Tester Professional Learning Path provides you with all the advanced skills required to carry out a thorough and professional penetration test against modern web applications, as well as prepares you for the eWPTv2 exam and certification.

title: Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE)
description:
This learning path consolidates all INE’s Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE) content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!

The series focuses on security technologies and solutions supported by the Check Point's flagship next-generation firewall system. It covers all essential and fundamental concepts that are important for every Check Point Firewall Administrator, System/Support Engineer or Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE) student. Join Piotr Kaluzny, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of this track, including core topics, to Check-Point-Firewall-specific features and command-line usage. This training also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with the Check Point's CLI/GUI and its features utilizing the INE's Lab Task platform.

title: Enterprise CORE Exam: 350-401 ENCOR
description: INE offers a wide variety of courses and materials to help you pass your Cisco 350-401 ENCOR exam. This Learning Path is designed to help you logically navigate through our offerings so that you can most efficiently make use of your studying opportunities to achieve the CCNP Enterprise Certification.

title: Security CORE Exam: 350-701 SCOR
description:
This learning path consolidates all INE’s CCNP Security Core exam content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!

This series explains how to implement and operate core security technologies including network security, cloud security, content security, endpoint protection and detection, secure network access and visibility and enforcement on Cisco's flagship security products and appliances. It covers all essential and fundamental concepts that are important for every Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Security student. Join Piotr Kaluzny, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of this track, including fundamental topics, to Cisco-platform-specific features and command-line usage. This training also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with several Cisco products (CLI/GUI) and their features utilizing the INE's Lab Task platform.

title: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF)
description: Securing Networks with Cisco Firewalls (300-710 SNCF) is a focused learning path designed for IT professionals preparing for the CCNP Security concentration exam. You’ll begin with an overview of the CCNP Security exams before diving into Cisco’s Next Generation Firewall technology. Through structured modules on Firepower Threat Defense, you’ll develop practical skills in configuring, managing, and troubleshooting firewall solutions across enterprise networks. Hands-on labs provide real-world scenarios that strengthen your technical expertise while reinforcing key concepts. By combining applied practice with exam-focused learning, this path equips you to confidently pass the 300-710 SNCF exam and deploy advanced firewall protections.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Security concentration exam trainings, which also include:

title: Designing Cisco Data Center Infrastructure (300-610 DCID)
description: Designing Cisco Data Center Infrastructure (300-610 DCID) is a comprehensive certification course tailored for IT professionals aiming to pass the CCNP Data Center Concentration exam. This learning path explores the principles of data center network, compute, and storage design, focusing on scalable, resilient architectures that support enterprise needs. You’ll gain practical insight into designing modern data center infrastructure with an emphasis on integration, performance, and future-ready technologies. With targeted exam preparation and review woven throughout, this course equips you with the technical design skills and confidence needed to succeed on the 300-610 DCID exam.   Important Information This learning path is part of a broader set of Cisco CCNP Data Center concentration exam trainings, which also include: Implementing Cisco Application Centric Infrastructure (300-620 DCACI) — view learning path

title: Data Center CORE Exam: 350-601 DCCOR
description: This series is for Cisco Data Center Professionals and CCNP Data Center candidates alike, focusing on the design, implementation, verification, and troubleshooting of technologies such as Nexus NX-OS Ethernet Switching, Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI), Unified Computing System (UCS), and Storage Networking. This series will help you prepare for the newest 350-601 DCCOR v1.1 exam, which is part of the CCNP Data Center certification track.

title: Implementing Cisco Enterprise Advanced Routing & Services (300-410 ENARSI)
description: Implementing Cisco Enterprise Advanced Routing & Services (300-410 ENARSI) is a comprehensive learning path designed to prepare you for the ENARSI exam and help you earn your CCNP Enterprise certification. You’ll dive into advanced network-layer technologies, routing protocols like EIGRP, OSPF, and BGP, and key services such as VPNs, MPLS, and IPsec. The path also covers infrastructure security, IPv6 routing, and service-level monitoring tools like SNMP and NetFlow. With a strong focus on hands-on learning, the included practice labs reinforce real-world skills and exam readiness, giving you the confidence to pass the 300-410 exam and advance your networking career.

title: Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA)
description: This learning path consolidates all INE’s Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA) content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!The series focuses on security technologies and solutions supported by the Check Point's flagship next-generation firewall system. It covers all essential and fundamental concepts that are important for every Check Point Firewall Administrator, System/Support Engineer or Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA) student. Join Piotr Kaluzny, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of this track, including core topics, to Check-Point-Firewall-specific features and command-line usage. This training also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with the Check Point's CLI/GUI and its features utilizing the INE's Lab Task platform.

title: AWS Certified SysOps Administrator Associate
description:
The AWS Certified SysOps Administrator-Associate certification is a valuable credential that demonstrates your proficiency in managing and deploying AWS services. INE’s AWS Certified SysOps Administrator-Associate learning path is designed to help you pass this exam and become a more proficient SysOps administrator on AWS. The learning path comprises a series of lectures and hands-on modules that cover various aspects of AWS operations, including monitoring, logging, automation, and deployment. You will learn how to optimize AWS resources and enhance the overall performance of your AWS-based infrastructure. Additionally, you will better understand AWS security and compliance best practices, which are essential for ensuring the security and confidentiality of data stored in the cloud.

Becoming an AWS Certified SysOps Administrator-Associate will demonstrate your expertise in managing and deploying AWS-based workloads—a skill that employers value. You will also have the skills and knowledge to design and implement highly available, scalable, and fault-tolerant systems in AWS, which is essential for businesses looking to leverage the benefits of cloud computing. This learning path is ideal whether you are an experienced IT professional or just starting your career. So get started today on your journey to becoming an AWS Certified SysOps Administrator-Associate with INE today!

title: AZ-104: Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate
description: As a leading cloud provider, Azure is a critical component of the IT portfolio for many companies, governments, and organizations. Understanding how to administer cloud-based resources in Azure is an increasingly critical skill for infrastructure administrators. The Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate is Microsoft's certificate validating your proficiency in the day-to-day skills required for Azure administration. This learning path is designed to help infrastructure administrators reach proficiency in Azure. Azure administration covers a wide range of topics, thus this learning path will take you through many different services and technologies available in Azure. You will learn day-to-day administration and best practices around concepts such as security, performance, and cost management. Successfully completing this learning path will get you ready for the Azure Administrator certification exam., but more importantly, will give you the information you need to administer resources in Azure.     ⚠ Attention The AZ-900: Azure Fundamentals certification is the recommended prerequisite for this learning path. You can review the course and certification details here .

title: AWS Solutions Architect Associate
description:
The INE AWS Solutions Architect (SA) Associate Learning Path is designed to give you a strong understanding of cloud architecture and help you build the confidence and practical skills you need to architect solutions in AWS. It will also give you the knowledge and hands-on skills to prepare for the AWS SA-Associate Certification exam. But more than just helping you prepare for that exam, this learning path will show you how to architect and build secure, highly available, and evolvable solutions in AWS.

It includes many courses, such as AWS Networking, AWS Storage Services, Resiliency in AWS, and AWS Serverless Solutions. The courses include demonstrations and hands-on labs, where you’ll do things such as design and create VPCs with complex IP addressing schemes, deploy a complete serverless site monitoring solution, and more. Throughout the learning path, we provide you with real-world wisdom where you’ll come away understanding concepts such as IP addressing, why “Game Days” are critical to the success of an organization, and the realities of building complete solutions in AWS.

So join us today and get started learning from the team that’s expert at making you an expert.

title: Fortinet Network Security Expert
description:
This comprehensive learning path brings together INE’s complete Fortinet content into a single structured journey, guiding you to success with Fortinet’s flagship Next-Generation Firewall (NGFW) system—FortiGate. 

Designed for FortiGate Administrators, System/Support Engineers, and those pursuing Fortinet certifications — previously known as Network Security Expert (NSE) — such as FCF, FCA, FCP, FCSS, or FCX, this series covers both fundamental and advanced security concepts critical for managing and securing FortiGate environments.

Led by expert instructor Piotr Kaluzny, you’ll dive deep into key FortiGate-specific features, learning how to implement them through both the command-line interface (CLI) and graphical interface (GUI). These courses also offer integrated hands-on practice using INE’s lab platform, allowing you to gain experience with real-world FortiGate configurations and integrations with tools like FortiManager and FortiAnalyzer.

title: AZ-900: Azure Fundamentals
description: Cloud services in general, and Microsoft Azure in particular, are key components of the IT portfolio for many companies, governments, and organizations. It is increasingly important to understand fundamental Azure concepts for any IT professional, manager or director. The Microsoft Fundamentals certificate is a common starting point for professionals starting their cloud journey. This learning path is designed to help professionals understand Azure concepts and basic implementation. You will learn what cloud services are, what Azure is, how resources are managed in Azure, how resources are billed, and how Azure implements information security.

title: Enterprise Defense Administrator
description: Designed for professionals that are just starting their defensive cybersecurity or security engineering journey, this learning path will introduce you to all of the concepts and skills you'll need to succeed as a Defensive Security Engineer. Starting with an introduction to security engineering, and moving into more in-depth topics covering practical defensive engineering techniques and practices, this path will teach you the skills you need for a successful cybersecurity career. In addition, you will learn basic server and network hardening techniques, risk management strategies, how to properly design a secure architecture, and much more. With hands-on labs throughout, you're not just reading slides and studying - you get your hands dirty working with real-world scenarios.  This path will prepares learners for INE's eEDA certification.

title: Juniper JNCIS-ENT & JNCIP-ENT
description: This learning path consolidates all INE’s Juniper JNCIS-ENT and JNCIP-ENT content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on all JNCIS-ENT and JNCIP-ENT blueprint technologies as per Juniper's requirements. The series has all the ingredients required for you to pass the Juniper JNCIS-ENT JN0-349 exam and to pass the Juniper JNCIS-ENT JN0-648 exam. Join Rohit Pardasani, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of the new JNCIS-ENT and JNCIP-ENT track. This course also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with the Junos CLI and Juniper features utilizing INE's Lab Task platform.

title: Juniper JNCIA-SEC
description: This learning path consolidates all INE’s Juniper JNCIA-SEC content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on almost every JNCIA-SEC blueprint technology as per Juniper's requirements. The series has all the ingredients required for you to pass the Juniper JNCIA-SEC JN0-231 exam. Join Piotr Kaluzny, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of the new JNCIA-SEC track, including core topics to SRX-specific features and command-line usage. This course also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with the Junos OS CLI and Juniper SRX features utilizing INE's Lab Task platform.

title: Juniper JNCIA-Junos
description: This learning path consolidates all INE’s Juniper JNCIA-Junos content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on all JNCIA-Junos blueprint technologies as per Juniper's requirements. The series has all the ingredients required for you to pass the Juniper JUNCIA-Junos JNO-104 exam. Join Keith Bogart, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of the new JNCIA-Junos track, including core network topics to Juniper-specific features and command-line usage. This course also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with the Junos CLI and Juniper features utilizing INE's Lab Task platform.

title: Penetration Testing Student
description: The hardest thing you will ever do in cybersecurity is to land your first job. There are HR gateways, industry jargon, and companies unwilling to hire new talent. To help combat these challenges, we have built a hands-on training path focused on the necessary skills to start your career. The Penetration Testing Student Learning Path covers prerequisite topics introducing you to pentesting, information security, and programming. The learning path prepares you for an entry-level position within a red team, exposes you to bug bounty basics, and provides the skills and practice necessary for the eJPT certification exam. INE Security's Junior Penetration Tester exam (eJPT) validates that the individual has the knowledge and skills required to fulfill a role as an entry-level penetration tester. This certification covers Assessment Methodologies and Enterprise Auditing with Host, Network, and Web Application Penetration Testing. This exam is designed to be the first milestone certification for someone with little to no experience in cybersecurity, simulating the skills utilized during a real-world engagement. This exam truly shows you and your employer that you have what it takes to be part of a winning penetration testing team.

title: Cloud Foundations & Management (ICCA)
description: The cloud is increasingly becoming a central component in the way organizations conduct their business every day. This learning path is designed for IT professionals, managers, officers, sales, marketing, and support personnel who require a high-level understanding of cloud technologies. The information provided in this learning path addresses the essential knowledge and skills required for an individual to participate in a range of strategic activities and conversations necessary for the application of cloud technologies as a business solution. This learning path covers general concepts and foundational cloud skills for supporting public cloud platforms, including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.

title: Microsoft Azure DevOps Engineer Certification AZ-400
description: Dive deep into Azure DevOps through in-depth lectures, step-by-step guided video labs, and prepare for the Microsoft Azure DevOps Expert (AZ-400) certification exam.     ⚠ Attention The following certifications are the recommended prerequisites for this learning path: AZ-104: Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate — view details Azure Developer Associate (AZ-204) — view details

title: Getting Started in Networking
description: Networking is the core lifeblood of all business’s IT and has been our focus here at INE for over 15 years. The sample playlist below is a cross-section of our Networking content and our Expert Networking Instructors, so you can see firsthand how these videos can help you become an Expert in Networking as well.

title: First steps in Data Science with Python
description:
Data Science is one of the fastest growing disciplines in IT. It's a unique speciality that combines Programming, Mathematics (statistics, algebra, calculus), Data Analysis and management (SQL, storytelling) and Machine Learning.

As the fastest growing IT area, the demand for qualified experts is skyrocketing, with sites like Glassdoor, LinkedIn and Indeed listing it as one of the Most Wanted / Most Needed specializations for recruiters.

INE's Data Science approach is unique: our curriculum includes a combination of advanced videos with a hands-on approach using online coding exercises, hosted Jupyter Notebooks and Capstone projects. This first initial Learning Path is a quick overview of what Data Science is, and what you can expect to know by the end of your journey.

title: Microsoft 365 Security Administration
description:
This learning path is designed for Azure Security administrators that implement, manage, and monitor security and compliance solutions for Microsoft cloud and hybrid environments. Security administrators deal with threat management, perform investigations, and impose data governance. Planning and implementation of Azure security features are heavily covered in this course to assist with ensuring solutions comply with that of the administrator’s organization. Students taking this course should be
experienced with identity solutions and the protection of information from threats both inside and
outside of an organization.

title: Azure Developer Associate (AZ-204)
description: If you are an application developer, coder, software engineer, or are old enough like me to call yourself a programmer, you simply need to be ready to develop applications for the cloud. Whether you are developing applications that are hosted on virtual machines, or deployed via containers, or are designed to take advantage of cloud platform services; there is a good chance that your solutions will live in the cloud. This learning path gives you the knowledge you need to take best advantage of the Azure environment. The learning path covers the Azure compute environment, cloud storage, application security, system integration, and instrumentation. This learning path aligns with Microsoft exam AZ-204, which is the sole requirement for the Microsoft Certified Azure Developer Associate certification.     ⚠ Attention The AZ-900: Azure Fundamentals certification is the recommended prerequisite for this learning path. You can review the course and certification details here .

title: Exploit Development Student
description: If you are looking for the most practical way into the exploit development and software security world look no further. The Exploit Development Student Learning Path provides not only the fundamentals of Windows and Linux exploit development but also covers advanced Windows and Linux exploit development techniques, as well as anti-exploit mechanism bypasses. Learning path at a glance: -Based on techniques professional exploit developers use -Thoroughly covers fundamental as well as advanced exploitation techniques -Software debugging -Shellcoding -Covers both Windows and Linux exploit development -Methodology on how to identify and fully exploit 0-day vulnerabilities -Covers bypassing modern anti-exploit mechanisms -Learn how to use tools like Immunity Debugger, x32dbg, Mona, Pwntools, GDB, Ropper, etc.

title: Advanced Penetration Testing
description: The Advanced Penetration Testing Learning Path provides all the advanced skills required to carry out a thorough and professional penetration test against modern networks and infrastructure, such as the ability to execute state-sponsored-like operations and advanced adversary simulations. You must be familiar with PowerShell scripting, Active Directory administration and Windows internals knowledge, basic reverse engineering skills, and possess a good working knowledge of network protocols, as the content dives into all stages of a red-teaming engagement. Learning path at a glance: -Implementation details on numerous undocumented attacks -Obscure ways of exploitation and backdooring -Advanced client-side exploitation techniques -Custom attack vector and payload creation -Custom payload creation techniques -In-depth analysis of Active Directory exploitation -Stealthy lateral movement and evasion against modern defenses -In-depth analysis of critical domain infrastructure exploitation -In-depth details of common misconfigurations and weaknesses -Details for covert operations and stealthy persistence

title: Digital Forensics Professional
description: Have you ever wanted to learn how to perform digital forensics activities after an intrusion? The Digital Forensics Professional Learning Path will teach you how to identify and gather digital evidence as well as retrieve and analyze data from both the wire and endpoints. The Digital Forensics Professional Learning Path also prepares you for the eCDFP exam and certification. This course is part of the Digital Forensics Professional Learning path which prepares you for the eCDFP exam and certification Learning path at a glance: -Learn how to acquire volatile and non-volatile data, using various techniques -Dive into the structure of files and then, analyze file headers, malicious documents, and file metadata -Become familiar with walking through partitions, recovering corrupted disks, and locating hidden data -Learn how to analyze both FAT & NTFS file systems -Get familiar with file carving and creating your own custom carving signatures -Learn how to analyze the Windows registry, LNK files, prefetch files, and previously mounted USB devices -Learn how to perform thorough investigations, against Skype, explorer's shellbags, and Windows recycle bin -Become proficient in forensically investigating network attacks

title: Malware Analysis Professional
description: Are you interested in dissecting malicious software in order to understand its mechanics and purpose? The Malware Analysis Professional Learning Path provides a holistic approach to reverse engineering and analyzing all aspects of malware. During the learning process, you will come across realistic and even real-world malware such as ransomware, botnets, and rats, against which you will perform reverse engineering, static analysis, and dynamic analysis activities. Learning path at a glance: -Learn about IA-32 CPU Architecture -Entire module dedicated to x64 bit assembly -Practical display and dive into the TLS method -Understand how malware uses Windows APIs to achieve their malicious activity -Understand and bypass Anti-Reversing techniques -Perform full manual unpacking on packed executables -Debug samples using different debuggers -Learn different methods to locate the important algorithms

title: Web Defense Professional
description: Have you ever wondered about how web applications are attacked in the real world and what you can do to mitigate every attack? The Web Defense Professional Learning Path will illustrate exactly how each attack works, what the impact of each attack is, how to fix it, and how the exploit no longer works after the fix. This learning path will also give you in-depth, practical advice about how to simplify your defense and how to implement attack mitigations that actually work (regardless of you having access to the source code or not). Learning path at a glance: -Close the gap between Web application attack and defense -Mitigation advice for multiple platforms and languages -The most comprehensive and practical coverage of the OWASP Testing Guide -Comprehensively aligned to OWASP methodologies, tools, and tests -Covers and goes beyond OWASP TOP 10 -Detailed techniques and methodology to simplify the defense of web applications -No boring theory: practice-oriented curriculum -Over 20 different lab scenarios to practice with -Advanced usage of OWASP ZAP, OWASP OWTF, ModSecurity... -Coverage of OWASP Cheat Sheets, OWASP OpenSAMM, OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set

title: Reverse Engineering Professional
description: Are you looking to gain the theoretical and practical knowledge required to perform advanced reverse engineering of third-party software and malware on the assembly language level? The Reverse Engineering Professional Learning Path will teach you several methods to identify, isolate, and finally, analyze portions of code which are of high interest, as well as the most common Windows APIs utilized for file, memory, and registry manipulation by either software protections (such as packers) or malware. During the learning process, you will also get insights into the most common anti-reversing tricks, including different code obfuscation methods, and how to bypass them. Learning path at a glance: -Start from the basics up to highly technical chapters -Learn about IA-32 CPU Architecture -Learn about functions, stack frames, heaps, exceptions, important Ring3 Windows internal structures, PE file format -Master ImmunityDBG -Learn about important Ring3 Windows Internal Structures -Learn different methods to locate the important algorithms -Understand and bypass Anti-Reversing techniques -Perform full manual unpacking on packed executables -Practice-based course with dozens of guided exercises -Challenge your mind with hardcore technical topics

title: Service Provider CORE Exam: 350-501 SPCOR
description: This learning path consolidates all INE’s CCNP Service Provider content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on all basic and advanced blueprint technologies as per the new curriculum. The series has all the ingredients required for you to pass the CCNP Service Provider exam. Join Rohit Pardasani, CCIEx5 # 21282, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of the new CCNP Service Provider track.

title: Palo Alto Networks Firewall
description: This path will provide learners with the knowledge and tools required to successfully build and maintain Palo Alto Next-Generation Firewall solutions. This will include coverage of the Palo Alto platform architecture, firewall administration and maintenance, configuration of policies, related technologies, and more. This Learning Path also consolidates all INE's video courses related to Palo Alto Networks technical certifications into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!

title: Microsoft 365 Teams Admin
description:
With the ever-changing information technology landscape, many Microsoft solutions are moving to the cloud with Office 365 and Azure. Coworkers are requiring more ways of connecting and sharing their information and data to achieve a common goal. Microsoft Teams is the next step in the evolution of Skype for Business where users function together in a collective workspace where they can chat, create and host meetings, share files, and automate their workflows.

This learning path has been designed for someone looking to achieve an Administrator role working with Microsoft Teams. Teams Administrators will be required to plan, configure, deploy, and troubleshoot workloads within Office 365 and Microsoft Teams.

This learning path covers planning and configuring Microsoft Teams environments, managing chat and calling features, and managing teams and app policies.

title: Python Data Scientist
description: Your journey to become an expert Python Data Scientist begins here.

title: Azure Security Engineer Associate (AZ-500)
description: IT environments require rock-solid security solutions. This is true whether they are on-premises, in the cloud, a combination of both. Azure, as a leading cloud platform, has a thorough portfolio of security features and solutions. The Microsoft Certified: Azure Security Engineer Associate verifies practitioners' ability to implement security in Azure. This learning path prepares you for the AZ-500 exam and provides the information required to effectively implement secure workloads in Azure. The learning path covers a wide spectrum of Azure security topics including identity management, platform protection, security operations, data security, and application security.     ⚠ Attention The AZ-104: Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate certification is the recommended prerequisite for this learning path. You can review the course and certification details here .

title: Azure Solutions Architect Expert (AZ-303 & AZ-304)
description: As a leading cloud provider, Azure is a critical component of the IT portfolio for many companies, governments, and organizations. Architecting solutions that run optimally in Azure requires a deep working knowledge of a wide range of resources and services. The Microsoft Certified Azure Solution Architect Expert is Microsoft's premier certificate validating your proficiency in designing solutions that run in Azure. This learning path is designed to help you develop expertise in a wide range of skills including infrastructure design and implementation; diagnostics monitoring and auditing, identity, authentication, and security; application services; data services; and business continuity. Successfully completing this learning path will get you ready for the Azure Architect certification exams, but more importantly, it will give you the information you need to effectively design solutions in Azure.     ⚠ Attention The AZ-104: Microsoft Certified Azure Administrator Associate certification is the recommended prerequisite for this learning path. You can review the course and certification details here .

title: CCIE Data Center
description: This Learning Path is designed to help candidates prepare for Cisco’s CCIE Data Center certification exam and is aligned with Cisco’s latest v3.1 blueprint updates. This path will equip learners with the skills required to plan, design, deploy, operate, and optimize complex Cisco-based Data Center networks at an expert level. Key topics covered in this Learning Path include Classical Layer 2 Switching on Cisco Nexus NX-OS, Virtual Port-Channels (vPC), Layer 3 Routing with EIGRP, OSPF, IS-IS, and BGP on NX-OS, Layer 3 Multicast Routing on NX-OS, VXLAN and BGP EVPN on NX-OS, Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI), the Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS), Storage Networking (SAN), Data Center Security, Data Center Quality of Service (QoS), and Data Center Automation with the Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller (NDFC), and more. What’s New in v3.1? Enhanced focus on VXLAN EVPN multi-site and multi-pod deployment models with both ACI and the Nexus Dashboard Updated ACI coverage reflecting Cisco’s new feature sets Expanded programmability and automation sections, including Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller (NDFC) integration This series is led by industry-renowned instructor Brian McGahan, CCIEx4 #8593 (Routing & Switching, Data Center, Security, Service Provider), CCDE #2013::13 (Design), where Brian’s expert guidance helps bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and real-world deployment challenges. For more information on using virtual vs. physical hardware for lab practice, see Brian's blog post on Building Your Ultimate CCIE Data Center v3.1 Lab: A Complete Guide

title: CCIE Collaboration
description:
This Learning Path consolidates all INE's CCIE Collaboration v3.1 content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on all basic and advanced v3.1 blueprint technologies as well as discusses other topics you'll need to know to pass the exam, such as hardware platforms, software features, and more.

Join Rohit Pardasani, CCIEx5 #21282, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of the new CCIE Collaboration track, including Expressway, CMS, API Calls, conferencing between Jabber and IP phone endpoints, multi-cluster call routing, SIP URI dialing from IP phones and Jabber, IM and Presence, globalized dial plans and SIP normalization with both CUBE and native Lua scripting in CUCM, and much more.

title: CCIE Security
description:
This learning path consolidates all INE’s CCIE Security v6.1 exam content into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!

This series explains how to plan, design, deploy, operate, and optimize network security solutions on Cisco's flagship security products and appliances. It covers all fundamental and advanced concepts that are important for every Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE) Security student. Join Piotr Kaluzny, for an in-depth look at every technical aspect of this track, including fundamental topics, to Cisco-platform-specific features and command-line usage. This training also provides the opportunity to gain hands-on practice with several Cisco products (CLI/GUI) and their features utilizing the INE's Lab Task platform.

title: CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure
description: The most complete solution available anywhere, INE’s CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure v1.1 Learning Path has every resource you need to prepare for Cisco’s latest version of the CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure Lab Exam. From Ethernet Switching & IPv4/IPv6 Routing to SD-Access, SD-WAN, & Network Automation, this Learning Path consolidates all of our CCIE Enterprise Infrastructure resources into a single trackable path you can follow to your success!

title: CCNA 200-301
description: INE offers a wide variety of courses and materials to help you pass your Cisco 200-301 CCNA v1.1 Certification Exam. This Learning Path is designed to help you logically navigate through our offerings so that you can most efficiently make use of your studying opportunities.

title: CCIE Service Provider
description:
INE offers a wide variety of courses and materials to help you pass your CCIE Service Provider v5.1 Lab Exam. This Learning Path is designed to help you logically navigate through our offerings so that you can most efficiently make use of your studying opportunities to achieve the CCNP SP or CCIE SP Certification.

This Learning Path consolidates all INE's CCIE SP v5.1 video courses into a single trackable path you can follow to your success! The series focuses on all basic and advanced v5.1 blueprint technologies, such as Core IPv4 & IPv6 IGP & BGP Routing, MPLS L2VPN & L3VPN, MPLS Traffic Engineering & Segment Routing, as well as discusses other topics you'll need to know to pass the exam, such as Lab Exam Strategy.

This series is intended for Enterprise and Service Provider Professionals, and anyone looking to obtain their CCIE SP certification with the current CCIE SP v5.1 exam blueprint.

title: Firewall Essentials: Configuration and Management
description: Designed to help students configure and manage the essential features of Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls.

title: Firewall: Troubleshooting
description: Designed to help students understand how to troubleshoot the full line of Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls.

title: Panorama: NGFW Management
description: Designed to help students gain in-depth knowledge about configuring and managing Next-Generation Firewalls using the Palo Alto Networks Panorama management server.

title: Panorama: Centralized Network Security Administration
description: Designed to help students gain an introduction to configuring and managing Next-Generation Firewalls and Prisma Access using the Palo Alto Networks Panorama management server.

title: Prisma SD-WAN: Design and Operation
description: Designed to help students learn how to design, implement, and effectively operate a Prisma SD-WAN solution.

title: Prisma Access SSE: Configuration and Deployment
description: Designed to help students with the operational deployment of Prisma Access Secure Access Service Edge (SASE).

title: Prisma Access Browser
description: Designed to enable students to deploy, configure, maintain, and troubleshoot Prisma Access Browser using Strata Cloud Manager.

title: Cortex XDR: Investigation and Analysis
description: Designed to enable cybersecurity professionals, particularly those in SOC/CERT/CSIRT and Security Analysts roles, to use Cortex XDR.

title: Cortex XDR: Security Operations and Integration
description: Designed to enable cybersecurity professionals, particularly those in SOC/CERT/CSIRT and engineering roles, to use Cortex XDR.

title: Cortex XSOAR: Engineering Security Automation Solutions
description: Designed to enable students to integrate their existing security tools with Cortex XSOAR 8 to streamline security processes, accelerate security outcomes, and automate manual security-oriented tasks.

title: Cortex XSIAM: Investigation and Analysis
description: Designed to enable cybersecurity professionals, particularly those in SOC/CERT/CSIRT and Security Analysts roles, to use Cortex XSIAM.

title: Cortex XSIAM: Security Operations, Integration, and Automation
description: Designed to enable cybersecurity professionals, particularly those in SOC/CERT/CSIRT and engineering roles, to use Cortex XSIAM.

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cybersecurity Apprentice (PCCSA)
description: Validates foundational knowledge and understanding of networking and cybersecurity concepts.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate foundational knowledge and understanding of cybersecurity concepts, those who want to transition into a cybersecurity career, and other technical and non-technical IT professionals

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cybersecurity Practitioner (PCCSP)
description: Validates knowledge and understanding of cybersecurity concepts and the skills required for basic application of the Palo Alto Networks portfolio of solutions and related technologies.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate knowledge, understanding, and the basic application skills related to cybersecurity technologies and solutions

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Professional (PCNSP)
description: Validates knowledge and understanding of all products and services included in the Palo Alto Networks network security solution and entry-level maintenance, configuration, installation, and deployment of these products.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of network security, including the implementation and administration of Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Firewalls and SASE technologies

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Analyst (PCNSA)
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required of analysts and administrators in the areas of object configuration, policy creation, and centralized management using Strata Cloud Manager (SCM).
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in the configuration of firewalls and subscriptions, as well as in management and operations in a network security environment

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Next-Generation Firewall Engineer (PCNGE)
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for engineers and administrators in deployment, networking and device setting configuration, integration and automation, and centralized management using Panorama, templates, and rulesets.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in PAN-OS networking and device configuration, and in integration and automation in a network security environment

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified SD-WAN Engineer
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for engineers to plan, deploy, configure, operate, monitor, and troubleshoot modern SD-WAN environments and architectures.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in deploying and managing both standalone SD-WAN and integrated SD-WAN for SASE solutions

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Security Service Edge Engineer (PCSSE)
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for engineers to deploy, configure, manage, and troubleshoot security service edge (SSE) environments.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in security service edge (SSE) / secure access service edge (SASE) deployments

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Architect (PCNSA-Architect)
description: Validates the skills and experience required of network security architects to understand technical and business requirements and architect secure, highly available, and scalable systems with Palo Alto Networks network security portfolio solutions.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate skills and experience with architecting for Zero Trust across the network security portfolio

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Security Operations Professional (PCCSP-SOC)
description: Validates knowledge, understanding, and the job-ready skills required for basic application of the Palo Alto Networks Cortex portfolio of solutions and related technologies in a Security Operations Center (SOC).
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate knowledge, understanding, and the job-ready skills required for basic application of Palo Alto Networks Cortex products and solutions in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cortex XSIAM Analyst
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required to use the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XSIAM platform for automation, threat detection, and threat response.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate the knowledge and skills required to use the Cortex XSIAM platform—including those who want to advance their SecOps analyst career

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cortex XDR Analyst
description: Validates the job-ready skills required to demonstrate understanding of the basic architecture, components, and operation of Cortex XDR.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in Cortex XDR deployments in a security operations center (SOC)

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cortex XSIAM Engineer
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for engineers to deploy, configure, manage, onboard data, and create playbooks in a security operations environment using Cortex XSIAM.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in Cortex XSIAM deployments in security operations centers

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cortex XDR Engineer
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for engineers to deploy, configure, manage, onboard data, and create playbooks in a security operations environment using Cortex XDR.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in Cortex XDR deployments in security operations centers

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cortex XSOAR Engineer
description: Validates the knowledge and skills required for skilled engineers to deploy, configure, manage, integrate, and troubleshoot Cortex XSOAR solutions in security operations environments.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in Cortex XSOAR deployments and automation in security operations environments

title: Palo Alto Networks Certified Cloud Security Professional (PCCSP-Cloud)
description: Validates the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary for securing cloud environments with the Cortex Cloud platform, including Cloud Runtime Security, Application Security, Cloud Posture Security, and SOC processes.
notes: Target audience: Individuals who want to demonstrate technical knowledge and skills in the Cortex Cloud platform, Cloud Runtime Security, Application Security, Cloud Posture Security, and SOC processes
